description: To the Editor:

title: Ponce de Len, Exposed
description: MIAMI

title: Immigrants in Solitary
description: Americans who are unfamiliar with the immigration justice system might be surprised to learn how much it skimps on actual justice. The notion of a fair day in court becomes only theoretical when immigrants lack attorneys, as most do, when their deportation cases are not reviewed by judges, as too often happens, and when they are locked up in prisons unable to see their families, even though they have been accused only of civil violations  and many have never been convicted of anything.

title: Cyprus Was Not an Exception
description: The recent crisis in Cyprus has highlighted the curious and dangerous phenomenon of banking systems that are much bigger than the economies in which they are based. One reason the government of Cyprus struggled to deal with its failing banks was that their assets were seven times as big as the countrys economy.

title: Freedom Loses One
description: I dont think weve paused sufficiently to celebrate the wonderful recent defeat for the cause of personal freedom. After all, these sorts of defeats dont happen every day.

title: When TV Takes Its Time
description: If you havent caught Top of the Lake, a cryptic mini-series on the Sundance Channel right now, you owe yourself a peek, if only to behold and savor Holly Hunter, whose character is a mash-up of Pocahontas, the oracle at Delphi and Cousin Itt from The Addams Family. Shes all hair, her silvery mane accounting for easily half of her body weight and seemingly destined to sweep the ground. Perhaps when the character isnt providing terse counsel to the damaged women around her at an odd spiritual retreat, she moonlights as a broom.

title: A Better Way to Reunite Lost Items With Owners
description: ON a business trip a few months ago, I lost a little electronic device called a Fitbit that hooks onto a belt, measures physical activity and keeps daily records online.

title: In Washington, Abortion Debate Counters Trend
description: OLYMPIA, Wash.  The legality or availability of abortion is under challenge from North Dakota to Arkansas this spring as conservative state legislatures throw down roadblocks. But here in this corner of the Far West, winds may blow the other way.

title: American Airlines Settles Suit Against Orbitz
description: FORT WORTH (AP)  American Airlines said Monday that it had settled lawsuits with the online travel agency Orbitz over the agencys display of information about American flights and fares.

title: A Setback for Resellers of Digital Products
description: A federal judge in New York has dealt a blow to the nascent business of reselling digital goods like music and e-books, ruling that a small companys secondary market for digital music infringes on the copyrights controlled by record companies.

title: Marrying Out of the Faith
description: Back in 1963, my brother Ron was going out with (that was the phrase then) an Irish Catholic girl named Ann who was attending the University of Rhode Island. One day, she was sitting in class and suddenly through the window she saw my father, who, it turned out, had tracked her down by finding out from the university administration what classes she was taking and at what times. He took her to dinner and then proceeded to tell her that it would ruin his sons life if he were to marry a non-Jewish girl. He then asked if she would be willing to have no contact with Ron for a year; in return, he offered to pay all her expenses during that time. She refused.

title: A Slice of London So Exclusive Even the Owners Are Visitors
description: LONDON  An odd thing was happening, or rather not happening, as dusk fell the other day across Belgravia, home to some of the worlds most valuable real estate: almost no one seemed to be coming home. Perhaps half the windows were dark.

title: Sometimes, Its Better Not to Know Whats Coming
description: WHEN I moved to the United States, I started flying cross-country quite a bit. I used to work in San Francisco and fly to New York for my company, Goodby Silverstein & Partners, and now I head up our New York office and fly back to San Francisco a lot. I enjoy business travel, or I guess I learned to enjoy it. I can work or catch up on all the episodes of Homeland that I missed.

title: Mergers Slowed to a Snails Pace in the First Quarter, the Fewest Since 2003
description: Deal makers may want to keep the Champagne bottles on ice a while longer.

title: When Fury Can Be a Force for Good Ends
description: Michael R. Bloomberg can grow easily irritated, and he minces fewer words the closer he gets to the end of his near-infinite mayoralty.

title: Elwin Wilson, Who Apologized for Racist Acts, Dies at 76
description: Elwin Wilson, a former supporter of the Ku Klux Klan who made repeated apologies late in life for racist acts he committed decades earlier  including the bloody beating of a civil rights worker who later became a member of Congress  died on Thursday at a hospital in South Carolina. He was 76.

title: American Woman Gang-Raped and Beaten on Brazilian Transit Van
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  An American woman was raped by three men aboard a public van in a six-hour abduction over the weekend that began in the seaside district of Copacabana, the police said.

title: Whys That Taxi on the Stairs? Youre in Odessa
description: ODESSA, Ukraine  Starting early in the morning, men of widely varying physical types began collecting around the Magic Bar, which had been set up in central Odessa at a height of about eight feet. It looked easy: Pay your $2.50, hang on for two minutes and walk away with $40.

title: Sprawling County in Texas Seeks Clues to Prosecutors Deaths
description: KAUFMAN, Tex.  To scan the crime blotter of this largely rural county is to get a snapshot of life in small-town Texas.

title: Investor Activism Gone Wild
description: William Ackman, the investor-activist who runs the $12 billion hedge fund, Pershing Square Capital, is like one of those guys you used to see in a certain kind of old-fashioned comedy. On one shoulder sits an angel, encouraging his better nature. On the other sits a devil, whispering temptation.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 1, 2013

title: A $25 Million Question Over a Bid for Dell
description: Is Stephen Schwarzmans Blackstone Group really bidding for Dell? Or is it part of a bizarre, high-stakes charade?

title: A Final Shock in the Final Four
description: In this, the strangest of college basketball seasons, the makeup of the four teams left in the N.C.A.A. mens tournament seems almost scripted, in a perfectly nonscripted sort of way.

title: On the Montana Range, Efforts to Restore Bison Meet Resistance
description: HELENA, Mont.  Free-roaming wild bison, once vital to the history, culture and ecology of the high plains and then hunted nearly to oblivion, are back at the center of a new debate as they compete with cattle for space on Montanas vast grasslands.

title: Lawrence McKiver, a Singer in Long Tradition, Dies at 97
description: Lawrence McKiver, a founder and the longtime lead singer of the McIntosh County Shouters, a Georgia group representing the last community in America to perform the traditional ring shout  a centuries-old black form of ecstatic worship that marries singing, percussion and movement  died on March 25 on St. Simons Island, Ga. He was 97.

title: Japan Shifts From Pacifism as Anxiety in Region Rises
description: SAN CLEMENTE ISLAND, Calif.  The Japanese soldiers in camouflage face paint and full combat gear were dropped by American helicopters onto this treeless, hilly island, and moved quickly to recapture it from an imaginary invader. To secure their victory, they called on a nearby United States warship to pound the enemy with gunfire that exploded in deafening thunderclaps.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, Apr. 2, 2013
description: "What Im proud of is that all of us, Republicans and Democrats, understood that some issues, and this one particularly, should rise above politics.

title: Mets Meet Their Own Expectations
description: The rain came to Citi Field after the game, as the Mets players changed into their suits and ties for the teams homecoming dinner. The wind whipped garbage around the outfield, below the blank scoreboards. Three blissful hours of baseball already seemed like a dream.

title: Old-School Newsman, After Deadline
description: If love were really all you need, Nora Ephrons Lucky Guy would be the best show of the season, hands down. This fast-moving ink- and tear-stained portrait of the tabloid columnist Mike McAlary opened Monday night at the Broadhurst Theater, floating on a fathoms-deep reservoir of affection and good will, the likes of which back-stabbing Broadway seldom sees.

title: Preaching to the Choir
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Well, you knew it was going to happen, and here it is. A puzzle about the newly-elected PONTIFF, POPE FRANCIS, by Ian Livengood.

title: Real Estate Brokers Predict a Tough Time for Buyers
description: With inventory at near-record lows and prices inching up, all signs are pointing toward a sellers market for Manhattan real estate this spring.

title: Bike Tour Files Suit to Avoid Traffic Fees
description: Weeks before the start of New York Citys largest bicycling tour, its organizers filed suit on Monday to avoid nearly $1 million in fees for traffic control by the New York Police Department.

title: Uncertainty Is Yet Another Newcomer for Yankees
description: On his sixth opening day as manager of the Yankees, Joe Girardi said the advice he gave his many new players  which could easily have been to continue wearing name tags around the clubhouse  was to just be who you are.

title: Ralph Klein, 70, Politician in Alberta Oil Boom, Dies
description: Ralph Klein, a rambunctious Canadian politician who helped bring the 1988 Winter Olympics to Calgary as the citys mayor and then, as premier of petroleum-drenched Alberta for 14 years, spurred development of the provinces massive oil sands deposits, died on Friday in Calgary. He was 70.

title: Rare Choice for Opener: Yankees or Mets?
description: There were perhaps a few hundred feet of unity in Grand Central Terminal on Monday, stretching from the subway entrance on East 42nd Street and Park Avenue to the trains bound for competing boroughs.

description: With the Rangers coming off two disheartening shutout losses, Ryan Callahan said that he and his teammates simply needed a take a deep breath  and get a few timely goals  to restore their confidence.

description: President Obama on Tuesday will announce a broad new research initiative, starting with $100 million in 2014, to invent and refine new technologies to understand the human brain, senior administration officials said Monday.

description: The Knicks eight-game winning streak is similar to their quick start in November and early December.

title: North Korea: Not Crazy but Very Misunderstood
description: BEIJING  It seems scary, even crazy: talk of a sea of fire and an arc of destruction, nuclear missiles slamming into distant shores. North Korea, an isolated state, as were constantly told by media reports, hurls invective at the world while its people, abused, hungry and cold, are led by an apparently well-fed young man, Kim Jong-un, who sits in front of shabby-looking computers running nuclear programs that are going, literally, ballistic.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 2:15 P.M. (HBO) INTOLERABLE CRUELTY (2003) George Clooney, with his chiseled chin and blazing-white teeth, plays Miles Massey, the crme de la crme of Los Angeles divorce lawyers, in this film from Joel and Ethan Coen. Catherine Zeta-Jones, above with Mr. Clooney, is Marylin, a silken beauty and Miless latest client, who becomes mired in a vicious divorce after she catches her adulterous husband (Edward Herrmann) cheating yet again. Billy Bob Thornton is her Texas millionaire beau and Miless chief rival for her money-hungry affections. She may be a victim, but shes no innocent. The Coens, bless their hearts, are too smart to apologize for avarice  its what gave screwball comedies a kick and sends this movie straight to your head, Elvis Mitchell wrote in The New York Times. Keep in mind that its only a minor rush, but a rush nonetheless. He added: It has a Jell-O-shot smoothness that makes you a little dizzy afterward in recollecting how assured and unremittingly smart Intolerable Cruelty is. The second word in the title is a little too apt; this movie should pack a license to kill.

title: Opening Day, a Ritual of Shared Optimism
description: Baseballs opening day is the best day in sports.

description: NBCs two late-night stars, Jay Leno and Jimmy Fallon, who have said nothing publicly about the rumors of a potential changing of the hosting guard at the Tonight show, got together Monday night to perform a rather romantic music video commentary on their much-publicized situation.

title: IHT Quick Read: April 2
description: NEWS Outdoor air pollution contributed to 1.2 million premature deaths in China in 2010, nearly 40 percent of the global total, according to a new summary of data from a scientific study on leading causes of death worldwide. Edward Wong reports from Beijing.

title: North Korea Says It Will Restart Reactor to Expand Arsenal
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea announced plans on Tuesday to restart a mothballed nuclear reactor, the latest in a series of provocations by its leader, Kim Jong-un, to elicit a muted response from American officials, who believe they can wait out Mr. Kims threats until he realizes his belligerent behavior will not force South Korea or the United States into making any concessions.

title: Glencore Extends Deadline for Xstrata Takeover
description: LONDON  The commodities trader Glencore Internationals acquisition of the mining company Xstrata will have to wait a little longer.

description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article Its Back. But What Does It Mean?

title: Growing Concern That Too Many Children Are Receiving A.D.H.D. Diagnosis
description: In A.D.H.D. Seen in 11% of U.S. Children as Diagnoses Rise, Alan Schwarz and Sarah Cohen write about a growing concern that that too many children are receiving a diagnosis of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

title: Photography in the Docket, as Evidence
description: On a cool spring day at the beginning of the Bosnian war in 1992, Ron Haviv watched Serbian paramilitary soldiers pull a middle-aged Muslim couple from their home in Bijeljina. Shots rang out, and although members of the Arkan Tigers militia had warned him not to take photographs, Mr. Haviv stepped behind a truck and squeezed off a few frames.

title: Do You Think Child Stars Have It Rough?
description: The public spectacle of child stars self destructing is almost clichd. Think Britney Spears in her 20s, or the continuing struggles of Lindsay Lohan. But whats really going on?

title: Lean In, Dad
description: I happen to be an educated young woman who loves her job, sometimes gushingly, occasionally annoyingly. And yet, even in this enlightened age, Ive had two relationships end  at least in large part  thanks to that clammy-palmed discussion in which couples plot hypothetical milestones and life goals. The gentlemen in question said that, somewhere in our semicharted future, they expected me to quit my job. At least for a couple of years, anyway, in order to be the kind of hypothetical mother they wanted to raise their hypothetical kids, if that hypothetical day ever came.

title: Anti-Rape Law Means India Needs More Female Cops
description: NEW DELHI  Who will rape such an old woman? asked a senior police officer in Uttar Pradesh last month, responding to a rape complaint by a 35-year-old mother of four.

description: After a stellar career as a quarterback at Michigan, Denard Robinson hopes to make his mark in the N.F.L. as a multidimensional player after a nerve injury to his throwing arm last October.

description: PARIS  While the euro zone has been transfixed lately by the Cyprus meltdown, another and potentially bigger European crisis has continued to simmer: record-high unemployment.

description: Just as April showers are supposed to bring May flowers, the many upfront presentations scheduled this month  wooing marketers and agencies before the start of the 2013-14 television season  are bringing complementary advertising efforts intended to reinforce those pitches.

title: A Flamboyant Taunt by a Fellow Gay Student: How a Mother Can Help
description: Every other Tuesday,  Steven Petrow, the author of Steven Petrows Complete Gay & Lesbian Manners, (Workman, 2011), addresses questions about gay and straight etiquette for a boomer-age audience.  Send questions for Civil Behavior to stevenpetrow@earthlink.net.

title: A Start-Up Fund That Lets College Students Make the Decisions
description: Most college dormitories are a mixture of unmade beds, fireproof carpeting, beer pong, ramen noodles and that poster of John Belushi in Animal House. Investors want to add two more ingredients: successful start-ups and budding venture capitalists.

title: Parking Rules
description: Because of the eighth day of Passover, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Tuesday. Other regulations remain in effect.

description: BEIJING  A Tibetan activist whose long, harsh detention by Chinese authorities drew international scrutiny has been freed after serving 17 years in prison, exile groups reported on Tuesday.

description: LONDON  Although predictions are risky, heres one I offer with absolute confidence: Traffic jams will return to Nairobi this week.

description: The Blackstone Groups interest in Dell seems to raise more questions than it answers, especially in light of Dells 274-page proxy filing about the process of selling the company. Is Blackstone really bidding for Dell? Or is it part of a bizarre, high-stakes charade? Andrew Ross Sorkin asks in the DealBook column.

title: Lawmakers in New York Tied to Bribery Plot in Mayor Race
description: The two men sat in the state senators parked car in suburban Rockland County, but New York City was at the front of their minds and the focus of their conversation.

description: Spell-check cant replace the keen eyes of an experienced editor.

title: In Performance: Hands on a Hardbody
description: Hands on a Hardbody, a new Broadway musical at the Brooks Atkinson Theater, concerns a group of Texans vying to win a truck in an endurance test. The country-rock score was written by Trey Anastasio, of the jam-band Phish, and Amanda Green, who also wrote the lyrics. (Doug Wright wrote the book.) In this excerpt Mr. Anastasio, on guitar, accompanies the actors Allison Case and Jay Armstrong Johnson in Im Gone.

title: Incentives for Men, to Help Women to Work
description: As I wrote in an article appearing this week in The New York Times Magazine, if you want women to be bigger participants in the labor force, some expansion of work-life accommodations (parental leave, flex work, telecommuting, etc.) is probably desirable, particularly relative to the barren landscape of work-life policies in the United States.

title: Martin Scorsese Argues For Film Preservation in 2013 Jefferson Lecture
description: Drawing upon films that included Orson Welless Citizen Kane, Alfred Hitchcocks Vertigo and Thomas Edisons short of two cats engaged in a boxing match, Martin Scorsese made the case on Monday evening that Americans need to take pride in our cinema, our great American art form and that all films need to be preserved, regardless of their box-office performance or apparent cultural merit.

title: $14 Million SAC Settlement Is Approved
description: On the same day prosecutors announced insider trading charges against a former portfolio manager at the hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors, a judge signed off on a civil settlement between the fund and regulators related to the same set of facts.

title: Cyprus Chief of Finance Quits Post
description: Michalis Sarris, the Cypriot finance minister who negotiated Cypruss bailout agreement with international creditors, resigned on Tuesday, citing the beginning of a government inquiry into the collapse of the countrys banking industry.

title: Good Enough to Eat | Pieces of Porcelain
description: Just in time for all things springlike, the latest collection in the Pieces of Porcelain line from the Australian studio Mod Collective is available from Gretel Home. Mod Collectives founder, the ceramicist Valissa Butterworth, combines digital design and hand-molding and casting to make these hard-to-resist bowls, plates and cups. She colors them with raw pigment, a process that allows her to use bold hues as well as delicate ones, and which ensures that even if a piece chips, you still see color all the way through. The exteriors are left unglazed, while a clear gloss glaze is used on the inside of the pieces to make them safe for food. Prices for the collection range from $32 to $149.

title: Colorado Looks to Its Own People to Burnish Its Image
description: Colorado is taking a nontraditional approach to the usual efforts of creating ads that are meant to help burnish the brand image of a state. With an initiative  Making Colorado  to be announced on Tuesday, the state will ask its residents for advice that will shape the development of a campaign that is to be introduced in August.

title: Mustard Fails Security Test at the Airport
description: Dear Diary,

title: Could Verizons Best Friend Be Its Biggest Rival?
description: For years, Verizon and Vodafone have confronted a problem: what to do with Verizon Wireless, which they both own nearly equally?

title: March Auto Sales Increased 3.4% for Highest Total Since 2007
description: DETROIT  Automakers reported on Tuesday that March sales of new cars and trucks were the highest monthly total in five years, providing more evidence of a sustained turnaround in the industry.

title: Who Has the Most Exclusive Backstage Pass?
description: This past weekends article about the Yeah Yeah Yeahs features portraits by Robert Maxwell. But for a more candid look at the band, we asked the guitarist Nick Zinner to send us some of his most recent pictures of the groups performances and travels. Zinners photography has been exhibited in art galleries and collected in four monographs. I asked him a few questions about his work.

title: After Running S.E.C., Schapiro Becomes Bank Consultant
description: After more than three decades of policing Wall Street, Mary L. Schapiro is going to work for some if its biggest players.

title: The Debate Over Welfare Reform in Britain  and Even France
description: LONDON  Iain Duncan Smith, a millionaire minister in Britains Conservative-led coalition government, was evidently tempting fate when he claimed this week that he could live on the equivalent of $11.50 a day.

title: Daily Report: Pressured by China, Apple Apologizes for Warranty Policies
description: Apples chief executive, Tim Cook, took the unusual step on Monday of apologizing to Chinese customers over the companys warranty policy and said he would improve customer service in the country, David Barboza and Nick Wingfield report in Tuesdays New York Times.

title: Grand St., an Online Boutique for Electronics, Raises $1.3 Million
description: Often, the new must-have gadget is not something you can pick up at Best Buy or find on Amazon. It is something you find on a site like Kickstarter, or a product produced by a small start-up company.

title: What Were Reading
description: The Atlantic: Your house is still overrun with Peeps. Heres another use for them: Infuse them with vodka.  Maria Newman

title: Leading Off: The Dodgers Hollywood Opening
description: As opening day dawned bright and full of hope almost everywhere except the Bronx, there was occasion for hope in so many places. The Nationals opened at home looking for all the world like the next superstar team. The Braves have launched a whole era by uniting the Upton brothers. Seattles Felix Hernandez pitched so well, people stopped minding that he needs a Brinks truck to bring home his new paycheck. And while New York slumped at the sight of the Yankees geriatric era, the Mets tried to inject a ray or two of sunshine by thinking almost aloud, Hey, we might not be totally terrible!

title: Cinematic Head Start on Istanbul Art Biennial
description: ISTANBUL  The 13th Istanbul Biennial  whose title theme is Mom, am I Barbarian?  doesnt officially open until Sept. 14. But you can get a leap on the curator Fulya Erdemcis views on the public versus private spheres, civility versus violence, and utopian societies by going to the movies this week.

title: A Building Not Just Green, but Practically Self-Sustaining
description: SEATTLE  When an office building here that bills itself as the worlds greenest officially opens later this month, it will present itself as a living building zoo, with docents leading tours and smartphone-wielding tourists able to scan bar codes to learn about the artfully exposed mechanical and electrical systems.

title: Opening a Gateway for Girls to Enter the Computer Field
description: WHEN Julia Geist was asked to draw a picture of a computer scientist last year, the 16-year-old sketched a businessman wearing glasses and a tie. Looking around at her classmates drawings, she saw similar depictions of men.

title: Jack Pardee, a Star at Texas A&M and an N.F.L. Coach, Dies at 76
description: Jack Pardee, a survivor of Coach Bear Bryants merciless Junction Boys training camp at Texas A&M who went on to become an All-Pro linebacker and a coach of the year in the N.F.L., died on Monday in suburban Denver. He was 76.

title: The Complaint Against Smith, Malcolm, Et Al.
description: Read the full formal complaint against State Senator Malcolm A. Smith, City Councilman Daniel J. Halloran III, et al.

title: The Gun Report: April 2, 2013
description: Take a look at the second shooting in todays Gun Report. A toddler gets a hold of a loaded gun and kills himself. I keep coming back to this particular kind of shooting: children killed or maimed after finding a loaded gun. Not only because they are so heartbreaking, but because they are so preventable. I wrote a column 11 days ago about the possibility of childproofing guns. Not surprisingly, gun absolutists find this idea appalling.

title: Why So Few Women Reach the Executive Rank
description: Here is a puzzle. If the bulk of studies show that women are a net plus to corporate America, why are they still a small minority on Wall Street and in the executive suite?

title: Subaru Recalls 215,000 Outbacks and Legacies for Corrosion in Brake Lines
description: 12:26 p.m. | Updated Subaru is recalling at least 215,000 of its most popular models  the 2005-9 Outback wagon and Legacy sedan  because of corrosion of the brake lines, the automaker says.

title: The Man Behind Mad Men Is Back: Matthew Weiner Talks Season 6
description: LOS ANGELES  With every ad campaign won or lost by Sterling Cooper Draper Pryce, every whiskey swigged, every cigarette smoked and every errant lipstick stain that turns up on the wrong collar, Mad Men draws nearer to its end. That AMC period drama begins its second to last season on Sunday with a two-hour premiere. As audiences prepare to get reacquainted with Don Draper, the enigmatic executive played by Jon Hamm, and his colleagues and family, Matthew Weiner, the Mad Men creator and show runner, isnt taking any victory laps.

title: Block Party
description: Come spring, not everyone wants to wear flowery prints and Breton stripes. The solution? Cubism!

title: The Mumbai/New York Photo Project: Education Heroes
description: Mumbai and New York may both be the financial capitals of their respective countries and home to vibrant economies, but the cities have struggled since their birth with persistent social inequity.

title: North Korea Heightens Nuclear Tensions
description: The countrys leadership strives to gain leverage in its escalating standoff with the United States and its allies.

title: Keeping an Eye on Savings Account Transfers
description: Back in January, I fulfilled a New Years resolution by setting up automatic online transfers for my childrens weekly allowances. So far, so good  or, so I thought.

title: Chipping Away at the Glass Ceiling in Private Equity
description: The clubby, male-dominated world of private equity prompted a lot of name-calling in the late 1980s. Barbarians. Raiders. Vultures.

title: Israel Says Its Tanks Responded to Shots Fired From Syrian Side
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli military said Tuesday night that its tanks had fired into Syria in response to shots fired from the Syrian side at an Israeli Army jeep in the Israeli-held Golan Heights, adding that the shells hit their target. Earlier that day, the Israeli military said, a mortar shell from Syria sailed over the Israeli-Syrian cease-fire line and crashed into an open field.

title: Palestinians Jailed in Israel Protest After Inmate Dies
description: JERUSALEM  Hundreds of Palestinian prisoners staged protests in Israeli jails on Tuesday as the Palestinian leadership accused Israel of deliberately delaying the treatment of a fellow prisoner who died that morning of cancer.

title: Marriage, Procreation and Historical Amnesia
description: Not surprisingly, my Sunday column raising the possibility that the successes of the gay marriage movement might be having some modest influence on marriages overall decline left liberals (and many others) unpersuaded. Kevin Drum has a usefully representative rebuttal, whose three major points I think Ill take up in separate posts. Heres the first, which dismisses the idea that the push for same-sex marriage has tended to weaken the legal and cultural connection between marriage and procreation by  blaming social conservatives for injecting that supposed connection into the debate in the first place:

title: Americas Pastime, Behind Bars
description: Civil War prisons were terrible places: captured solders suffered and died by the thousands from malnutrition, disease and exposure to the elements. But in several Northern and Southern prisons, a few fortunate inmates were able to enjoy, for a moment, a lighter side of life: baseball.

title: Rockwood Music Hall Starts a Record Label
description: For the last eight years, Ken Rockwood has served as an impresario and a mentor for scores of New York bands, giving them shows on the two stages at his Rockwood Music Hall on the Lower East Side. Now he says he is taking the next step: he has started a record label.

title: A Global Mission to Fight Sexual Violence Against Women
description: WASHINGTON  Just as the pressing call for an end to violence against women resounds around the world, it is also making itself heard here in Washington.

title: One Size Fits None
description: In todays Business Insider, Joe Weisenthal reports on Europes truly dismal PMIs (survey-based indexes that act as early-warning indicators for official economic data). Theres no doubt at all that the continent is falling deeper into recession, even in the core countries. And reading this news reminds me of something Ive been meaning to write  namely, that discussions of Europes troubles, and the debate over austerity, often suffer from a tendency to blur two somewhat different issues.

title: U.N. Treaty Is First Aimed at Regulating Global Arms Sales
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations General Assembly voted overwhelmingly on Tuesday to approve a pioneering treaty aimed at regulating the enormous global trade in conventional weapons, for the first time linking sales to the human rights records of the buyers.

title: A Plan to Simplify the Tax Code That May Be Too Simple
description: Did anyone else notice the elephant in the living room?

title: That Falling Feeling
description: This has been a nasty winter for those of us afraid of falling. Recently, having left my dog alone far longer than expected, the call of nature required I take him out immediately on returning home  after yet another March snow. He is big, I am small, and in his urgency he yanked me down the unshoveled and unsalted porch steps. That was fall No. 1.

title: Kindergarten Redshirting Gets Tougher in N.Y.C., With Repercussions
description: We redshirted our son last year, and Im so glad we did.

title: Final: Bayern 2, Juventus 0; P.S.G. 2, Barcelona 2
description: The Goal blog provided updates and live analysis of Tuesdays UEFA Champions League quarterfinal matches: Barcelona at Paris St.-Germain and Juventus at Bayern Munich. Read on for updates, photos and video highlights.

title: Easter Postscript: What to Do With Ham Stock
description: Cooks who tried our braise-roast technique  on an Easter ham this year may now have quarts of tasty stock on hand. It freezes well until you figure out how best to use it.

title: A Virtual Tour of the Observation Deck
description: A virtual tour, based on renderings, of the World Trade Center Observation Deck.

title: Staying Independent Is Not Much of an Option for MetroPCS
description: MetroPCS owners should forget about a stand-alone option. The dissident investors John A. Paulson and Peter M. Schoenfeld persuaded two proxy services that the cellphone operator was selling out on the cheap to a rival, T-Mobile USA, and that independence was a better option. While the agitating may bring a sweeter bid, MetroPCS is unlikely to prosper or exist for long on its own.

title: Jack-booted Insurance-bringing Thugs
description: Jonathan Chait and Aaron Carroll both have fun with Elizabeth Cheneys bonkers op-ed about how Obamacare will destroy our freedom.

title: Double Dose on Opening Day Warms the Soul
description: Two opening days in the same town did not sound kosher.

title: World Nomads Arts Festival to Focus on Tunisia
description: This years World Nomads Festival, presented in May by the French Institute Alliance Franaise, will focus on the culture of Tunisia, where artists played a crucial role in overthrowing the countrys authoritarian government in January 2011. Those street protests ignited demonstrations in other nations and helped usher in the Arab Spring. Marie-Monique Steckel, the president of Alliance Franaise, said that the festival, which runs from May 3  June 1, will feature some of the phenomenal artistic creativity that has emerged on the heels of the Arab Spring. There will be art, film, photography and dance shows, an ideas forum, and a Tunisian craft market. Performing alongside his Tunisian-born father, Tsvi Bokaer, the dancer and choreographer Jonah Bokaer will present the United States premiere of The Ulysses Syndrome. Some of the countrys best-known artists, including Sonia MBarek, Ghalia Benali, Emel Mathlouthi, will also be performing. For more information, go to www.fiaf.org.

title: G.O.P. and Democratic Senators Back Gay Marriage
description: Two more senators, one from each party, announced their support for same-sex marriage on Tuesday. Their shifts appear to mark 50 votes to legalize such unions in the Senate.

title: Rigging New York Citys Mayoral Race?
description: The Timess Michael Barbaro on how the arrest of two lawmakers and a half-dozen other politicians could shake up New Yorks Republican Party.

title: The Envelope Please: Sush Krishnamoorthy
description: Sush Krishnamoorthy, a student in New Delhi who is applying to universities in the United States, lists the resources that helped her navigate the college admissions process from afar.

title: Cano Fires Agent and Signs With Jay-Zs Agency
description: When Robinson Cano rejected the offer of a substantial contract extension from the Yankees before spring training, he was still being represented by Scott Boras, baseballs most formidable and challenging negotiator. It is Boras, after all, who consistently takes big-name players to free agency so they can obtain every last penny possible in a new contract.

title: Acceptance Rates, Apparently, Are Poor Predictors of Getting In
description: Early in the college application process, I classified colleges as dream schools and reach schools based on their acceptance rates. It is popular advice to do so. Also, the terms selectivity and acceptance rate are often used interchangeably, and this indicated to me that the higher the acceptance rate of a college, the easier it is to get in.

title: A NASA Hangout on Rising Seas and Global Warming
description: 2:11 p.m. | Updated |Earlier today, I participated in a NASA Google+ Hangout on Air on these questions and more:

title: Comparing the Worlds Glass Ceilings
description: One of the more surprising things I learned in my research for an article in The New York Times Magazine is that despite all the complaints about the glass ceiling, the United States is actually doing a relatively good job of getting women into high-achieving jobs.

title: Finding a Coder When You Dont Know How to Code
description: When I first entered the start-up world, I found the landscape tricky to navigate especially as a nontechnical founder of a technology company. How could the founder of a tech start-up not know anything more than HTML? How was I going to hire the right people with the right skills to build the lines of code I needed if I didnt understand what I was looking for?

title: Report Sees Guns as Path to Safety in Schools
description: WASHINGTON  With the Senate set to debate gun control this month, a National Rifle Association task force released a 225-page report on Tuesday that called for armed police officers, security guards or staff members in every American school, and urged states to loosen gun restrictions to allow trained teachers and administrators to carry weapons.

title: Feeling For | Bright Lights
description: Im just mad for these candylicious resin lamps by the London-based designer Marianna Kennedy. They come in eye-popping colors like deep sea green or chrome yellow, and at about $600 each (with shade) are relatively affordable, unlike the lacquered gueridon tables and gilded mercury mirrors in Kennedys gallery-quality collection. The conical shades are made from antique book cloth, most of which Kennedy sources from Paris. Isnt it funny, she says, you just have to say it comes from Paris and it sounds irresistible.

title: U.S. Soccer Celebrates 100 Years
description: U.S. Soccer is coming home  to New York  to celebrate the 100th anniversary of its founding on April 5, 1913.

title: Prepare for Launch with Angry Birds
description: Angry Birds, the popular video game that involves catapulting birds at fortresses constructed by enemy pigs, now has a greater purpose than killing time at the checkout line. Its the subject of a 4,485-square-foot exhibit at the Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex in Florida that is meant to teach children physics.

title: A Beach Vacation, Lizard-Style
description: Jonathan Losos, professor and curator of herpetology at Harvards Museum of Comparative Zoology, writes from Colombia, where he is studying the biodiversity of anole lizards, an evolutionarily successful group that has produced 400 species throughout Central and South America and the Caribbean islands. For more on anoles, see anoleannals.org.

title: Cat Ticket Sales Fall Short of Recouping Costs
description: The Broadway revival of Cat on a Hot Tin Roof, starring Scarlett Johansson as Maggie the Cat, fell short of recouping its $3.6 million capitalization before ending its 15-week run on Saturday, a spokeswoman for the show said on Monday.

title: Its an April Fools Day Spoof, but Its Not a Joke
description: Monday was a really funny and sad day on the Internet.

title: James and Wade Will Sit Out Against Knicks
description: The Miami Heat entered Tuesday 11 games ahead of the Knicks in the Eastern Conference. The standings make it clear the Heat, the defending champions, and the Knicks are not equals at this point late in the regular season. The Knicks are still fighting for their playoff seeding, while Miami long ago locked up the No. 1 spot and has the luxury of resting players after winning 29 of the last 30 games.

title: Motorsports: Larry Dixon Uninjured in Dragster Spinout
description: Larry Dixon escaped injury in a terrifying Top Fuel dragster mishap Friday, at an exhibition in Queensland, Australia.

title: A Law Firm Stands Out for Its Work, Not Its Gender Makeup
description: As Harvard Law School classmates in the mid-1980s, Susan E. Brune and Hillary Richard dreamed about one day starting their own law firm.

title: Unfamiliar Feelings in a Familiar Land
description: When I first set foot at Baghdad International Airport in March 2010 to work for The New York Times, I was no stranger to Iraq. Until 2003, Baghdad had been my home. I still had family and friends here, and they remained dear to me, and I to them.

title: Women Lead the Way in White-Collar Law
description: Its still a mans world in many sectors of the legal profession, as it is in much of corporate America. Its true for prosecutors, for white-collar defense partners at major firms and in executive suites. But when it comes to researching and being an authoritative voice of study about white-collar crime, women are taking the lead.

title: Breaking It Down: Williams vs. Sharapova
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Serena Williams is from another planet.

title: A Huge Parking Bill, but Its Also a Huge Space
description: By the end of the week, Roman Abramovichs latest bill for parking in New York City will reach $100,000. And by the time his ship sails, the tab could exceed $150,000.

title: Hanjan
description: Inside a Korean restaurant that infuses traditional dishes with new ideas.

title: China Announces 4 New Bird Flu Cases
description: SHANGHAI  China said Tuesday that four more people in the coastal part of the country had been infected with a new strain of bird flu, which is believed to have killed two Shanghai residents last month and left one person in critical condition.

title: Women in a Mans World
description: Irene Dorner blames herself  and her female colleagues  for the lack of women on Wall Street.

title: Law Firm Partner Accused of Sexual Harassment Fires Back
description: A law firm partner who was sued last month, accused of sexual harassment, fired back on Tuesday at the junior lawyer who brought the case, contending that she fabricated her claims and was obsessed with him.

title: John J. Gumperz, Linguist of Cultural Interchange, Dies at 91
description: The conflict hinged on a single word: gravy.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Action on the Climate
Splitting the Difference
description: The pajeon at Hanjan did not look like any Korean pancake Id ever seen. It appeared to be a casual pile of squid tempura interlaced with a few splinters of fried green stuff, but I took a knife to it and quartered it anyway. Amazingly, the gold loops and strands held together as they traveled from the dish of spicy dipping sauce to my mouth.

title: Press Conference by N.R.A. Task Force
description: The National Rifle Association proposes a plan to train and arm security guards at every school in the nation.

title: A $100 Weekend in Boston
description: Philadelphia might claim Benjamin Franklin as its own, but I can think of two ways hes more closely tied to Boston. First, he grew up there. Second, I just spent a weekend in Boston for the value of the bill that bears his portrait.

title: HBO Orders Fourth Season of Game of Thrones
description: George R. R. Martin, it will soon be time to put down your remote control and pick up your pen (or get behind your computer keyboard), because HBO will have need for more of your narrative content. The cable network said on Tuesday that it had officially ordered a fourth season of Game of Thrones, its epic fantasy series created by David Benioff and D. B. Weiss, and adapted from Mr. Martins best-selling Song of Ice and Fire novels. This announcement comes two days after the third-season premiere of Game of Thrones, which set ratings records for that series, drawing 4.4 million viewers first episode and exceeding the 4.2 million viewers who watched the initial broadcast of its second-season finale last June. HBO said that Game of Thrones had an average gross audience (including showings on the network as well as plays on DVRs and digital services like HBO Go) of 11.6 million viewers in Season 2.

title: The Roving Runner: Elevating the Jog
description: No smoking, dog-walking, biking, skating or scooting.

title: Coffees to Go, and Make One Suspended
description: A while back, I wrote about how I was pleasantly surprised to receive a free coffee at a bagel shop drive-through, during Random Acts of Kindness week. The customer in front of me paid for my order before driving away.

title: The N.R.A.s Useless Advice
description: Paging through the new National Rifle Association report on improving school security, I stopped short at a photograph illustrating how profoundly depressing that document really is.

title: A Polished Past and Polite People
description: When Meghan Fedor opened her mailbox recently, she found a brown paper bag with a length of green ribbon enclosed, along with a note explaining that a local high school girl was undergoing treatment for lymphoma and that the ribbons could serve as a show of support. Within days, some 150 homes in Ms. Fedors Basking Ridge neighborhood had ribbons waving from mailboxes and lamp posts. Its this kind of neighborly act, said Ms. Fedor, who commutes to a job at the Environmental Protection Agency in New York three days a week, that has had her marveling since she moved here almost two years ago.

title: Living In Basking Ridge, N.J.
description: Open tracts, a friendly downtown and a rich history characterize the commutable town.

title: Night, Night, Little Headset
description: The Jabra Motion is a wireless headset that knows when its nap time.

title: Is It Too Classy for Pancakes?
description: DOVER PLAINS, N.Y.  In Robb Turners telling, it all sounds so inevitable, as if maybe the same thing could happen to you. You would buy some land, discover it dense with maple trees and decide to tap them for syrup. Your product would so intrigue the sommelier at Per Se that he would leave his job to sell it for you. One of New Yorks most celebrated chefs would design the kitchen for an all-maple cafe at your new sugarhouse.

title: N.R.A. Unveils Plan to Arm School Guards
description: The Timess Sheryl Gay Stolberg discusses a new proposal commissioned by the National Rifle Association to place trained guards in American schools.

title: The Inside Scoop on Your Insides
description: The Timess Quentin Hardy talks with Mary Roach about her new book, Gulp: Adventures on the Alimentary Canal.

title: Untangling Two New York Corruption Cases
description: Diagrams showing how the arrested officials are linked.

title: Closing a Gender Gap: A Computer Science Immersion Program Aimed at Girls
description: Girls Who Code is among a recent crop of programs aiming to close the gender gap in technology by intervening early, when girls and young women are deciding what they want to study.

title: For Albany, Yet Another Corruption Case
description: The arrest of State Senator Malcolm A. Smith on Tuesday followed a string of corruption cases involving elected officials in New York State that has helped burnish Albanys reputation as an ethical cesspool.

title: Divisions Form in Atlanta as Bail Is Set in Cheating Case
description: ATLANTA  Confusion, anger and charges of racism played out at the Fulton County Jail here on Tuesday as the process of booking 35 educators in the nations largest school-cheating scandal began.

title: Google Faces More Inquiries in Europe Over Privacy Policy
description: Instead of facing one European investigation into its privacy policy, Google now has to contend with at least six of them.

title: A Glimpse of the World
description: Two of the countrys most valuable sports franchises extended their reach to New Yorks newest and tallest perch Tuesday morning, when they unveiled plans for the three-level One World Observatory, on the 100th floor of 1 World Trade Center.

title: Image of the Day: April 2
Big Profits at Fannie and Freddie Reignite Debate on Housing Supports
description: What was the most profitable insurance company last year?

title: Generational Shift: Learning to Drive a Stick
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  Dorrie Sibleys reason for bringing her son Breslin, 16, to learn how to drive a car equipped with a manual transmission, a so-called stick shift, had nothing to do with the reason the instructional event was being held. But it was a very good reason nonetheless.

title: Wheelies: The Secret-of-My-Success Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Formichetti Out at Mugler
description: If Lady Gaga wants to continue her career in runway modeling, she will have to look elsewhere than Mugler. Jol Palix, the president of the Clarins Fragrance Group and the director general of its Mugler fragrance and fashion label, announced on Tuesday that the company had parted ways with the creative director Nicola Formichetti.

title: Clinton and Biden on Stage, No Spin Room Needed
description: Before the Great Showdown of the Presidential Candidates comes the Great Showdown of the Award Presenters.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Digg Resurgence, and Nanoparticles vs. Viruses
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: The Centurys Bitterest Journalistic Failure? Considering Times Coverage of the Holocaust
description: April 8 is Holocaust Remembrance Day (Yom Hashoah), which marks the anniversary of the Warsaw ghetto uprising on the Hebrew calendar.

title: Banish Winter With the Taste of Spring
description: Though the vernal equinox has passed, here in the Northeast trees remain largely bare, with brown branches on view instead of cherry blossoms. If spring has actually arrived, it is in its slow beginning stages, with daffodils and tulips poking through the hard ground.

title: In Act of Solidarity, Top Pentagon Officials Will Return a Share of Salaries
description: In an unusual act of solidarity with the Pentagons civilian workforce, Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel and the departments deputy secretary, Ashton B. Carter, will return a share of their salaries to the federal Treasury for the same number of days that employees are docked because of furloughs.

title: At Home in Tanzania, Thabeet Plays the Motivator
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Theres a popular bumper sticker on the streets of Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania, that reads, This car is protected by the blood of Jesus. But theres one teacher at the International School of Tanganyika who needs one that reads, This car is protected by Hasheem Thabeet.

title: U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara Statement
description: U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara outlined the criminal charges filed against six New York state officials, calling today a sad and disappointing day for those who still dream of an honest government.

title: Look Whos Not Taking a Pay Cut
description: This just in from the sequester front: The Journal Gazette reported that Indianas Head Start program could lose roughly 1,000 spots. Programs in Columbus and Franklin have already held lotteries to determine which needy children will get kicked out.

title: Front Burner
description: To Prepare: A Complement From the Chef

title: Off the Menu
description: Headliner: Lobster Place and Chelsea Market

title: The Times, Too, Is Reconsidering the Term Illegal Immigrant
description: The Associated Press made a bold move on Tuesday in dropping the term illegal immigrant from its influential stylebook.

title: Turning a Dark Place Into a Beacon of Discovery
description: The memoirist and poet Mary Karr, who has traded whiskey for Jesus, once described the difficulty of talking nonironically about faith to a secular audience. It is, she said, like doing card tricks on the radio.

title: The Very Brief Revival of the Homemade Zip Gun
description: With a pipe for a barrel and a nail for a firing pin, the homemade firearm known as a zip gun fires only a single bullet at a time, with limited accuracy.

title: Shades On | House of Waris and Illesteva
description: Waris Ahluwalia of House of Waris is to jewelry as Daniel Silberman and Jus Ske of Illesteva are to eyewear: they design culty, mostly unisex accessories; pal around with downtowns creative peerage; and are prone to participating in one-off collaborations. It seems inevitable, then, that the two brands would end up joining forces with one another. A single eyewear style resulting from a single design session, House of Waris for Illestevas sunglasses ($250) might be the single most essential frame of the summer. Handmade in France, the 1960s-influenced unisex style comes in five colors, all of which are refreshingly subdued. They look good on everybody, says Silberman, who also wears a pair as his prescription eyeglasses. Adds Ahluwalia, The idea was to help the world look as sexy as possible, even in the glaring sun.

title: S.E.C. Sets Rules for Disclosures Using Social Media
description: 8:34 p.m. | Updated Chief executives can now feel free to post, blog or tweet  as long as they inform investors about their social media strategy first.

title: Wilson-Pakula, Obscure to All but Ballot-Hopping Politicians
description: The criminal complaint accusing a top state lawmaker of trying to buy his way into the race for New York City mayor made several references to a document most New Yorkers have probably never heard of.

title: Hotel Review: Georges Hotel Galata in Istanbul
description: Rates

title: Restaurant Report: maz in Lima, Peru
description: With all of the attention paid to Peruvian food in recent years, the cuisine of the Amazon has been all but ignored. Pedro Miguel Schiaffino is a rare exception. At his Lima restaurant Malabar he uses ingredients from the Peruvian Amazon, the countrys largest and least populated region, and he has spent a decade developing a relationship with producers there. The result is maz, opened last June in a high-profile location in trendy Miraflores and the capitals first serious Amazonian restaurant.

title: Lois Smith and Frances Sternhagen to Share Obie Lifetime Achievement Award
description: Lois Smith and Frances Sternhagen, stage veterans with recent major Off Broadway roles, are joint recipients of the lifetime achievement Obie, The Village Voice announced Tuesday. The Obies have been presented by The Voice since 1956, and the shared lifetime achievement award is a first.

title: Beet and Bulgur Salad
description: The Restaurant Takeaway column is devoted to restaurant dishes you can make in your own kitchen, tweaked for home cooks.

title: Pictures of the Day: West Bank and Elsewhere
description: Photos from the West Bank, Myanmar, South Africa and Nepal.

title: More Rizzo Than Sandra Dee
description: IT SMELLS SO SWEET in here, remarked a young female customer entering the new Cynthia Rowley shop (or should we call it Good Ship, as in Lollipop), at the end of a branch-festooned alleyway on the Upper East Side.

title: Dragonfly, Hunting
description: The deadly, exacting aerialist catches a fruit fly.

title: At Trade Center, Looking Ahead While Finding Remnants of the Past
description: Update, May 1: The medical examiner said fragments that may be human remains were recovered Tuesday in material excavated from the vehicle security center area at the new World Trade Center site. A total of 77 such fragments have been found since sifting operations began on April 1.

title: The House Band Amid the Artwork
description: Hard to believe a full decade has passed since Edward Arron, a skillful young cellist with a flair for programming and a knack for organization, convened a group of his peers for a new chamber music initiative, the Metropolitan Museum Artists in Concert. Formed in 2003 to help the museum celebrate its 50th anniversary as a concert presenter, the ensemble celebrated its own 10th anniversary with a concert in the museums Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium on Friday night.

title: Lonely Spy in a Love Triangle
description: There is no such thing as a good old-fashioned spy story.

title: Moonstruck, and Keeping Their Eyes on the Prize
description: With our ever-increasing ability to look deep into space and ponder its brain-bending mysteries, the humble old Moon seems largely forgotten. But a few people are still carrying a torch for that nearest of celestial neighbors, and their strange, poignant devotion is beautifully captured in a wry documentary called Lunarcy! on Wednesday night on Epix.

title: Verizon Says Its Not Currently Planning to Bid for Vodafone
description: Investors hoping for a giant trans-Atlantic telecommunications deal will have to cool their heels for a bit longer.

title: When the Artists Muse Loves the Artists Wife
description: Three Trees is inspired by the life of the 20th-century artist Alberto Giacometti and his unusual relationship with his muse, the Japanese philosophy professor Isaku Yanaihara. Unusual not only because the muse was male, but also because he happened to be sleeping with Giacomettis wife, with the artists full knowledge and consent.

title: Arts Hub for All May Work for None
description: The visionary architect Frank Gehry remains committed to designing the performing arts center at the site of the former World Trade Center. But what exactly has Mr. Gehry been asked to design? What is it for? Which institutions, ensembles or companies will perform in the complex? Who will be its artistic leader?

title: A Generic Guitar Inspires a Distinctive Project
description: It started out as an inside joke and quickly became an international art project, linked to a charitable cause.

title: Set Joyce to Music? Yes She Said Yes She Will Yes
description: Take a few words by Joyce. How about herds innumerable from the Cyclops episode in Ulysses, made up of bellwethers and flushed ewes and shearling rams and lambs and stubble geese and medium steers and roaring mares and polled calves and longwools and storesheep and Cuffes prime springers and culls and sowpigs and baconhogs and the various different varieties of highly distinguished swine and Angus heifers and polly bullocks of immaculate pedigree together with prime premiated milchcows and beeves:  oh, good, a colon, take a breath  and there is ever heard a trampling, cackling, roaring, lowing, bleating, bellowing, rumbling, grunting, champing, chewing, of sheep and pigs and heavyhoofed kine from pasturelands of Lush and Rush and ...? Well fade out there, but it goes on.

title: A Suite of Their Own
description: Women make up more than half of the work force on Wall Street. But breaking into the highest ranks is still largely a mans sport.

title: Chastened, Folk Art Museum Puts Down Healthier Roots
description: The American Folk Art Museums attendance is projected to be 80,000 this fiscal year, up from 66,000. Important donors are giving again. And for the first time in its history, this summer the museum will send a work from its collection to the Venice Biennale.

title: New America Foundation Naming Anne-Marie Slaughter as President
description: April 3 | Updated

title: Fatal Landslide Draws Attention to the Toll of Mining on Tibet
description: BEIJING  One after another, the bodies have kept coming. By Wednesday, rescuers had pulled 66 dead miners from the snow-covered rubble. They expect to find more.

title: Using ECMAScript 5 Objects and Properties
description: With ECMAScript 6 inching closer and closer to becoming an accepted standard, its a perfect time to look at some of the incredibly useful changes in the last big ES release. ECMAScript 5, published in 2009, gave JavaScript developers some great new options. One of its most powerful additions was Object.defineProperty. This method allows you to make better use of the browsers internals. John Resig explains:

title: Some Dessert, After That Meal With Wally
description: Its the art of being, not the act of performing, the experimental-theater director Andr Gregory muses in Andr Gregory: Before and After Dinner, an indelible, gripping documentary portrait by his wife, Cindy Kleine. Even emotion can be a mask.

title: Movie Time
description: To help moviegoers keep on track for a weeks worth of screening indie titles during this years Tribeca Film Festival, which takes place in New York later this month, IWC Schaffhausen created a limited-edition Tribeca Film Festival 2013 watch. Produced in stainless steel and a batch of only 100, the watch will set you back $13,600 and is available today at the watchmakers flagship store on Madison Avenue, just in time to map out your viewing schedule. For those truly wanting to commemorate the event, a single platinum version will be up for auction at Antiquorum on April 10.

title: Sandbag Season Has Fargo Thinking of a Better Way
description: FARGO, N.D.  Just last fall, the reservoirs and rivers here in the Red River Valley were so low from drought that Mayor Dennis R. Walaker of Fargo was concerned that the faucets and shower heads in his city would run dry.

title: FIFA Selects Goal-Line System
description: Under the cloak of games Tuesday in the quarterfinals of the UEFA Champions League, FIFA issued a communique about its approval of a single goal-line technology system that will be employed at this years Confederations Cup and next years World Cup, both of which will be played in Brazil.

title: A Roving Noise Laboratory
description: In 1929, the Noise Abatement Commission drove a truck around New York City to measure the din. Fox Movietone Newsreel preserved by the University of South Carolina, Moving Image Research Collections.

title: Live Streaming: TimesTalks With Robert Redford and Shia LaBeouf
description: 11:30 p.m. | Updated Tonight, ArtsBeat live streamed a TimesTalks event with the Oscar-winning director and actor Robert Redford and the actor Shia LaBeouf, who both star in Mr. Redfords latest film, The Company You Keep. Click on the image above to watch the event, which was moderated by the Times media columnist David Carr.

title: Upping the Ante in a Play for a Stronger Board
description: Would you pay a director tens of millions for fantastic performance? Welcome to the newest trend in activist investing: hedge funds paying their nominees to a companys board as if they were chief executives.

title: The Evolution of Audis Singleframe Grille, Explained in Detail
description: Wolfgang Egger, Audis design chief, took a few minutes last week at the New York auto show to explain the shape of the companys new A3 and S3 models, and his new twist to the evolution of the Audi grille. Mr. Egger, 50, pulled out one of his burnt sienna drawing pencils to highlight his ideas.

title: Video Captures Mugging in Subway Station
description: Update, April 3 | The police arrested Aidan Folan, 21, of Bay Ridge, Brooklyn on Wednesday and charged him with robbery and assault in connection with this attack.

title: Helpful Workplace Hints From the Worlds Most Helpful Guy
description: Yesterday, I asked you to write in with your questions about workplace dilemmas for the organizational psychologist Adam Grant, the subject of this past weekends cover article, who studies the ways that being altruistic can lead to success in a career. Here are Grants answers to your questions.

title: Alec Baldwin Back on Broadway
description: Alec Baldwin, Ben Foster and Tom Sturridge discuss the gritty drama Orphans, Mr. Baldwins first Broadway appearance since 2004.

title: The Many Faces of State Political Scandals
description: Over the past seven years, 29 state officeholders have been convicted of a crime, censured or otherwise accused of wrongdoing, according to the New York Public Interest Research Group.

title: Pipeline Spills Stir New Criticism of Keystone Plan
description: Two recent oil pipeline spills have prompted new criticism from opponents of the proposed Keystone XL project, while raising more questions about whether the federal government is adequately monitoring the nations vast labyrinth of pipelines.

title: After Protests, Prison Firm Pulls Donation
description: Sports stadiums have been named for fast food companies, office supply chains, and banks, but apparently there is one sector of the economy that is not welcome in the sports world: the private prison industry.

title: Investments in Education May Be Misdirected
description: James Heckman is one of the nations top economists studying human development. Thirteen years ago, he shared the Nobel for economics. In February, he stood before the annual meeting of the Nebraska Chamber of Commerce and Industry, showed the assembled business executives a chart, and demolished the United States entire approach to education.

title: Bucking French Tradition, City Sets Up a Kind of Holy Quarter
description: BUSSY SAINT-GEORGES, France  Set above a sweep of green farmland, the crumbling stone chapel at the center of this village met the spiritual requirements of its Roman Catholic residents for nearly four centuries. But Bussy Saint-Georges is no longer just a village.

title: How Lawyers Charge Their Clients
description: To the Editor:

title: Provoking North Korea: A Plea for Caution
description: To the Editor:

title: Sexual Assaults in Egypt
description: To the Editor:

title: Case of Psychologists Killer Goes to Jury in Manhattan
description: After three weeks of testimony, jurors are to begin debating on Wednesday whether David Tarloffs plan to save his mother  a plan that resulted in his killing an Upper East Side psychologist  was the product of an insane mind or simply a poorly thought-out crime that ended in a murder.

title: Gays and the Church
description: To the Editor:

title: Care for Native Americans
description: To the Editor:

title: House Immigration Bill Is Said to Offer 3 Paths
description: WASHINGTON  In the shadow of a bipartisan Senate group preparing to roll out broad immigration legislation next week, shortly after Congress returns from its holiday break, a bipartisan group of eight House members is readying its own bill.

title: Notable Deaths of 2013
description: Remembering Jonathan Winters, Julie Harris, Edward I. Koch, Chinua Achebe, Margaret Thatcher, James Gandolfini and others who died this year.

title: Diagnosis: Human
description: THE news that 11 percent of school-age children now receive a diagnosis of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder  some 6.4 million  gave me a chill. My son David was one of those who received that diagnosis.

title: Egyptians Struggle as Wary Tourists Stay Away
description: AL-BAIRAT, Egypt  Many of this countrys post-uprising troubles wash up here, in a crumbling shack on a dirty canal, where 13 members of the Abdul Latif family have long relied on tourism to keep them from slipping from poverty into ruin.

title: France: Ex-Minister Admits Lying About Secret Bank Account
description: The former budget minister, Jrme Cahuzac, admitted Tuesday that he lied to Parliament and the president about the existence of a secret overseas bank account. Mr. Cahuzac, left, who resigned over the scandal, confessed to investigating magistrates that he had an undeclared account in Switzerland and then Singapore, as the Web site Mediapart had asserted. Mr. Cahuzac was preliminarily indicted on tax fraud charges, and in a statement on Tuesday, President Franois Hollande criticized him for an unpardonable moral fault in lying to the countrys highest authorities. Mr. Hollandes critics accused him of a delay in cleaning house. The politician Franois Bayrou said the scandal produced damages that are considerable and devastating for French politics.

title: Background Checks Are Still Stumbling Block in Gun Law Overhaul
description: WASHINGTON  With Senate Democrats still struggling to line up support, the success or failure of President Obamas four-month campaign to overhaul gun laws will most likely revolve around a single provision: a proposal to expand federal background checks for gun purchases.

title: Mets Marcum Scratched Because of Neck Pain
description: The right-hander Shaun Marcum was unable to pitch a previously scheduled simulated game Tuesday in Port St. Lucie, Fla., after feeling pain in his neck, the Mets said.

title: Brazil: Suspects in Gang Rape Linked to Assaults and Robberies
description: The Rio de Janeiro police said Tuesday that they were investigating a new accusation of rape against three men arrested in connection with the gang rape over the weekend of an American student in a transit van. In the newest case, a woman said she was raped by the men during the Carnival holiday in February, but she did not report the attack then to the authorities. Another woman had formally accused the same men of raping her in March. The police said they were also investigating at least 10 claims of robbery in which the men have been implicated.

title: Did Putin Sink Cyprus?
description: ISTANBUL

title: J.C. Penney Slashes Pay of Its Chief
description: In a clear sign of its dissatisfaction with the direction of the company, the board of J. C. Penney gave its chief executive, Ron Johnson, a pay cut of almost 97 percent, to $1.9 million, for 2012, according to a regulatory filing on Tuesday.

title: Centers See New Faces Seeking Test Prep
description: Elma Moy, a teacher from southern China, opened her learning center in a storefront with low ceilings on Henry Street in 1982, catering to Chinatowns growing student body. For years, her Web site was mostly in Cantonese, advertisements were reserved for Chinese-language daily newspapers, and staff members at the front desk greeted parents signing up for classes with Ching choh la. (Have a seat.)

title: In Mexican Villages, Few Are Left to Dream of U.S.
description: EL CARGADERO, Mexico  The pretty houses in the hills here, with their bright paint and new additions, clearly display the material benefits of having millions of workers move to the United States over the past few decades. But these simple homes also reveal why another huge exodus would be unlikely: the bulk of them are empty.

title: Jimmy Fallon Said to Have Extended NBC Contract
description: Jimmy Fallon has signed a contract extension with NBC that will keep him at the network, executives with knowledge of the deal said Tuesday night. It is understood the deal will include that he will succeed Jay Leno as host of the Tonight show at some point, they said.

title: Empty Mexican Villages Raise Doubts on New Immigration Wave
description: American lawmakers worry that  a pathway to citizenship could encourage illegal immigration, but in Mexico, there seem to be few left to come.

title: My Little (Global) School
description: There was a time when middle-class parents in America could be  and were  content to know that their kids public schools were better than those in the next neighborhood over. As the world has shrunk, though, the next neighborhood over is now Shanghai or Helsinki. So, last August, I wrote a column quoting Andreas Schleicher  who runs the global exam that compares how 15-year-olds in public schools around the world do in applied reading, math and science skills  as saying imagine, in a few years, that you could sign on to a Web site and see how your school compares with a similar school anywhere in the world. And then you could take this information to your superintendent and ask: Why are we not doing as well as schools in China or Finland?

title: Barcelona Loses Messi and the Lead, Spoiling Its Evening in Paris
description: When the prize is the Champions League title, tiny errors and small tweaks become vital.

title: Russia: New Law Allows Governors to Be Appointed, Undoing Reform
description: President Vladimir V. Putin signed a law on Tuesday that could roll back a reform pushed by his predecessor allowing the direct election of regional governors. The new law allows regional legislatures to forgo elections and appoint governors from a list of candidates approved by Mr. Putin. He abolished direct elections for governors in 2004, during his second term as president, but President Dmitri A. Medvedev pushed a law through Parliament last year to restore them in what was seen as a major concession to a growing political opposition movement. Mr. Putin, now serving his third term as president, has said that the new law is needed to protect minorities in regions where elections could be combustible. Critics said the law would allow the pro-Kremlin United Russia Party to avoid election defeats by using its control of regional legislatures to bypass popular voting. The law was the latest unwinding of Mr. Medvedevs initiatives since Mr. Putin returned to the presidency.

title: With New Move, Jay-Z Enters a Sports Agent State of Mind
description: His social circle includes the biggest names in sports. His celebrity cachet is unmatched. He has informally advised athletes on everything from housing choices to contract extensions.

title: Public Housing as a Penal Colony
description: New York Citys constitutionally suspect stop-and-frisk program is rightly being hammered in federal courts. Earlier this year, the court ruled in the case of Ligon v. City of New York that the city had violated Fourth Amendment protections against unreasonable search and seizure by illegally stopping people outside of private buildings in the Bronx. In the case of Floyd v. City of New York, which is currently being heard in Federal District Court in Manhattan, the plaintiffs charge the city with illegally stopping and frisking citizens based on race.

title: Bribery Case Unsettles a Coalition in Albany
description: Last fall, as a group of breakaway Democrats was preparing to join forces with Republicans to take control of the State Senate, they recruited Malcolm A. Smith, a Queens Democrat, to join their caucus.

title: On the Frontiers of Brain Research
description: President Obama officially announced his new brain research initiative on Tuesday, with a pledge to put $100 million in his 2014 budget to support work at three federal agencies. It is a modest but welcome start for an effort that could transform our understanding of how the brain works and help researchers find new ways to treat and prevent brain disorders like epilepsy and Alzheimers.

title: Bravo Discusses Mixing Advertising With Its Shows
description: Anderson Davis is not among the stars of Bravo series that the channel likes to call Bravolebrities. Nonetheless, he was treated like one on Monday night during an episode of Watch What Happens Live: he served as the bartender; joked with the host, Andy Cohen; and even took off his shirt to reveal a toned upper body that would not be out of place on one of Bravos Real Housewives shows.

title: The Connecticut Gun-Control Package
description: The Connecticut Legislature is scheduled to vote Wednesday on what leaders of both parties call the most far-reaching gun-legislation package in the country. The bill is thorough and bipartisan. Swift approval would send a message to the entire country that, as John McKinney, the Republican State Senate minority leader, observed, some issues must rise above politics. Mr. McKinney represents Newtown, where, in December, a gunman armed with a Bushmaster XM-15 military-style rifle massacred 20 children and six adults at Sandy Hook Elementary School.

title: Military Sees Broader Role for Special Operations Forces, in Peace and War
description: FORT BRAGG, N.C.  Here at the headquarters of the Army Special Operations Command, planning is well under way for a significantly increased presence in Africa, Asia and Latin America for the Special Forces soldiers with the distinctive green berets who were the first American troops into Afghanistan after the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001. Special Operations forces, which include Green Berets, Navy SEAL teams, the Rangers and specialized aviation units, have historically been a small corner of the military and not always embraced by conventional commanders.

title: Egypt and U.S. Argue Over Jon Stewart, Americas Bassem Youssef
description: Last Updated, Wednesday, 10:22 a.m. The American comedian Jon Stewarts criticism of the Egyptian government briefly escalated into a diplomatic incident on Tuesday, as the United States Embassy in Cairo shared a link to a Daily Show segment on Twitter, causing the office of Egypts president to react with anger.

title: Video Puts Rutgers Coach Under Scrutiny
description: In a video shown Tuesday on ESPN, the Rutgers mens basketball coach, Mike Rice, is seen yelling homophobic slurs at his players, kicking them, grabbing them and shoving them. He also throws basketballs at their legs, their heads and their bodies from point-blank range  as if he were playing dodge ball.

title: Why Do G.M.O.s Need Protection?
description: Genetic engineering in agriculture has disappointed many people who once had hopes for it. Excluding, of course, those whove made money from it, appropriately represented in the publics mind by Monsanto. That corporation, or at least its friends, recently managed to have an outrageous rider slipped into the 587-page funding bill Congress sent to President Obama.[1]

title: Justice Ginsburgs Misdirection
description: With two same-sex marriage cases before the Supreme Court, numerous commentators have latched on to remarks by Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg critical of the courts 1973 Roe v. Wade decision that legalized abortion nationwide. It is not the judgment that was wrong, but it moved too far, too fast, she said at Columbia Law School last year, a view she has expressed in various speeches and law review articles. As one of the courts moderate liberals and a champion of womens rights, she is now being routinely cited to argue for a timid resolution on the issue of same-sex marriage that would strike down Californias ban on such marriages, but would leave prohibitions standing in about 40 other states.

title: Addictive Animal Webcams Get Network Attention
description: The average visitor to the Kitten Cam on Animal Planets Web site has a hard time leaving. The live Internet stream of felines has been watched more than 25 million times since it started last September. The average person, seemingly transfixed by the cuteness, stays on the page for 18 minutes and 50 seconds.

title: 2 Deterrents to Robocalls Win Contest by F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON  Caller ID, Do Not Call registries, telephone number blocking  all entered the arsenal of consumer weapons against telemarketers to great acclaim, only to fall from favor as growing numbers of cold-calling solicitors found ways around them.

title: Jumping From Party to Party to Bribery Charge
description: You could drag Malcolm A. Smith out of bed at 6 in the morning, and hed still look like a million dollars.

title: U.S. Grows More Helpful to International Criminal Court, a Body It First Scorned
description: THE HAGUE  When a fugitive African warlord, Gen. Bosco Ntaganda, gave himself up in March to the United States Embassy in Rwanda and asked to be sent to the International Criminal Court here, American diplomats publicized the episode and swiftly brokered the transfer.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, Apr. 3, 2013
