description: The amnesty, its for them, the people who are there. It doesnt mean much for us.

title: Denver Oil Concern Withdraws Its Plan for Big Tank in Maine
description: A Denver oil company that had proposed building a 14-story liquid-propane storage tank on the Maine coast abruptly withdrew its application on Tuesday, bringing to a sudden halt a contentious battle that had raged for three years in the tiny town of Searsport and its environs.

title: William F. Peel III
description: Mr. Peel, 59, is the chief executive of Datawatch Systems, a company based in Bethesda, Md., that provides remote security monitoring for commercial buildings in the United States and Canada.

title: Interpreting North Korea
description: Rendezvous editor, Marcus Mabry, discusses the U.S. perspective on North Koreas actions with Mark Landler, a White House correspondent.

title: Emissions Rules Put Alternative-Fuel Vehicles in a Bind
description: WASHINGTON

title: Once Hobbled, New York Developer Aims for Comeback
description: David Lichtenstein presided over one of the biggest real estate debacles of the last economic cycle. In 2009, only two years after he bought a portfolio of nearly 700 hotels for $8 billion, almost all of it borrowed, he filed for bankruptcy protection.

title: The Damage Done by a Lucky Guy
description: I WENT last week to see Lucky Guy, the new play by Nora Ephron about the journalist Mike McAlary, in previews. The decision to cast Tom Hanks in the lead role was brilliant. Mr. Hanks cannot be anything but endearing, almost cuddly, even though the man he is portraying was complicated and deeply flawed.

title: Advances in Science of Fire Free a Convict After 42 Years
description: TUCSON  Prosecutors who seek a conviction on a charge of arson must first prove that a fire was intentionally set, and then that the defendant was the one who set it.

title: Report Links High Rates of Gun Violence to Weak State Regulations
description: Many states with the weakest gun laws have the worst rates of gun violence, ranking high on numerous indicators, like gun homicides and suicides, firearm deaths of children, and killings of law enforcement officers, according to a report to be issued Wednesday by the liberal Center for American Progress.

title: Legislative Deal Prompts Run on Connecticut Gun Shops
description: Guns shops were jammed. Gun manufacturers were angry. Gun-control advocates were thrilled. Many legislators were torn.

title: Can He Win? Trumps Is He a Fascist?
description: LONDON

title: Retailers Track Employee Thefts in Vast Databases
description: Facing a wave of employee theft, retailers across the country have helped amass vast databases of workers accused of stealing and are using that information to keep employees from working again in the industry.

title: Corrections: April 3, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: He Sings, She Sings: Whos Right?
description: In the more than 10 years since The Last Five Years was first produced, this two-character musical by Jason Robert Brown about the life and death of young love has been embraced by new generations of musical-theater lovers. Watching the revival that opened at Second Stage Theater on Tuesday night, I fancifully imagined I could hear all the fans in the audience singing along in their heads. They greeted almost every number with fervent applause, as if each were the guest of honor arriving at a birthday party.

title: Holy Fish
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  If I didnt know any better, I would say that it is the beginning of baseball season. In fact, it opened on April 1 for most ball clubs, and soon we should be in full MOOD SWING.

title: Scandal in Atlanta Reignites Debate Over Tests Role
description: There are few more contentious issues in public education than the increased reliance on standardized testing.

title: Diplomatic Incident Arises Over Egyptian Comedian
description: CAIRO  The legal troubles of an Egyptian television comedian briefly escalated into a diplomatic incident on Tuesday, when the United States and Egypt traded barbs on Twitter and in the news media over issues including freedom of speech, religion and sovereignty.

title: Legacy of Mets Injured Aces: Big Paydays for Few Victories
description: Pedro Martinez and Johan Santana came to the Mets with high hopes, reputations as clubhouse leaders and multiple Cy Young Awards. They had sterling debut seasons that kept their teams in playoff contention, but then both spent long stints on the disabled list.

title: Should Tweets Cost You Your Job?
Accusations of Bribery Hit a Villages Main Street
description: The large sign by the fenced-in property next to a strip mall in Spring Valley, N.Y., seemed to offer so much promise. Coming Soon! it said, the words floating above a picture of a mock-up of a gaudy community center and catering hall that was to have a capacity of more than 1,000 people.

title: Happily Never After?
description: Im worried about the Supreme Court.

title: 2 Canadians Who Joined Algeria Attack Are Identified
description: LONDON, Ontario  Two friends who met at a high school here have been identified as among the militants who attacked an Algerian gas plant in January, an assault that left 37 hostages and 29 kidnappers dead, government officials said Tuesday.

title: With Legacy on His Mind, Mayor Adds More Schools
description: As the clock winds down on his administration, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg is moving quickly to ensure that his educational legacy lasts until long after he is gone, or at least to make it difficult for his successor to undo it.

title: Pakistan: Attack on Power Station Leaves 7 Dead and a City Dark
description: At least seven people were killed early Tuesday in a militant attack on a power grid station outside Peshawar, the provincial capital of insurgency-riven Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province. Dozens of militants, believed to be Taliban, attacked the 500-kilowatt grid station, killing four government employees and three police officers. The militants planted bombs inside the compound and took four employees hostage. The explosions destroyed the offices and control room of the station, resulting in a power breakdown that lasted for several hours in Peshawar and neighboring areas. As the country gears for general elections on May 11, militants have stepped up their attacks on government installations and security forces, and have threatened to attack election rallies.

title: Rangers Obtain Big Forward; Bruins Get Jagr
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  On the eve of the N.H.L. trade deadline, the Boston Bruins loaded up for the playoffs by acquiring Jaromir Jagr, and the Rangers, desperate for scoring and grit and now ninth in the Eastern Conference, acquired forward Ryane Clowe from San Jose.

title: Devils Playoff Push Feels Like a Halfhearted Tap
description: NEWARK  The Devils trailed by 2-0 when the feisty right wing Tom Kostopoulos attempted to spark his seemingly listless team by dropping his gloves and exchanging blows with the Islanders Matt Martin on Monday night.

title: Crosswalks in New York Are Not Havens, Study Finds
description: Pedestrians struck by cars are most often hit while in the crosswalk, with the signal on their side.

title: Clinton Speaks Up for Womens Issues
description: WASHINGTON  Hillary Rodham Clinton made her public debut in her new role as prospective presidential candidate on Tuesday night by returning to the issue that has animated her long career on the national stage  the empowerment of women around the globe.

title: Crucible of Change in Memphis as State Takes On Failing Schools
description: MEMPHIS  Not far off a scruffy boulevard lined with dollar stores and payday loan shops in a neighborhood of run-down brick bungalows, Corning Achievement Elementary School here is a pristine refuge, with gleaming tile floors and signs in classrooms proclaiming Whatever it takes.

title: Game No. 1, if Not Others, Favors Mets
description: It is one of those quirky statistics that cannot be explained, other than to concede that baseball is baseball, and the Mets are the Mets.

title: Turning Around Failing Schools
description: Tennessee is one of a handful of states attempting a radical experiment in which schools are removed from the oversight of traditional school boards and pooled into special districts.

title: A G.O.P. Candidate Heard His Partys Message: To Run, You Pay
description: Last August, George T. McDonald sat down in an East Harlem restaurant with the five bosses of New York Citys Republican Party, hoping to persuade them to support his bid for mayor.

title: Transactions
description: Recent Sale

title: Treatment Plant for Waste in Nuclear Cleanup Has Design Flaws, Panel Says
description: WASHINGTON  A treatment plant that the Energy Department is counting on to stabilize the radioactive waste at the nations largest environmental cleanup project, at the Hanford Nuclear Reservation in Washington State, has design problems that could lead to chemical explosions, inadvertent nuclear reactions and mechanical breakdowns, a federal advisory panel warned on Tuesday.

title: Chuck Fairbanks, a Fitful Football Coach, Dies at 79
description: Chuck Fairbanks, who built successful football teams in college at the University of Oklahoma and in the National Football League with the New England Patriots but left each job under a cloud of disfavor, died on Tuesday in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 79.

title: More Than Just Green
description: The Bullitt Center, a  new office building in Seattle, goes beyond energy conservation and recycled materials in an effort to be fully sustainable.

title: How the Auto Industry Fared in March
description: How the Auto Industry Fared in March

title: Officials Say Texas Inquiry Is Not Limited to White-Supremacist Gang
description: KAUFMAN, Tex.  Law enforcement officials investigating the fatal shootings of two prosecutors here have been pursuing a variety of leads, including prison interviews with members of a violent white-supremacist gang and an examination of cases worked on by both victims. But they remain no closer to linking the shootings to any particular suspects or motive.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 2, 2013

title: A Debate in the Open on the Fed
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Federal Reserve officials regularly air their views in public speeches, but they rarely engage in public debates. On Tuesday night, two of the officials who disagree most sharply about the Feds current policy did just that.

title: Former Students Recall Teachers Accused of Abuse
description: DEERFIELD, Mass.  After he went off to college, Michael Zimmerman returned when he could to Deerfield Academy, the elite boarding school he had attended for three years. On one visit to the campus, which rises in vine-covered brick from a rural stretch of this small town, he was invited by his former dormitory master, Michael Bois, for a glass of wine.

title: Oregon: Groups Give Notice of Suit Over Coal Dust
description: An environmental coalition on Monday charged that coal and coal dust spilled from railroad hoppers is polluting the scenic Columbia River Gorge, and pledged to sue mining companies and the Burlington Northern Santa Fe Railroad if they do not halt the spills. Representatives of the Sierra Club and other conservation groups said they were invoking a clause in the Clean Water Act that permits lawsuits if those accused of polluting do not remedy environmental problems within 60 days. Each coal train leaves behind 10,000 pounds of loose coal in the gorge containing heavy metals and other harmful chemicals, the groups maintained. But there has been little research on the issue, they added, and the environmental impact is unclear. The groups declined to release their own studies of the contaminants.

title: Massachusetts: Harvard Admits Deeper Search
description: Harvards search of staff e-mail accounts went further than previously disclosed, administrators said Tuesday. They announced that an outside lawyer would investigate the matter and a task force would review privacy policies. President Drew Gilpin Faust and two deans revealed the developments in a faculty meeting, and the deans apologized. In investigating leaks about a cheating scandal, administrators searched subject lines in the accounts that 16 instructors have as resident deans. On Tuesday, administrators said that with one resident dean, the search included that deans personal Harvard account, but no e-mails were opened.

title: N.C.A.A. Replay: April 2
description: Images from the N.C.A.A. womens basketball tournament, where Louisville and Notre Dame joined UConn and California in the Final Four.

title: Anthony, With the Stage to Himself, Scores 50
description: MIAMI  Carmelo Anthony decided to try to beat the depleted Miami Heat single-handedly Tuesday night, and he succeeded.

title: Why Big Data Is I.B.M.s Friend
description: For big sellers of computer technology to business that are looking to stay relevant, theres no friend quite like Big Data.

title: Reasons Not to Stretch
description: Most of us grew up hearing that we should warm up with a stretch. Strike and hold a pose, such as touching your toes, for 30 seconds or more, we were told, and youll be looser, stronger and injury-proof.

title: Word of the Day | hallucination
description: hallucination \h-l-s-na-shn\ noun

title: Rebuilt Blue Jays Stumble Out of Gate
description: TORONTO  The first question posed to Blue Jays Manager John Gibbons in his office Tuesday afternoon dripped with extra meaning.

title: Stephens, After Another Early Exit, Tries to Maintain Focus Moving Forward
description: DANIEL ISLAND, S.C.  After her surprise run to the semifinals of the Australian Open in January that included an upset of Serena Williams, Sloane Stephens was suddenly the brightest young star in American tennis.

title: U.S. Speeds Missile Defense to Guam After North Korea Bars Souths Workers
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The United States announced Wednesday that it was speeding the deployment of an advanced missile defense system to Guam in the next few weeks, two years ahead of schedule in what the Pentagon said was a precautionary move to protect American naval and air forces from the threat of a North Korean missile attack.

title: New Orleans Jail Videos Bring Shock at Hearing
description: NEW ORLEANS  Lawyers and onlookers were stunned when videos were played in federal court here Tuesday that appeared to show inmates in the Orleans Parish Prison using drugs, drinking beer and showing off a loaded pistol. The videos, which lawyers for the sheriffs department said were filmed four years ago and had recently been found in a safe, were shown as part of a hearing to determine whether a federal consent decree is warranted to reform the city jail.

title: Photo Replay: April 2
description: A view of the day in sports, including Champions League play in Paris, Davis Cup quarterfinal play and baseball in Toronto.

title: Whats On Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (13, 49) WHAT PLANTS TALK ABOUT Nature follows J. C. Cahill, an experimental plant ecologist at the University of Alberta, from the Great Basin Desert in the western United States to the rain forests of British Columbia to reveal landscapes where plants eavesdrop on one another, talk to their allies, summon mercenaries, nurture their young and sometimes wage war, as when wild tobacco deploys nicotine to poison certain insects. Yet when a hungry hornworm caterpillar proves unaffected, the plant releases a chemical S.O.S. message that alerts the bugs enemies to attack.

title: If They Meet Knicks in Playoffs, Heat Say Theyll Be Ready
description: MIAMI  The Miami Heat are 32-4 at home this season, but half of those losses have come against the Knicks.

title: In China, Bird Flu Jitters Are Back
description: BEIJING  As four more people in China were diagnosed this week with a new strain of bird flu, bringing the total number of cases to seven, flu jitters were spreading again.

title: Malaysia Vote May Rule on Racial Divide
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  When the prime minister of Malaysia, Najib Razak, announced Wednesday that he was dissolving Parliament, he set in motion an election campaign that will render judgment not just on his embattled governing coalition, but also on Malaysias longstanding system of dividing the power and spoils of public life on ethnic lines.

title: News Quiz | April 3, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: A Conversation With: Chess Champion Viswanathan Anand
description: It would not be exaggerating to call Viswanathan Anand a chess legend.Mr. Anand, Indias first grandmaster, has been undisputed world champion since 2007 and has successfully defended the title three times. He also is the winner of six Chess Oscars, an annual award given to the worlds most outstanding player in the opinion of chess journalists and other top players.

title: IHT Quick Read: April 3
description: NEWS North Korea on Wednesday blocked South Koreans from crossing the part of their heavily armed border that leads to an industrial park that the two nations have operated for eight years. Choe Sang-Hun reports from Seoul.

title: In Praise of Dani Alvess Pass
description: Before everyone moves on to Matchday 2 of the Champions League quarterfinals and begins worrying about what Barcelonas 2-2 tie at Paris St.-Germain and Lionel Messis hamstring injury will mean for next weeks second leg, lets take a moment to properly honor the gorgeous ball that Dani Alves sliced into Messis path for the Catalans opening goal.

title: Is the Prime Minister Changing His Tune?
description: NEW DELHIPrime Minister Manmohan Singh spoke of Indias flagging economy in a televised address Wednesday. He endorsed the need for growth that uplifts the poor, and acknowledged that the current 5 percent growth rate was disappointing, but he nonetheless urged people to be optimistic.

title: Test Yourself | Math, April 3, 2013
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Patrick Honner at Math for America from the article Coffees Economics, Rewritten by Farmers.

title: Pattycake the Gorilla Mourned
description: In A Child Star With a Knack for Publicity, N. R. Kleinfield writes about the death of a beloved Bronx Zoo gorilla.

title: Blogging a Bridge From Havana
description: Havana is a city of flags, says Orlando Luis Pardo Lazo, a Cuban blogger whose photographs show them dangling from telephone wires, draped over headstones and reflected in windows and puddles. The tricolor standard is everywhere.

title: Whats the Coolest Thing Youve Ever Seen in Nature?
description: Go to related article

title: Tensions Rise as Israel and Gaza Swap Strikes
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli-Palestinian tensions rose sharply on Wednesday, with a resumption of clashes at the Gaza border as Palestinian prisoners in Israeli jails declared a three-day hunger strike to protest a fellow inmates death, saying Israel was responsible.

title: Please  Draw Me a State
description: JERUSALEM  When Barack Obama visited Israel two weeks ago he reiterated the U.S. governments stock opposition to Israeli settlements in the West Bank: Such activity, he said, undermines peace. On the other hand, he added in Ramallah  and these were his words  The core issue right now is, how do we get sovereignty for the Palestinian people and how do we assure security for the Israeli people? That is to say, settlements no longer rank high on his agenda because if we solve those two problems, the settlement problem will be solved.

title: How Final Is a Colleges Financial Aid Offer?
description: As the end of March wraps up the suspense of college acceptances and rejections, the beginning of April tips the decision-making power to students, who must now choose where to enroll. Most students, after having received their (virtual) envelopes, have until May 1 to decide.

title: Small Companies and the Affordable Care Act
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: The Early Word: Pathway
description: Todays Times

title: Vodafone Shares Fall After Verizon Throws Cold Water on Bid Talk
description: Shares of Vodafone fell in London trading on Wednesday after Verizon Communications said it did not currently have any intention to merge with or make an offer for Vodafone, whether alone or in conjunction with others.

title: Taliban Assault on Afghan Compound Leaves Dozens Dead
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In one of the deadliest insurgent attacks in the decade-long war in Afghanistan, nine Taliban fighters dressed as Afghan soldiers stormed a government compound in the western part of the country on Wednesday morning, killing at least 44 people and wounding more than 100 in a hostage standoff.

title: Yes, Healthful Fast Food Is Possible. But Edible?
description: When my daughter was a teenager, about a dozen years ago, she went through a vegetarian phase. Back then, the payoff for orthodontist visits was a trip to Taco Bell, where the only thing we could eat were bean burritos and tacos. It wasnt my favorite meal, but the mushy beans in that soft tortilla or crisp shell were kind of soothing, and the sweet hot sauce made the experience decent enough. I usually polished off two or three.

title: Why I Like to Hire Great Recession Graduates
description: Pampered. Pragmatic. Persnickety. These are not the employee attributes that build fast-growth companies, but all three describe a group of employees that fast growth entrepreneurs must confront when hiring. Since the Great Recession of 2008, my advice to entrepreneurs is to run, baby, run when it comes to hiring this group.

title: Shares of Moleskine Fall Modestly in Trading Debut
description: 12:52 p.m. | Updated

title: 2 Deterrents to Robocalls Win F.T.C.s Contest
description: The Federal Trade Commission expressed hope that the winning proposals find their way to the marketplace soon to provide relief to millions of American consumers, Edward Wyatt writes in Wednesdays New York Times. Read more.

title: Daily Report: Databases of Retail Thefts Are Used to Bar Employment
description: Facing a wave of employee theft, retailers across the country have helped amass vast databases of workers accused of stealing and are using that information to keep employees from working again in the industry, Stephanie Clifford and Jessica Silver-Greenberg report in Wednesdays New York Times.

title: Mandela Said to Be Much Better Than a Week Ago
description: JOHANNESBURG  Former President Nelson Mandelas health is improving after nearly a week in the hospital being treated for pneumonia, South Africas government said on Wednesday.

title: I.M.F. and Europe Set Tough Terms for Cyprus Bailout
description: BRUSSELS  The International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday that it would contribute 1 billion euros, or about 10 percent, of a bailout package for Cyprus but stipulated that the country would need to take tough measures to overhaul its beleaguered economy.

title: C.E.O.s Now Free to Tweet
description: Sites like Twitter and Facebook are now considered legitimate ways for chief executives to communicate with their investors, but within certain limits. The Securities and Exchange Commission outlined disclosure rules for social media, saying on Tuesday that companies could use the tools to convey important information as long as they informed investors about that strategy ahead of time, DealBooks Michael J. de la Merced reports.

title: Google Faces More Inquiries in Europe Over Privacy Policy
description: Instead of facing one European investigation into its privacy policy, Google now has to contend with at least six of them. Data protection agencies in Britain, Germany, Italy, Spain and the Netherlands said on Tuesday that they were moving to take action against Google over the policy, which the company introduced last year. They joined the French regulator, which had initiated a European Union inquiry on behalf of its counterparts across the 27-nation bloc, Eric Pfanner writes in The New York Times. Read more.

title: Carpet Diem (but Watch Your Back)
After Twitter Tumult, Actors Regroup
description: Is anything ever easy with Alec Baldwin?

title: Opinion Report: Brain Research
description: From the editorial page

title: Tip of the Week: Keeping Web Browsers in Sync
description: Keeping the open browser tabs on a computer in sync with the browser on a mobile device can save a lot of time and e-mailing when you are on the go and need to keep working. The Google Chrome browser can keep tabs in sync between its desktop and Android mobile versions when all the devices are signed into the same Chrome account. Googles site has detailed instructions. (Mozilla has a similar Firefox Sync feature for computers and other devices that can run its Firefox browser; information on using Firefox Sync can be found here.)

title: Report Faults at All Costs Attitude at Barclays
description: 7:43 p.m. | Updated

title: Wednesday Reading: A $100 Weekend in Boston
A Timely Cat Emergency
description: Dear Diary:

title: America the Debtor
description: I guess Im going to have to write more about David Stockmans unfortunate rant, since a lot of people who should know better seem to think he made serious points. Right now, however, I just want to lay down a marker on an issue I really really do know something about: America as a net international debtor.

title: 2 Major Air Pollutants Increase in Beijing
description: BEIJING  In the first three months of this year, levels of two major air pollutants increased by almost 30 percent here in the Chinese capital, over the same period in 2012, according to a report on Wednesday by a Chinese news organization.

title: S.E.C. Sets Rules for Disclosures Using Social Media
description: Chief executives can now feel free to post, blog or tweet  as long as they inform investors about their social media strategy first, Michael J. de la Merced writes in The New York Times. Read more.

title: Now Booking | New Beds in Blighty
description: Chewton Glen, a palatial Georgian-era resort and spa in New Milton, England, recently built 12 treehouse suites. The nomenclature is a bit off the mark because not one of them is actually built into or even adequately surrounded by trees. Rather they appear like stilt homes on the Outer Banks. Still, the interiors are cozy, modern and ample. The living rooms have big half-moon couches upholstered in soft Balmoral tweed, and small wood-burning stoves that are all set up and ready to light. Among Chewton Glens more gimmicky offerings are its breakfast and other snack baskets, which you can order any time of day. They are slipped in from outside of the treehouse and arrive in a cupboard in the suites kitchenette. Its a romantic and almost courtly service. All of the suites have wraparound terraces and Jacuzzis, with views onto a wide heath that was covered in silvery frost when I visited.

title: Where YouTube Meets the Farm
description: Half of the children in India are chronically malnourished. So imagine the potential benefits if there were a simple way to increase the milk production from cows by, say, a quart per week? Or imagine if there were a better way for small farmers to cultivate rice  the staple food of half the world  one that required no costly inputs, used less water, and substantially increased yields?

title: Former Goldman Trader Pleads Guilty to Wire Fraud
description: 7:08 p.m. | Updated

title: Lack of Accord May Hurt Serbias Aim to Join European Bloc
description: PARIS  Marathon talks aimed at overcoming ethnic divisions in Kosovo ended without an agreement on Wednesday, dealing a potential blow to Serbias aspirations to join the European Union and undermining hopes of improved stability in the Balkans.

title: This Architect Was Aboard the Space Station 45 Years Ago
description: As the International Space Station flew over New York on March 23 (yielding this dazzling nighttime cityscape), its safe to say that crew members were not thinking about Danforth W. Toan. But 45 years earlier, before some of the crew members were even born, he was thinking about them.

title: Municipal Art Society Challenges Architects for New Penn Station Vision
description: In a way, its every architects dream  to re-envision Penn Station and Madison Square Garden in New York. The Municipal Art Society of New York is giving four design firms that chance with a challenge to be announced Thursday.

title: Taking Shakespeares Sonnets to the Streets of New York
description: Michael Urie, Lynn Cohen, Joanna Gleason, Austin Pendleton and Chris Sarandon are a handful of the 154 actors who will speak the speech in the yearlong Sonnet Project, an undertaking of the New York Shakespeare Exchange. The company, after raising almost $50,000 in a Kickstarter campaign, will film all of Shakespeares sonnets, each performed by a different actor in a New York City location  hence the overall cast of 154. Over the course of the next year, videos will be released singly or in small groups on the Web site SonnetProjectNYC.com, and through a soon-to-be-released mobile app.

title: Affirming Abortion Rights
description: Anti-abortion activists are nothing if not inventive. State legislatures sympathetic to the cause are constantly finding new ways to restrict the legality or availability of the procedure, passing bans on so-called partial-birth abortion, parental consent requirements, and, more recently, fetal heartbeat laws. Choking off money is also wildly popular. According to the Guttmacher Institute, 32 states and the District of Columbia prohibit the use of state funds except in cases where the womans life is at risk or the pregnancy is the result of rape or incest. Another eight states limit coverage in private insurance plans.

title: Finals: Real Madrid 3, Galatasaray 0; Mlaga 0, Borussia Dortmund 0
description: The Goal blog will provide updates and live analysis of Wednesdays UEFA Champions League matches: Mlaga at Borussia Dortmund and Real Madrid at Galatasaray beginning at 2:45 p.m. Eastern. Check back here for live updates. (Note that videos here will not play outside the United States.)

title: What Were Reading
description: The Washington Post: The solution for kale fatigue: chard.  Julia Moskin

title: Rolling Stones Announce 9-City North American Tour
description: After a week of not-so-subtle hints on billboards around the country, the Rolling Stones announced on Wednesday that the band will do a tour of nine cities in North America this summmer, starting in Los Angeles in May. That concert, at the Staples Center, will be followed by performances in Oakland; San Jose, Calif.; Las Vegas; Anaheim, Calif.; Toronto; Chicago; Boston; and Philadelphia.

title: That Other Champions League: Concacaf
description: Santos Laguna of Mexico went to the Pacific Northwest on Tuesday night and snatched a 1-0 win against the Seattle Sounders of M.L.S. in the first leg of a semifinal series in the Concacaf Champions League. The return match is next week in Torren.

title: Announcing a Leave of Presence, Ebert Says Hes Reducing His Workload
description: Not every critic makes waves when he says that hell be writing fewer than 300 reviews in a year, but then not every critic is Roger Ebert.

title: Playing It Safe
description: HO CHI MINH CITY  There had been some safe-sex campaigns in Vietnam before: university students walking around campus dressed up as condoms, a video game by U.S.A.I.D. teaching men to use protection with prostitutes and even a stylish condom dress designed for World AIDS day. Now government officials have started doing their part, too, by calling on all hotels in the city to distribute free condoms.

title: Mentally Ill, but Insanity Plea Is Long Shot
description: Slouched over in the striped gray shirt that he has worn for much of his murder trial, his piercing stare disconcertingly fixed at the courtroom walls at times, David Tarloff can appear like one of the few killers whose claim to an insanity defense might be deserved.

title: Sanfords Political Comeback
description: The Timess Kim Severson on Mark Sanfords runoff win and re-entry into politics, three years after he was plagued by political scandal as governor of South Carolina.

title: Toronto-Dominion Announces C.E.O. Succession
description: The Toronto-Dominion Bank, which is pursuing an aggressive expansion into the United States, said on Wednesday that the head of its American operation would become its chief executive late next year.

title: Britains Great Class Debate
description: LONDON  Britains obsession with class, once thought to have been swept away by a rising tide of meritocracy, appears to be undergoing a revival as a consequence of the countrys economic tribulations.

title: Misperceptions of Benefits Make Trimming Them Harder
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama had Senate Republicans nodding in agreement during a recent ice-breaking dinner as he described a basic problem for the nations fiscal future: For each dollar that Americans pay for Medicare, they ultimately draw about $3 in benefits. Whats more, he added, most people do not understand that.

title: Rutgers Leaders Are Faulted on Abusive Coach
description: Rutgers made an unconventional choice for an athletic director four years ago when it selected Tim Pernetti, a television executive who had extensive experience presenting college games on national broadcasts but had never run a college program or coached a major team.

title: The Gun Report: April 3, 2013
description: A high school graduate from the Midwest who moved to New Orleans to embark on his first project as an AmeriCorps member was gunned down on a street corner there Monday night. Joseph Massenburg, 18, was walking in the Leonidas neighborhood shortly before 11 p.m. when he was shot several times and killed. All he wanted to do was give his life to service, his father said.

title: Survey Finds Most Republicans Seek Action on Climate Change
description: Its time for that national listening tour on energy and climate, President Obama. Some evidence comes in a new survey from the Center for Climate Change Communication at George Mason University (seen via Tom Yulsman on Facebook). Heres an excerpt from the news release:

title: Leading Off: Rutgers Runs Off the Rails
description: The news Tuesday could have revolved around Carmelo Anthonys 50 points against the Heat, Yu Darvishs almost no-hitter for the Rangers or the idea that the Mavericks owner Mark Cuban might draft Brittney Griner.

title: Finding the Right Summer Day Camp
description: Now is the time to get your kids into summer day camp, if you havent already. Parents of children returning to camp, or of younger siblings following their elders, have it easy (and are probably already signed up). But if this will be your childs first summer of day camp, the choice may feel more difficult.

title: Want the Lowest Drug Price? Make Sure to Ask
description: In its latest analysis of prescription drug prices, Consumer Reports comes up with some advice that sounds almost retro: when shopping for medicine, ask for the lowest possible price.

title: Free Internet Access
description: Free hotel Internet service may be reaching a tipping point. The InterContinental Hotels Group (IHG) is offering free Internet to its 71 million loyalty program members over the next year. Elite members of the IHG Rewards Club will get free Internet access beginning in July when staying at any of the companys nine hotel brands, including InterContinental Hotels & Resorts, Hotel Indigo, Crowne Plaza, Staybridge Suites and Holiday Inn. The rest of the programs members will get the free service starting in early 2014.

title: Kickstarters
description: The architect Rafael de Crdenas has electrified Rivieras, the classic French slip-on, with a sharp new pattern available in four color combos. De Crdenas says the shoe brand was a natural fit for him. I like their form and shape as well as their nod to the 60s and 70s French Riviera summer culture, he says. I also like that they are called a leisure shoe, almost as though wearing them might relax you regardless of whether youre leisurely or not. $100; Opening Ceremony, (212) 219-2688.

title: Kia and Hyundai Are Recalling 1.9 Million Vehicles in Three Actions
description: Kia and its parent company Hyundai are recalling almost 1.9 million vehicles in three actions, according to reports posted on Wednesday on the Web site of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: Tantalizing New Clues Into the Mysteries of Dark Matter
description: The dark side of the universe is whispering, but scientists are still not sure what it is saying.

title: Reports on Barclays
description: New Yorks attorney general contends that Barclays favored high-frequency traders over other investors in its dark pool.

title: Businesses of Varied Sizes Find Customer Relationship Help
description: Kelly Fallis has inadvertently become something of an expert on customer-relationship management, or C.R.M., software. She has gone through eight platforms in three years as chief executive of RemoteStylist, a five-employee company, based in Toronto and with an operation in New York, that provides free design advice and sells furniture at discounted prices.

title: Trade Deadline Day: Rangers Send Gaborik to Columbus
description: As the N.H.L. trading deadline at 3 p.m. approached, the Rangers blew up their lineup, trading forward Marian Gaborik to the Columbus Blue Jackets. In return, the Rangers will receive three relatively obscure players: forwards Derick Brassard and Derek Dorsett and defenseman John Moore. Dorsett is out indefinitely with a broken collarbone.

title: Oven-Steamed Arctic Char With Piperade
description: Arctic char, a cold-water pink-fleshed fish, is farmed in a more sustainable way than salmon and has the same good Omega-3s. Simply steamed in a low oven, it is complemented here with a sweet and savory pepper sauce. The sauce is great with just about any fish. Try it with a whole grilled striped bass (another one of Seafood Watchs Best Choices).

title: Inside Orleans Parish Prison
description: Excepts from video taken four years ago depict drug use, an inmate brandishing a gun and others drinking and gambling. Warning: portions of this video contain graphic content.

title: Image of the Day: April 3
Striped Bass or Mahi Mahi With Fennel, Leeks and Tomatoes
description: Fennel is a classic accompaniment to fish throughout the Mediterranean. Any firm white fish will work here. Porgy and sea bass are also good choices. The sauce is almost like a vegetable ragout.

title: Do Small Businesses Understand the Customer Relationship Systems They Buy?
description: As discussed in the small-business guide we have just published, large businesses have long used customer relationship management software to automate sales and marketing and to manage their interactions with customers. In the last several years, though, small businesses have started using this kind of software, too. In part, thats because the programs have become cheaper and easier to use.

title: New Boss at the Louvre
description: PARIS  Jean-Luc Martinez, the head of the Louvres department of Greek, Etruscan and Roman antiquities, was named the museums new director on Wednesday.

title: Parental Loss
description: The death of a parent is a subject most people instinctively shy away from. That is, until it hits home; then parents, teachers, therapists and other caregivers are grateful for picture books that grapple with the hardest stuff faced by young children  whether its the loss of a grandparent or a pet, or in the case of Missing Mommy, one of the worst experiences of all.

title: A Big Data Weapon for the Mobile Ad Challenge
description: The march of mobile is following the usual evolutionary path in media  first come the eyeballs and later comes the money. People spend an estimated 10 percent of their media attention staring at their smartphones and tablets, but mobile advertising accounts for a small fraction of 1 percent of total advertising spending.

title: 60 Seconds With Pogue: Cellphone Billing
description: David Pogue says T-Mobiles billing makes a lot more sense than that of its competitors.

title: Ruth Prawer Jhabvala, Screenwriter, Dies at 85
description: Ruth Prawer Jhabvala, the German-born screenwriter and novelist who, as the writing member of the Merchant Ivory filmmaking team, won two Academy Awards for adaptations of genteel, class-conscious E. M. Forster novels, died on Wednesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 85.

title: How Meditation Might Boost Your Test Scores
description: Mindfulness meditation, the ancient and flourishing practice that increases awareness of random thoughts and redirects attention to the present moment, has been used to manage stress, depression and even chronic pain. But can it improve test scores?

title: Finding the Human Factor in Bank Risk
description: When he left physics, John Breit had the choice of a job in naval intelligence or on Wall Street. My wife said I couldnt be a spy. She hates capitalism, but said to go to Wall Street, he told me recently. And then I ended up running a spy network.

title: Pitkanens Injury Renews Debate About Icing Rule
description: After Carolina Hurricanes defenseman Joni Pitkanen broke his heel in a high-speed icing race on Tuesday night, there were revived calls to do away with traditional icing, which can lead to what the former Maple Leafs coach Ron Wilson called train wreck injuries.

title: A Broadway Baby Bids Goodbye to New York
description: When is it time for a great entertainer to say goodbye to the stage? Watching Elaine Stritch, 88, in the opening-night show of her five-night farewell engagement at the Caf Carlyle on Tuesday, I reflected that in cabaret, a genre that venerates the wisdom and experience of great ladies of a certain age, nobody wants to stop. As long as people are willing to pay to see them, why shouldnt they continue?

title: Leno Blesses Tonight Show Succession Plan
description: Steve Burke had seen enough. For months, the NBC chief executive had been involved in efforts to create a smooth transition at the Tonight show. Yet for most of March, after Jay Leno had been taken to task by a network executive over jokes about NBCs poor ratings, the news media were full of reports that the network once again was mishandling its most storied late-night franchise.

title: Breaking It Down: Murray vs. Ferrer
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Andy Murrays fitness coach Jez Green deserves a raise.

title: Expanding in Asia
description: If youre going to Asia, expect to see that glowing W emblem more often. The hotel chain has just opened a hotel in Guangzhou  its first in mainland China  and plans to open 10 more properties in cities including Shanghai (above), Mumbai and Kuala Lumpur, doubling its footprint in Asia.

title: A Passion for Jean Prouv
description: A Passion for Jean Prouv, which opens on Saturday at the Pinacoteca Giovanni e Marella Agnelliin Turin, Italy, examines the architecture and furniture of Prouv (1901-84), the pioneering 20th-century designer, from the collections of Laurence and Patrick Seguin. The couple, who own Galerie Patrick Seguin in Paris, which specializes in 20th-century Modernist design, have been collecting Prouvs work since the late 1980s. The exhibition, which includes about 40 pieces, features worksmany of them prototypes or rare itemsthat range in scale from the chair that Prouv designed for the University of Antony in 1954 to his aluminum Maison Metropole, a 1949 design for rural schools and teacher housing that could be mass produced, although only two of these buildings were ever made. This one has been reassembled (a stop-motion film of the construction can be seen on the Pinacotecas Web site) on the famous test track atop the Lingotto, the former Fiat factory that now houses the Pinacoteca.

title: Possible Path to Vaccine for AIDS Is Suggested
description: In what may be an important step toward a long-elusive AIDS vaccine, American researchers have minutely tracked one persons powerful immune response to the virus to see how a series of mutations led to an antibody that can defeat many H.I.V. strains.

title: Assessing the Safety of New York Streets
description: The Timess Matt Flegenheimer takes to the New York streets to show how new research trumps traditional ideas about pedestrian and bike safety.

title: My Life. My College Choice. (Sorry, Friends.)
description: Editors Note: This post was written before most college decisions were released. Well have more updates about the authors admission results in the coming days. Stay tuned.  Tanya Abrams

title: Breaking Free of the Cellphone Carrier Conspiracy
description: Where, exactly, is your threshold for outrage?

title: Is China the New Taiwan?
description: BEIJING  The date says it all: the Taipei Womens Rescue Foundation, a leading womens rights group, was formally registered in September 1987, just two months after Taiwans leader, Chiang Ching-kuo, lifted martial law, legalizing the political opposition. Many civil society groups that had long been gathering ideas and forces sprang into action.

title: Barclays Need for a Culture Change
description: The Salz review into management practices at Barclays shows just how much the bank needs a cultural renaissance. It pulls few punches in its assessment: The bank grew too fast, vested too much power at the top and became difficult to manage.

title: Guns, Guns, Guns
description: Gail Collins: David, I know weve both been felled by the flu lately. I had a shot. Did you? I was thinking today we could talk about the danger of creating a false sense of security.

title: Everything Familiar Is About to Disappear: Tracy Thompson Talks About the South
description: In her book The New Mind of the South, Tracy Thompson tours the region and analyzes the forces  both familiar and new  that are shaping the way its residents live and relate to each other. In a recent e-mail interview, Ms. Thompson discussed the classic book echoed in her title, her geographic definition of the South, race, class and more. Below are edited excerpts from the conversation:

title: Inherited Tactics in North Korea
description: An analyst from the Center for Strategic and International Studies says the abrasive actions of the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, are part of a game plan set by his father.

title: The Debate Over Stem-Cell Face-Lifts
description: When Eva Campbell-Morales was in her early 40s, she noticed that her face, which was naturally thin, was suddenly starting to look gaunt and old. Being thin meant I looked great in my jeans, but my face looked like the crypt keeper, said Ms. Campbell-Morales, 51, an actress and Spanish translator. She saw several doctors in pursuit of a traditional face-lift, but no one would agree that was what she needed. Finally, she saw Dr. Nathan Newman, a Beverly Hills, Calif., dermatologist, who persuaded her to try a newer procedure called a stem-cell face-lift.

title: Columbus Circle, 9:27 A.M.
Pushing Paternity Leave Helps Working Mothers
description: How best to encourage women to lean in to the work force? Encourage men to lean in at home.

title: Big Change Confirmed for Tonight Show
description: The Timess Bill Carter reports after interviewing Jay Leno and Jimmy Fallon about who will be hosting The Tonight Show.

title: How Do You Keep Track of It All?
description: In an opinion article in The New York Times in January, Olivia Judson wrote about the Google calendar she and her brother shared to better cope with their fathers decline. Each time either of us spoke to our father, we marked it on the calendar  what time of day it was, how he sounded, what we spoke about, she wrote. The upshot was that we had an excellent record of how he was  whether he was getting out, if he was cheerful or feeling low, changes to his medicines, any falls he said he had had. It became a record of his final days: Laughs, tears, worries, frustrations, joy and love  its all in the calendar, she wrote.

title: House Hunting in ... Scotland
description: A THREE-STORY VICTORIAN IN EDINBURGH

title: A Historic Edinburgh Victorian
description: A five-bedroom sandstone Victorian in the Blacket Conservation Area is on the market for $2.4 million.

title: In a Budget Gesture, Obama Will Return 5% of His Salary
description: President Obama plans to return 5 percent of his salary to the Treasury in solidarity with federal workers who are going to be furloughed as part of the automatic budget cuts known as the sequester, an administration official said Wednesday.

title: Opening Up, Students Transform a Vicious Circle
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  There is little down time in Eric Butlers classroom.

title: Road Tripping to Australias Other Great Reef
description: After a hair-raising, tire-spinning, engine-overheating, two-and-a-half-hour drive through soft, shifting sand in temperatures well over 100 degrees, we reached the end of a thin peninsula jutting into the oceans void. There, near the westernmost point in Australia, a tableau more stunning than the heat stretched out below us.

title: Defusing Conflict in Schools
description: Restorative justice is a program taking root in schools in Oakland, Calif., that seek an alternative to punitive policies like suspension and expulsion.

title: Australias Wild West Coast
description: Just when you think the landscape is dramatic, marine life trumps it.

title: What You Get for ... $2.3 Million
description: PALM BEACH, FLA.

title: Teamwork Wins, 1973 Knicks Will Remind Us
description: History is beckoning the Knicks these days, but which will be the more powerful calling, the individual measure of lasting greatness or the consummate joy of collective achievement?

title: What You Get for $2.3 Million
description: Homes in Palm Beach, Fla., Boise, Idaho, and Highland Park, Tex.

title: Timberlake Reigns at No. 1 on Album Chart
description: Justin Timberlakes comeback album, The 20/20 Experience (RCA), holds at No. 1 for a second week on the Billboard chart, beating a slew of new releases by Lil Wayne, Blake Shelton, the pop band OneRepublic and others.

title: New Rebel Gains Reported in Southern Syria With Seizure of Military Base
description: Syrias insurgency appeared to make further territorial gains in the south on Wednesday, antigovernment activists reported, saying that rebel fighters had seized a military base near the city of Daraa, where the uprising against President Bashar al-Assad first began more than two years ago.

title: Americans Attitudes Toward Owning a House Have Changed
description: Even as the housing market improves, Americans seem more willing to embrace renting as an alternative to homeownership, a new survey on housing attitudes from the MacArthur Foundation finds.

title: Weather Channels Challenge: Predictable Programming for Advertisers
description: Eyebrows usually rise when the Weather Channel makes upfront presentations, sharing with marketers and agencies its programming plans for the coming television season. As one reader of this blog commented on a post on Tuesday that mentioned in passing the Weather Channels 2013-14 upfront, I cant wait to see which hurricanes theyll be covering this summer. : )

title: Viral Video Helps Oust Rutgers Coach
description: The Timess Steve Eder on how video helped push administrators at Rutgers to fire the universitys basketball coach, Mike Rice.

title: For the Rockets, It Really Is Science
description: When Houston Rockets General Manager Daryl Morey signed a four-year contract extension in March, it signaled a victory not just for his wallet, but also for the numbers movement. The extension validated the idea that Morey and other stats guys could last.

title: At Sharpton Event, Kelly Discusses a Shared Concern With a Wary Audience
description: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly sat in the front row of a large hotel conference room on Wednesday morning, waiting for his turn to speak about New York Citys gun violence.

title: A Sad History of Abusive Coaches
description: Unfortunately, Mike Rices antics as the Rutgers mens basketball coach falls into an all-too-rich history of coaches who crossed the line between garden variety berating of players (usually euphemistically called intensity) and out-and-out abuse.

title: Ask Well: Dried or Fresh Blueberries?
description: Do dried blueberries provide the same antioxidant benefits as fresh berries?

description: (function($) {var data = chameleonData[0];var beforeAfterContainer = $('#nytmm_beforeAfter_wrapper395 .nytmm_beforeAfter_container');var options = {leftImage: data.images.left.leftImage,rightImage: data.images.right.rightImage,showFooter: data.footer.showFooter,leftCredit: data.images.left.leftCredit,rightCredit: data.images.right.rightCredit,caption: data.footer.caption,startPoint: data.images.startPoint,showButton: data.footer.button.showButton,leftButtonText: data.footer.button.leftButtonText,rightButtonText: data.footer.button.rightButtonText}beforeAfterContainer.BeforeAfter(options);})(jQuery||NYTD.jQuery);

title: A Weatherproof Case for the iPhone
description: Pelican Products makes protective cases favored by the military because they are practically bombproof.

title: Budget Constraints Forcing an Overhaul in Military Operations, Hagel Says
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel, facing inevitable steep cuts in military spending even as global threats remain high, said Wednesday that he is being forced to consider fundamental changes in how the Pentagon defends American interests and conducts its daily business.

title: Look Whos Taking a Pay Cut
description: Yesterday I wrote that the lucky ducks in Congress are exempt from the sequester. Head Start programs are cutting back; the White House furloughed 480 people; but Congressional salaries will remain intact, because theyre not appropriated by Congress or included in presidential budgets.

title: As Business Lending Rises, Concerns Emerge About Profit
description: On the economic scene, it would seem heartening to see a surge in loans that banks are making to corporations of all sizes. The loans help finance business expansion, which may lead to jobs growth. And it shows that banks dont have to pile back into real estate loans, recently the source of crippling losses, to grow.

title: Company With Aspirations to Make Police Cars Abandons Its Indiana Offices
description: The small town of Connersville, Ind., has closed the books on the Carbon Motors Corporation, an Indiana start-up that had moved to town in 2009 to manufacture and sell police vehicles, but was turned down last year for an Energy Department loan.

title: Subway Service Is Returning to Old South Ferry Station
description: More than five months after Hurricane Sandy battered South Ferry station, blowing a hole in the subway map in Lower Manhattan, service will return to the stop on Thursday for the first time since the storm, officials said.

title: Midterm Elections Unlikely to Alter Party Balance
description: WASHINGTON  Like the current shape of divided government here? Didnt think so.

title: Spanish Princess Is Subpoenaed in Embezzlement Case
description: MADRID  A subpoena was issued Wednesday for a daughter of King Juan Carlos of Spain as part of a widening investigation into whether her husband embezzled millions of euros from a sports charity, further tarnishing the image of the monarchy at a moment when corruption cases have shaken virtually every public institution in Spain.

title: Irish Search for Billionaires Assets Leads to Russia
description: MOSCOW  The Irish Bank Resolution Company is working with one of Russias largest banks to help find and seize assets in the former Soviet Union that belong to Sean Quinn, a bankrupt Irish billionaire who was once Irelands richest man.

title: Prison Isnt the Only Place Where Sentences Are Served
description: Confinement pervades Eric John Meyers play The Sister, at the Fourth Street Theater. You see it in Sara C. Walshs striking set, a living room under refurbishment. Comprising a half-painted wall and sets of vertical wooden roof supports, it suggests a jail cell into which audience members, sitting just outside it, peer through wooden bars.

title: Madonna Selling Lger Painting to Benefit Girls Education
description: Madonna has decided to sell Trois Femmes  la Table Rouge, a 1921 painting by Fernand Lger at Sothebys in New York on May 7th to benefit girls education projects in Afghanistan, Pakistan and other countries.

title: Theyre Back  Learning About Periodical Cicadas to Participate in Citizen Science Projects
description: Updated | May 9, 2013.

title: Magazine Cover Features Yankees Medicated Row
description: The cover of The New Yorker this week portrays the Yankees aging and wounded stars arranged on a baseline at Yankee Stadium as if they had just been introduced on opening day.

title: Getting Back More From Medicare, Less From Social Security
description: Analysts say that Medicare beneficiaries on average pay about $1 for every $3 in benefits, but for Social Security beneficiaries who retired in 2010, the amount was about even.

title: Its Been Chilly, Exceptionally So
description: Boy has it been not-very-warm lately. How not-very-warm has it been? Kind of history-makingly, reports Stephen Fybish, City Rooms semiofficial amateur New York City weather enthusiast, who left us the following message Tuesday:

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Anonymous vs. North Korea, and Hijacked Webcams
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: When Jim Morrison Loved Mashed Potatoes
description: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=BhszZ53SEC8

title: Scene City: Vice Premieres on HBO
description: The media elite turn out for a stomach-churning screening

title: For a Night, Out of Harms Way
description: Vice, a new HBO docu-series created by the same guys behind the Williamsburg-based lad magazine, makes Girls look like a tea party. With segments about child suicide bombers, Philippines election shootings and the Kashmir border (not to mention Dennis Rodman with Kim Jong-un in North Korea), the program sends tattoo-covered correspondents into places only adrenaline-fueled fatalists could love.

title: Dozens of Argentines Die in Flash Flooding
description: BUENOS AIRES  Record flash floods in Argentina have killed at least 54 people this week, officials said on Wednesday, destroying thousands of homes and renewing tensions as politicians blamed one another for the high death toll.

title: Dementia Care Cost Is Projected to Double by 2040
description: The most rigorous study to date of how much it costs to care for Americans with dementia found that the financial burden is at least as high as that of heart disease or cancer, and is probably higher. And both the costs and the number of people with dementia will more than double within 30 years, skyrocketing at a rate that rarely occurs with a chronic disease.

title: Investigating One Type of Corruption, and Finding Another
description: Why did State Senator Malcolm A. Smith allegedly bribe Republican officials to run in the partys mayoral primary instead of doing it the old-fashioned way  by contributing to the partys coffers?

title: The Smartest Ways to Keep Fit
description: Have you ever wondered whether you can lose more weight by working out harder for a shorter time? Or whether consuming energy drinks during exercise can increase stamina? Is running barefoot a good idea?

title: Steps and Missteps at Guantnamo Bay
description: Even by the lax standards of Washington political rhetoric, the recurring debate over military tribunals stands out as especially unmoored from reality.

title: How to Shield Yourself From Smartphone Snoops
description: Your smartphone knows more about you than any other device, and it can so easily get into the wrong hands.

title: N.F.L. to Install Cameras in Locker Rooms for Stadium Viewing
description: In its quest to keep fans in the stands, and give them a reason not to view games in high definition in their livings rooms, the N.F.L. will put cameras into all home team locker rooms next season. Then they will encourage the teams to use the video on their stadium scoreboards, to give fans who buy tickets an inside look at what goes on in the teams inner sanctums.

title: In Selfish Sons and Trolls, Swollen Egos Stride the Stage
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  How exactly do we become the people we are? That knotty question hovered in the air at the Humana Festival of New American Plays at the Actors Theater here. The most intriguing works in the festival, now under the direction of Les Waters, take the audience on engrossing journeys through the thick underbrush of the human psyche as it is shaped by family, society and the divided impulses of the self.

title: Who Is Bridget Foley?
description: Ms. Foleys reports from fashions front lines, her coverage of major collections and, perhaps even more, her pronouncements on the state of the industry carry the sort of weight that makes Womens Wear Daily a must-read.

title: Corcoran Announces Proposed Partnership With University of Maryland
description: With $130 million-worth of needed renovations looming, the Corcoran Gallery of Art in Washington was in need of help. On Wednesday, the board of trustees announced that a memorandum of understanding to pursue a partnership with the University of Maryland.

title: A Love Letter to Seattle | Doug Aitkens MIRROR
description: Mountain ranges. Airplane hangars. Trains and lakes. In Doug Aitkens latest video art project, MIRROR, images of city and country dissolve into graphic patterns. The work, Aitkens first permanent installation, is displayed on a giant LED screen thats wrapped around the facade of the Seattle Art Museum. Its part video, part light display: columns of light brighten the building in time with the film, which highlights the beauty of Seattle and Washington State. The video feed is said to respond to conditions outside the museum  weather, traffic and the like. On March 24, Terry Riley and the Seattle Symphony were on hand to inaugurate Aitkens first-ever permanent installation for a public museum with a live performance of Rileys In C. The video above features highlights from the event.

title: In Mortgage Case, Dexia Claims Against JPMorgan Barred
description: A federal judge dealt a devastating blow to a lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase that accused the nations largest bank and its affiliates of duping investors into buying troubled mortgage-backed securities.

title: The Seat of Power
description: In her front-row seat at the Calvin Klein fall 2013 show in February, Bridget Foley was a study in reticence. Her dun-colored coat, a Prada of uncertain vintage, and a face devoid of makeup lent her a muted air.

title: Despite Loss, Townsend Has New Confidence
description: DANIEL ISLAND, S.C.  Taylor Townsend lost fairly quickly at the 2013 Family Circle Cup, falling 6-3, 6-0 to fellow wild card Andrea Petkovic in a first-round match Monday at this island community adjacent to Charleston.

title: Pictures of the Day: West Bank and Elsewhere
description: Photos from the West Bank, India, Myanmar and Virginia.

title: For Friars, Finding Renewal by Sticking to Tradition
description: CORK, Ireland  The Rev. Gerard Dunne has worked for 12 years essentially as a human-resources recruiter  albeit one in a habit cinched with a dangling wooden rosary  for the ancient order of the Dominican friars. Once, his medieval robes may have deterred some. But today he is convinced that the garment is his greatest selling point for enlisting new priests.

title: No Comment Necessary: The Wussification of American Men
description: Via Think Progress

title: High-Speed Stitching, Full of Joy
description: The performances that the superlative Argentine tangoists Gabriel Miss and Anala Centurin give in New York are late-night affairs, with the result that a working dance critic usually comes to them after another performance. Over the past 13 months Ive therefore seen them within an hour or two of superb performances by American Ballet Theater, the Paul Taylor Dance Company and, on Tuesday, Lil Buck. Each time, as Ive arrived, Ive feared that the tangoists will pale by comparison. Each time the opposite has proved true.

title: A Mid-19th-Century Milestone in the Rise of Cities
description: It was to elevators what the phrase Mr. Watson, come here was to telephones: Cut the rope.

title: A French Auction Riles an American Tribe
description: An auction house in Paris plans to auction many sacred Hopi artifacts, over the objections of the tribe.

title: Hopis Try to Stop Paris Sale of Artifacts
description: In a rare case of a cultural heritage claim arising from the sale of American artifacts abroad, the Hopi Indians of Arizona have asked federal officials to help stop a high-price auction of 70 sacred masks in Paris next week.

title: A Serial Killer Now Prepared for TV Dinners
description: There is one reason, and only one reason, that the name Hannibal has become synonymous with gleefully stomach-churning horror: Anthony Hopkinss tour-de-force performance, both chilling and hilarious, in Jonathan Demmes 1991 film, The Silence of the Lambs. Everything before and since  the four Hannibal Lecter novels by Thomas Harris, the four other films with or without Mr. Hopkins  has gone to the bank because of the way he wrapped his lips around Good evening, Clarice.

title: Fun, Intrigue and Drama in Touch-Screen Adventures
description: Ive loved adventure games since I was young. Its a passion that began with choose-your-own-adventure books and grew with the games for my wonderful 8-bit home computer. Now we have smartphones and tablets, and no matter how cool those early adventure games were, they cant rival the fun, intrigue and drama of playing a point-and-click adventure on a touch screen.

title: Hip-Hop Meets Ballet in One Mans Body
description: As  Lil Buck  performed with an array of distinguished musicians on Tuesday night at Le Poisson Rouge, a series of extraordinary windows seemed to open, each revealing a new and unimagined realm. That was surely the evenings intention: a primer in the dance style of this young and phenomenal practitioner of Memphis jookin, a footwork-focused idiom that grew out of hip-hop. There were two performances only, at 7 and 10, but it seems obvious that they must lead to others.

title: Shopping Snapshots: April 4
description: The leather motorcycle jacket is getting a kick in the pants for spring; a new Midtown store opens; a young milliner freshens headbands with feathers and stones; and other shopping news.

title: Excerpt: 'Hannibal'
description: The new NBC series stars Mads Mikkelsen as a younger version of Hannibal Lecter.

title: Government Watchdog Faults Regulators Over Foreclosure Review
description: Federal authorities plan to issue a stinging critique of how banking regulators responded to wide-ranging foreclosure abuses, blaming officials for a bureaucratic maze that delayed relief to homeowners.

title: Vanderbilt Knockout Teams
description: ST. LOUIS  Some North American Bridge Championships yield few interesting deals. In contrast some, like the one here last month, harvest many.

title: City Leaves Police Official Without Lawyer to Fight Protesters Lawsuit
description: For the second time in a case stemming from Occupy Wall Street demonstrations, city lawyers are not stepping forward to defend a police commander accused of mistreating protesters, according to court papers filed on Wednesday.

title: Gentlemen, Start Your Calculators: Checking the Math of Teslas Lend-Lease Program
description: The announcement on Tuesday by Elon Musk, chief executive of Tesla Motors, of a hybrid lease-purchase plan for its Model S electric luxury sedan, coupled with a guaranteed buyback program for three-year-old cars, generated a great deal of Internet buzz and a lot of armchair number-crunching.

title: Now They Come to Her
description: Danielle Levitt, a fashion photographer, was sitting at her new bar and restaurant, Wise Men, wedged in an old town house on the Bowery.

title: U.S. Embassy in Cairo Scrubs Twitter Feed of Link to Daily Show Commentary on Egypt
description: In a belated attempt at damage control, the United States Embassy in Cairo edited its official Twitter feed on Wednesday to remove an update that drew attention to video of the American comedian Jon Stewarts withering criticism of Egypts government.

title: Sense, Sensibility and Elbow Grease
description: When it comes to demanding clients,Diana Ross has nothing on Jane Austen.

title: Sales at Ct France, Crate & Barrel and Others
description: Many handmade resin accessories are up to 80 percent off at Dinosaur Designs, from Friday to Monday (the small Beetle vase, originally $125, will be $50); 211 Elizabeth Street (Prince Street), (212) 680-3523, dinosaurdesigns.com.au.

title: Plywood Bends to an Architects Will
description: Next week, the Pritzker Prize-winning architect Tadao Ando will introduce his first production piece: a chair called Dream, for the Danish company Carl Hansen & Son. The chair, which will be shown during the Milan Furniture Fair, is a single sheet of curved plywood set on a plywood base.

title: Molding the Glow
description: Founded in 1586, Cristalleries de Saint-Louis is the oldest glass manufacturer in France, but its taking a 21st century approach to new products. Next week in Milan during Euroluce, the lighting show held every other year during the international furniture fair, it will introduce three lighting collections by celebrated women designers: Kiki van Eijk, Paola Navone and Ionna Vautrin. Ms. van Eijk, who is based in the Netherlands and is best known for unique or limited-edition objects, found inspiration in the thousands of old molds she discovered in the factorys warehouse. Her design, Matrice (French for matrix), takes the shape of one of those molds. Illuminated by LEDs, Matrice is available as a sconce, table lamp or floor lamp in a copper or nickel frame with a matte or bright finish. The table lamp, shown in copper, stands 15  inches tall and is $14,200. Information: (212) 835-6448.

title: In London, Plan a Visit to a Tropical Island
description: The idea of being shipwrecked on a tropical island has lost luster since the 2000 film Cast Away portrayed Tom Hanks performing dental surgery on himself with a piece of flotsam. But Tord Boontje is restoring romance to the concept, while commenting on the creative potential sparked by a desolate economy.

title: Cottage at Home in Coconut Grove
description: Home-design books are often homages to a particular style, era or corner of the world, and with that homogeneity a dreaded sameness can set in. Which is why The Tropical Cottage: At Home in Coconut Grove, due out later this month from Rizzoli ($50), is such a delight. Simple bungalows are set against more ornate Mediterranean-style homes. A 1910 clapboard Key West-style farmhouse gets equal billing with an art-drenched midcentury modern suburban spread. And lush gardens, large and small, beckon from many pages.

title: A Personal Stamp on the Skyline
description: It is beautiful, isnt it? Tapping a shaft of white marble in the lobby of the Seagram Building, the bespoke modern tower she willed into being more than 50 years ago, Phyllis Lambert was as close to wistful as her rather unsentimental constitution would allow. I consider I was born when I built this building, she said.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. There are ugly security bars on the windows of my ground-floor apartment. What can I do to improve the view?

title: The Sharp Rise in A.D.H.D. Diagnoses
description: To the Editor:

title: A Rug Expert Keeps Her Eyes on the Floor
description: Is this rug worth cleaning? If its wall-to-wall, hire a professional in-home carpet cleaner. But for wool, silk, cotton, Navajo, Turkish, Afghani, Berber, Chinese or other woven rugs, the answer can often be found on the blog Rug Chick. Lisa Wagner, Rug Chick herself, is an owner with her mother of K. Blatchfords Rug Cleaning in San Diego. Ms. Wagner teaches rug cleaning to professionals; her next workshop, in McKeesport, Pa., is April 24 through 26. I share our mistakes over the decades, she said. Ms. Wagner was born into the business; her father, Don Blatchford  her parents are long divorced  is a rug broker. Her mother, Kate Blatchford, is a weaver and rug-repair specialist. Ms. Wagner is, in other words, a rug geek. Im part of a Facebook group, she said, that posts pictures daily asking, Whats my rug and wheres its from?

title: A Puppy Called Marvin
description: Clara, who lives in Harlem, is a sociable creature. Every day, she rushes to meet her friends in Morningside Park. Along the way she salutes the neighbors: Hi, Hazel. Hi, Harold. Great to see you, Fern.

title: Whats in a (Dog) Name?
description: Alexandra Horowitz, a dog cognition expert, interviews dog owners about the names of their pets.

title: You Named Me Brutus? Really?
description: What to name the new puppy?

title: Makeshift Headgear Needed for Such a Cold Night
description: With the temperature plunging before Wednesday nights game at Yankee Stadium, Chris Stewart tried to prepare for batting practice as best he could.

title: Chew on This
description: A canine parade.

title: Gay Marriage and Freedom
description: To the Editor:

title: A Gucci-Fueled Pursuit of a New Sense of Identity
description: The Internet came alive last week with frenzied commentary about the confessional by the Pulitzer Prize winner Buzz Bissinger in the April issue of GQ, an epic tale of a writer stoking a compulsive-shopping disorder with huge doses of Gucci. The article was a classic in glossy magazine moralism, well timed both to lure and shock readers still attempting to stagger out of the slough of an inert economy. What do you mean Buzz Bissinger spent $638,412.97 on clothing? Thats 9,388 pairs of Dockers, or enough to outfit almost 400 of the high school football teams Mr. Bissinger came to fame writing about.

title: A Singular Vision
description: After her marriage broke up, an editor relished designing for one.

title: Some Assembly Required
description: Despite the chaotic economic and real estate climate of the last decade or so, it is still the case that the young and innovative can take root and even flower in New York City. Amy Azzarito, 35, is proof that those in the creative classes have not all decamped to Pittsburgh or Philadelphia, and that you can repurpose old-media skills and appetites for a new-media world.

title: Shopping for Coat Racks
description: Because there are never enough closets.

title: Coat Racks
description: Since the official start of spring, temperatures have been fluctuating wildly  by as much as 20 degrees on any given day  leaving New Yorkers in need of a wide variety of coats.

description: Store Events
