description: To the Editor:

title: All Boathouses Challenged to Race Gowanuss Fetid Course
description: Sure, you were captain of your college crew team, but are you man or woman enough for the Gowanus Canal regatta?

title: Gambling Addiction
description: To the Editor:

title: Global Branding in Their Blood
description: It has been widely noted that couples over time start to look alike: mannerisms, facial expressions, style of dress. The Kooples, a fashion label that hails from Paris via London and recently set up at Bloomingdales in New York, takes this last point to heart. Its mens and womens collections are designed to complement each other, even be shared.

title: A Chilly Start to the Season for the Mets
description: The Mets will be fighting the cold while trying to get off to a hot start this season. Nighttime temperatures in the low 40s were forecast for Citi Field this week, and the cold air was expected to be accompanied by blustery winds.

title: Financing Hospitals
description: To the Editor:

title: Nesting Is Better Back Home
description: HILLSBOROUGH, N.C.  Even when she was living near Boston, teaching at Harvard and Brandeis, married to a Northerner and raising two small Yankees, Jill McCorkle never left the South  in her mind, at least. Her associations and conversations, like so many of her stories and her new novel, Life After Life (Algonquin), drew on memories of small-town North Carolina, particularly her childhood in the downstate community of Lumberton, in the 60s and 70s.

title: Reward for Less Recidivism
description: To the Editor:

title: Airports in China Hew to an Unswerving Flight Path
description: SHANGHAI  For those frustrated with air travel in the United States, arriving at this citys domestic airport can be a treat.

title: Marcum to Visit Team Doctors
description: Shaun Marcum was expected to fly from Port St. Lucie, Fla., to New York on Thursday morning to see team doctors about the lingering pain he has been experiencing around his shoulder and neck.

title: Does Anyone Here Speak Art and Tech?
description: Chelsea is a Manhattan neighborhood long associated with warehouselike spaces filled with contemporary art, icy gallerinas who ignore all but the most well-heeled customers, and schmoozy Thursday nights, where the sidewalks of the West 20s are crowded with visitors smoking and drinking room-temperature white wine as they make their way from one show opening to another.

title: Return of a Dixie Chick
description: After a life up north, Jill McCorkle settles down on a 19th-century farm in North Carolina.

title: Breeding Pigeons on Rooftops, and Crossing Racial Lines
description: When New Yorkers consider the subculture of people who raise pigeons on rooftops, many are likely to think of Terry Malloy, the longshoreman in the 1954 film On the Waterfront played by Marlon Brando. He was a classic rooftop breeder, rough-hewed, working-class and white ethnic to his toes.

title: Paris Employs a Few Black Sheep to Tend, and Eat, a City Field
description: PARIS  The archivists requested a donkey, but what they got from the mayors office were four wary black sheep, which, as of Wednesday morning, were chewing away at a lumpy field of grass beside the municipal archives building as the City of Pariss newest, shaggiest lawn mowers.

title: Beauty Spots
description: Collagen, long used as filler for wrinkles, has been moving from the face to other parts of the head.

title: Alabama Legislature Passes New Limits on Abortion Clinics
description: The Alabama Legislature late Tuesday adopted stringent new regulations for abortion clinics that supporters called a step to protect women but that others called medically unnecessary and a disguised effort to force the closing of the states five abortion clinics.

title: Bote
description: The restaurateurs Larry Poston and Johnny Swet are known for hard-to-get-into night spots like Jimmy at the top of the James Hotel. But their latest spot, the Rogue & Canon, is decidedly more down to earth.

title: How the I.R.S. Hurts Mothers
description: BOSTON

title: In Search, Google Still Leads
description: Google still holds by far the largest share of traditional search engine traffic.

title: As Child Care Costs Rise, Families Seek Alternatives
description: Child care costs have nearly doubled since the mid-1980s, but the portion of families paying for care has dropped, according to a new Census Bureau report.

title: Police Surveillance May Earn Money for City
description: A unique public-private partnership that joined gut-level police acumen with advanced computer algorithms is proceeding toward two goals that rarely coincide: The policing system is making New York safer and it will also make money for the city, which is marketing it to other jurisdictions.

title: Debt and David Stockman
description: Update: I forgot to explain that the chart shows the ratio of financial-sector debt to GDP.

title: Georgia: Defendants in Cheating Scandal Released
description: The 35 Atlanta public school employees charged in a testing scandal have been released from jail and are awaiting their first appearance in court. They are accused of running a conspiracy in which they changed students answers on standardized tests in order to be paid performance bonuses. By Wednesday evening, a day after they were ordered to surrender at the Fulton County Jail, all the defendants had posted bond and been released. Defense lawyers said they are asking the district attorney, Paul L. Howard Jr., to hold trials before multiple juries. They said there is no courtroom in the county large enough to accommodate 35 defendants, lawyers and family members.

title: Wisconsin: Church Will Release Files on Abuse
description: The Archbishop of Milwaukee, Jerome E. Listeki, announced on Wednesday that he has authorized the release of thousands of pages of documents on sexual abuse by Catholic priests, including cases that date back 80 years. His announcement came one day before a judge was scheduled to hear a motion from abuse victims asking for the documents to be released. The files, which will be posted on the archdiocesan Web site by July 1, include the legal depositions of former Archbishop Rembert Weakland and Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, now the archbishop of New York.

title: My Dinner With Dr. King
description: FORTY-FIVE years ago, the Rev. Dr. and Mrs. Martin Luther King Jr. went to a small dinner party in Atlanta, not far from the campus of Emory University. It was a quiet January night in 1968. I was one of the guests.

title: Power Struggle Is Gripping Iran Ahead of June Election
description: TEHRAN  PresidentMahmoud Ahmadinejad is not going quietly.

title: West Virginia: Man Held in Sheriffs Killing
description: A county sheriff was fatally shot in rural West Virginia on Wednesday, and a fleeing suspect was arrested after being shot by a deputy. The authorities said that Sheriff Eugene Crum of Mingo County died after an assailant fired on him in his car in Williamson. Tennis M. Maynard, 37, was arrested after a brief pursuit in which he lost control of his vehicle, stepped out with a weapon and was shot several times, said Sgt. M. T. Baylous of the West Virginia State Police. Mr. Maynard remained alert enough to speak as he was flown to a hospital, and the police are investigating a motive, Sergeant Baylous said. Sheriff Crum, sworn in Jan. 1 after serving as a local magistrate, was known especially for targeting drug dealers, the authorities said.

title: Echoes of Ebbets Field as It Turns 100
description: The apartment complex has stood longer than its fabled ancestor. On the wall near the Bedford Avenue entrance to the 1,318 units that rise 20 beige-brick stories is a concrete marker dated 1962 that reads, This Is the Former Site of Ebbets Field.

title: William H. Ginsburg, Monica Lewinskys Lawyer, Dies at 70
description: William H. Ginsburg, a civil malpractice lawyer in Los Angeles whose career took a startling turn in 1998 when he went to Washington to represent, volubly and controversially, a young White House intern named Monica Lewinsky, died on Monday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 70.

title: Priced Out of Citizenship
description: CHICAGO

title: Multiplying the Old Divisions of Class in Britain
description: LONDON  Class in Britain used to be a relatively simple matter, or at least it used to be treated that way. It came in three flavors  upper, middle and working  and people supposedly knew by some mysterious native sixth sense exactly where they stood. As the very tall John Cleese declared to the less-tall Ronnie Corbett in the famous 1966 satirical television sketch meant to illustrate class attitudes in Britain  or, possibly, attitudes toward class attitudes  I look down on him, because I am upper class.

title: Suit by Ex-Wife of SACs Cohen Revived on Appeal
description: While the billionaire Steven A. Cohen has come under mounting scrutiny related to insider trading, he had reason to believe that a nasty court battle with his former wife was behind him.

title: Calm Down, Coaches
description: The Rutgers mens basketball coach Mike Rice wasnt very nice. In fact, according to a video that surfaced Tuesday, he was godawful.

title: Trojan Horse
description: Beware of conservatives bearing gifts.

title: Attacks on Elderly Armenian Women in Turkey Awaken Fears
description: ISTANBUL  The man in the ski mask struck in the twilight of late afternoon, strangling the elderly woman from behind, beating her senseless and leaving her for dead. He ran off with 50 Turkish lira, about $30, and her engagement ring, a last memory of her long-dead husband.

title: Final Round Set for Parties in South Carolina House Race
description: Mark Sanfords fiance, the Argentine for whom he risked a political career, stood next to him Tuesday as he accepted the Republican nomination for a South Carolina Congressional seat.

title: Connecticut Senate Votes for Gun Limits; House Passage Is Expected
description: HARTFORD  With memories of the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School as fresh as an open wound, the Connecticut Senate passed on Wednesday what members called the nations most comprehensive package of gun control legislation. The House was expected to approve it early Thursday.

title: Facebook Is Expected to Introduce Its Phone
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Facebook does not have to build a phone, as its chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, has long maintained.

title: Horses Running at Santa Anita Are Under Surveillance
description: Horses competing in Saturdays Santa Anita Derby have been put under surveillance for the 72 hours before the race for the first time after an owner with a horse in the race offered to pay for the enhanced security to ensure the race was run fairly and provide transparency to the betting public.

title: Remembering the Affair to Remember
description: Its kind of nice to have Mark Sanford back.

title: Greece: Court Sentences Guerrillas
description: A Greek court on Wednesday handed down 50-year prison sentences to three leading members of the guerrilla group Revolutionary Struggle, which is best known for firing a rocket-propelled grenade at the United States Embassy in Athens in January 2007, and imposed shorter terms on two others suspected of being members. The verdict was issued in absentia for the organizations self-professed leader, Nikos Maziotis, and his partner Panagiota Roupa, who have been on the run since last June when they were released from prison after completing the maximum permitted period of 18 months in pretrial custody. The third person sentenced was Costas Gournas. The group has claimed responsibility for a string of bombings and shootings targeting the police and others between 2003 and 2010, causing some injuries but no deaths.

title: Councilmans Boast Revives Question of Quinns Oversight
description: It was a dark chapter in Christine C. Quinns political career, and the City Council speaker had hoped she could leave it behind.

title: Blame Abounds Over a Flawed Foreclosure Review
description: Private consultants and federal regulators are facing a fresh round of scrutiny in Washington after botching a broad review of foreclosures and failing to thwart financial misdeeds.

title: Walmart Strains to Keep Aisles Stocked Fresh
description: Michelle Obama visited a Walmart in February to extol the fresh, healthy food in the companys grocery aisles. But Walmart, Ms. Obamas corporate partner in a campaign to make food healthier and more affordable, has been running into problems with food that is not so fresh.

title: Veterans Affairs Officials Offer Reassurance About Troubled Hospital
description: JACKSON, Miss.  Senior officials with the Department of Veterans Affairs said on Wednesday that they have begun taking steps to fix problems at an embattled veterans medical center here, including hiring new senior leadership, adding primary care doctors and reviewing X-rays and CT scans that might have been misread several years ago.

title: At 97, the Oldest Living Brooklyn Dodger Reflects
description: Late one recent night on Bible Street in Cos Cob, Conn., in the carpeted basement apartment of a gray bungalow, Mike Sandlock, 97, had a dream that he was in Yankee Stadium.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 3, 2013

title: Scandal Suggests Narrower Corruption Law Still Survived
description: A federal law used to prosecute corrupt politicians lost some of its teeth when the Supreme Court significantly narrowed its scope in 2010.

title: Are Rich Politicians Less Corruptible?
Upon Further Review at Rutgers
description: In November, an extraordinary videotape showing Rutgers basketball players being physically and verbally abused at practice by their ranting coach, Mike Rice, came into the possession of university officials. With Rutgers intent on becoming a first-tier power in the lucrative world of university athletics, officials at the New Jersey institution foolishly sought to minimize the damage by announcing a three-game suspension of Mr. Rice and a $50,000 fine, while keeping the extent and details of his misbehavior vague.

title: More Rot in Albany
description: The corruption scandal that blew up in Albany this week is the equivalent of a Russian nesting doll: a federal prosecutor accusing a state senator of conspiring with county party bosses and a city councilman to buy a spot on a city ballot and to steer state money to a village mayor. Its a wonder it didnt wrap in a local school board and the P.T.A. You could hardly ask for a better all-purpose illustration of the rot that pervades New York States political culture.

title: Its North Korea, Again
description: Recent weeks of saber-rattling and military escalation have affirmed a harsh truth: North Korea  which is much closer to putting a nuclear warhead on a missile than Iran and has threatened to strike the United States and its allies  is the more urgent challenge. The major powers still havent figured out how to solve it.

title: Barbara Piasecka Johnson, Maid Who Married Multimillionaire, Dies at 76
description: Barbara Piasecka Johnson, whose rags-to-riches tale  an immigrant maid marries a multimillionaire and inherits all of his money, fending off the furious claims of his children  was at the center of what one writer called the largest, costliest, ugliest, most spectacular and most conspicuous probate battle in American history, died on Monday near Wroclaw, Poland, where she spent much of her childhood. She was 76.

title: Cano as Entertainer? Yanks Have to Hope Not
description: Robinson Canos new formal business relationship with Jay-Z was such big news on Wednesday that it merited mention on Good Morning America. But that did not mean the host, George Stephanopoulos, was obliged to pronounce Canos name right. Stephanopoulos called him CAN-o, instead of ca-NO.

title: In a State That Knows the Gun Debate, the President Urges Both Sides to Listen
description: DENVER  As his gun control legislation struggled back in Washington, President Obama pleaded on Wednesday for understanding from the opposing forces of a debate that has grown polarized since the December massacre of 20 young children in Connecticut.

title: Moscow Tries to Reinvent Itself as Financial Hub
description: MOSCOW  Having tried and failed to become a major financial center, Moscow is trying yet again  only this time it finds itself competing for business with Warsaw, not London, Tokyo and New York.

title: Gay Man Says Catholic Parish Rebuffed Him After Marriage
description: Days after Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan said the Roman Catholic Church should do a better job of reaching out to gay men and lesbians, a Catholic man on Long Island came forward to say he had been ousted from his parish duties because he married his boyfriend.

title: Officer Charged in Robberies of Drug Dealers
description: A 17-year veteran of the New York Police Department was arrested on Wednesday on charges that he was a member of a crew that robbed drug dealers of thousands of dollars in cash and drugs.

title: He Wears the Mask
description: The present darling of the right wing, Dr. Benjamin Carson, is a distinguished neurosurgeon who went from the depths of Detroit poverty to the heights of Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore. But his current status among conservatives isnt so much rooted in Carsons redemptive rise from rags to respectability, as it is in the belief that he is, in the long winter of Obama, the one theyve been waiting for.

title: Anthony Scores 40 as Knicks Roll to 10th Straight Win
description: ATLANTA  History was there for the taking, if Carmelo Anthony wanted it. Ten minutes to go, 50 points in reach, and there was Coach Mike Woodson, summoning him from the end of the bench.

title: Corrections: April 4, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: At a Lonely Hotel, Two Lives That Overlapped
description: Be warned in advance that theres no inoculation against the viral effects of Good With People, David Harrowers beautiful, deceptive wisp of a play at 59E59 Theaters. Though this two-character Scottish drama, which opened on Wednesday night as part of the Brits Off Broadway series, is less than an hour long, it is likely to have an enduring and varied afterlife in the shadows of your mind.

title: What May Go for a Buck
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  We get a lot of interesting mail from solvers here at The New York Times. Sometimes, people who write in have something to say about the way the puzzle is presented. Some of these letters, after you get past the personal attacks on our families and the questioning of the marital status of our parents, have suggested that the puzzle prints out in a way that is too small to read. The customer service emus, who have been carefully trained to write back by tapping the correct computer keys with a pen held carefully in their beaks, do their best to explain to the solvers that some of this can be alleviated by making changes to the printer settings, and most of the time, that helps.

title: Obama Pauses From Fray to Raise Money for 2014
description: WASHINGTON  As he battles to advance legislative priorities on gun control and taxes, President Obama opened a multimillion-dollar fund-raising drive Wednesday in the hope of winning a friendlier Congress for his final two years in office.

title: An MS Drug Takes a Feisty Approach Aimed at Younger Patients
description: THE Swiss drug maker Novartis is taking a sassy new tack to win converts to its oral multiple sclerosis treatment, Gilenya. Its Hey MS, Take This! campaign shows patients sticking out their tongues with Gilenya capsules on them to show their willingness to fight back against the neurological condition.

title: Officials Say Arrest Is Unrelated to Texas Killings
description: KAUFMAN, Tex.  Law enforcement officials investigating the killings of two prosecutors here said Wednesday that they had arrested a man on charges of threatening a county official, but that he was not connected to the shootings, underscoring the lack of significant leads so far.

title: Milo OShea, an Actor of the Stage and Screen, Dies at 86
description: Milo OShea, an Irish character actor  recognizable by his black bushy eyebrows, tumble of white hair and impish smile  whose films included Ulysses, Barbarella and The Verdict, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 86.

title: As Web Search Goes Mobile, Competitors Chip at Googles Lead
description: Say you need a latt. You might pull out your phone, open the Yelp app and search for a nearby cafe. If instead you want to buy an espresso machine, you will most likely tap Amazon.com.

title: Ebbets Fields 100th Birthday
description: Ebbets Field was home to the Dodgers until they left Brooklyn for Los Angeles after the 1957 season. The first game at Ebbets Field was an exhibition on April 5, 1913.

title: The Life of a Dodger
description: Mike Sandlock, at 97, is the oldest living Brooklyn Dodger. He played two seasons at Ebbets Field with the Dodgers in the mid-1940s.

title: Jane Henson, a Partner in Creating the Muppets, Dies at 78
description: Jane Henson, the widow of and original collaborator with Jim Henson, the creator of the Muppets, died on Tuesday at her home in Greenwich, Conn. She was 78.

title: Upstart Group Pushes Harder Than the N.R.A.
description: SPRINGFIELD, Va.  When word surfaced in February that Senator Tom Coburn, Republican of Oklahoma, was plotting with Democrats on a bill to expand background checks for gun buyers, Larry Pratt got really mad. Then, Mr. Pratt, the executive director of Gun Owners of America, got busy, mounting a lobbying blitz that helps explain why a bipartisan Senate deal on background checks remains elusive.

title: Hugh McCracken, a Studio Musician in High Demand, Dies at 70
description: Hugh McCracken, a virtuoso guitarist who was in such demand as a studio musician that he could afford to turn down Paul McCartneys invitation to join the band Wings in 1971, died on Friday in Manhattan. He was 70.

title: After Hasty Hellos, New Rangers Make Quick Work of Penguins
description: No matter how much of a head-scratcher the Marian Gaborik trade may have seemed on Wednesday, the Rangers did not seem to miss him at all at Madison Square Garden. Instead, with three newly acquired players combining to score four goals, the rebooted Rangers put together their best performance of the season, routing the Eastern Conference-leading Pittsburgh Penguins, 6-1.

title: The G.O.P.s Digital Makeover
description: The Republican Party faces hurdles as it attempts to equal or surpass the Democratic Partys success in capitalizing on technological innovation to win President Obama a second term.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, Apr. 4 ,2013
description: "Bunt, hit and run  they dont do that anymore!

title: Already a Star to Mets Fans, Harvey Dominates the Padres
description: At only 24 years old and wading into his first full season in the major leagues, Matt Harvey has already come to be seen as one of the Mets biggest stars.

title: Becoming a Female Police Officer in Delhi: Do You Qualify?
description: Indias capital city has promised to hire 2,500 new female police officers, as part of a push to increase the safety of women in Delhi after the fatal gang rape of a young student in December.

title: Reagans Daughter Says Hed Have Backed Gay Marriage
description: WASHINGTON  As Republican politicians wrestle with same-sex marriage, the daughter of a party icon  former President Ronald Reagan  said in an interview this week that she believes her father would have been puzzled by the political fuss and would have supported marriage for gay people.

title: Nets Ensure a Winning Road Record for the First Time as an N.B.A. Team
description: CLEVELAND  For the first time since joining the N.B.A. in 1976, the Nets will finish with a winning record on the road. Fittingly, they won their 21st road game of the season by beating a bad team, routing the Cavaliers, 113-95, on Wednesday night. The Nets (43-31) moved to 27-4 against opponents with a record below .500 at the time of the game.

title: Two Investment Groups Present Pitches for Kings
description: Just after noon on Wednesday, a large purple and white camper van pulled up in front of the St. Regis Hotel on 55th Street in Manhattan. Several dozen Sacramento Kings fans in purple and white jerseys and hats mobbed the truck like druids welcoming the summer solstice.

title: Colorado Seeks Gang Members in Its Inquiry Into Slaying
description: DENVER  The authorities in Colorado were seeking two white supremacists late Wednesday in connection with the killing of the executive director of the states prison system, Tom Clements.

title: Kuroda Is Hurt, Along With Yanks Pride
description: When Travis Hafner hit his first home run of the season in the fourth inning, it presented a rare opportunity for the operations crew at Yankee Stadium to blast some of that majestic music that has become synonymous with the teams many long-ball trots in recent seasons.

title: Think Like a Doctor: The Baby Who Wont Eat
description: The Challenge: Can you solve the mystery of a baby who refuses to eat?

title: Samsung Plans Mini-Stores in Best Buys
description: Samsung Electronics is giving Apple some of its own medicine. The company will set up mini-stores this summer inside Best Buys across the United States.

title: Word of the Day | beguile
description: beguile \bi-gi(-)l, be-\ verb

title: Rangers Deal Gaborik to Columbus
description: Seventeen deals involving 30 players were made before Wednesdays N.H.L. trading deadline, and among the biggest was the Rangers trade of Marian Gaborik, a three-time 40-goal scorer, and two prospects to the Columbus Blue Jackets for three relatively obscure players and a late-round draft choice.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 11:30 A.M. (Flix) THE APOSTLE (1997) Robert Duvall, above, wrote, directed and stars in this movie about Sonny Dewey, an evangelical preacher who trades in his church and his cheating wife (Farrah Fawcett) for life on the lam in the rural South. The supporting cast includes Miranda Richardson as the married focus of Sonnys charm; Billy Bob Thornton as a racist who proves that Sonny can achieve almost anything through his words; and a singing June Carter Cash, as Sonnys mother. Mr. Duvall received an Oscar nomination for best actor for his portrayal of Sonny in what Janet Maslin, writing in The New York Times, called a lovely, heartfelt film. She added, The actors are first rate, but much screen time in The Apostle is given to nonactors who give the film a sweetly believable tone and fill its churchgoing scenes with blazing heart and soul.

title: Occupy Hong Kong, for Universal Suffrage
description: BEIJING  A civil disobedience movement to push for democratic elections of Hong Kongs leader in 2017 was launched last week, dubbed the Let Love and Peace Occupy Central movement. (Central is the core downtown district of Hong Kong.)

title: News Quiz | April 4, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: A Conversation With: Cherie Blair
description: Cherie Blair, a discrimination law veteran, is also a campaigner for womens equality who is actively involved with nearly 20 charities, including Indias universally acclaimed Self- Employed Womens Association, or S.E.W.A.

title: IHT Quick Read: April 4
description: NEWS With only months to go before his last presidential term, and elections in June, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad has surprised many of his critics by challenging a coalition of traditionalists in Iran. Thomas Erdbrink reports from Tehran.

title: Fast-Food Workers Plan Second Strike for More Pay
description: Tabitha Verges, a minimum-wage worker at a Burger King in Harlem, was caught unawares when 200 workers at other fast-food restaurants in New York City walked out last November to demand higher wages.

title: Its a Beehive Full of Complainers, but if You Can Make it Here
description: Rahul Gandhis speech at the annual meeting of the Confederation of Indian Industry on Thursday morning, and the long, somewhat rambling question-and-answer session afterward, inspired an outpouring of appreciation, mockery and everything in between on social media.

title: British Premier Says Nuclear Risks Highlight Need for Deterrent
description: LONDON  Citing tensions with Iran and North Korea, Prime Minister David Cameron offered a strong defense of Britains nuclear deterrent on Thursday, traveling to Scotland to challenge nationalists seeking independence who want to expel nuclear-armed submarines from Scottish bases.

title: Test Yourself | English, April 4, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article Justin Bieber and Youths New Wilderness.

title: Video Shows Rutgers Basketball Coach Taunting and Abusing His Players
description: Update: April 4, 2013

title: The Ones Not Traded: Goalies Luongo and Kiprusoff
description: A total of 30 players were involved in 17 trades before Wednesdays N.H.L. trade deadline, but it was two goaltenders who didnt find new a home who dominated the postdeadline conversation.

title: Rahul Gandhi Steps Forward
description: NEW DELHI  He described himself as irrelevant, said he did not want to be a politician, or at least a hard-nosed one. And he worried openly that he is going bald.

title: How Important Do You Think It Is to Marry Someone With the Same Religion?
description: Love conquers everything. Or at least, thats what Romeo and Juliet thought. But love and marriage can be complicated, and some argue that marrying someone who shares your religious beliefs can make things easier.

title: Treasury Needs a Tough No. 2
description: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Kings of the Roma
description: To reach a surprising place, follow Route 6 south of Bucharest as it unwinds across the Romanian countryside, past fields of wildflowers and flocks of sheep. Turn west before the Danube River and head toward a grid of neatly laid streets, set down among farms.

title: North Korea Moves Missile to Coast, but Little Threat Is Seen
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Koreas defense chief said Thursday that North Korea had moved to its east coast a missile with a considerable range, but that the weapon was not capable of reaching the United States. The disclosure came as the Norths military warned that it was ready to strike American military forces with cutting-edge smaller, lighter and diversified nuclear strike means.

title: Seeking Your Questions on Making the Final College Decision
description: Now that colleges have decided to accept, deny or defer your college application, it is up to you to decide what your academic future will bring. Most colleges and universities require an enrollment deposit by May 1.

title: German Authorities Are Said to Investigate Deutsche Bank
description: PARIS  The German central bank is investigating allegations that Deutsche Bank hid billions of dollars in losses to avoid a potential bailout during the financial crisis, people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

title: New Arrested Development Season Coming to Netflix on May 26
description: Its no longer just a dream in the hearts of Arrested Development fans, a wild scheme in the mind of the series creator Mitchell Hurwitz or a question for its cast members to answer in every interview they have given since 2006. A new season of Arrested Development will be released on Netflix on May 26, it was announced on Thursday.

title: How Data Analysis Led Us to Reassess Sales and Open a Lead-Generation Center
description: Here is a quote I love from Good to Great, the Jim Collins book: But once we looked at the facts, there was really no question about what we had to do. So we just did it.

title: One Tiny German Town, Seven Big Michelin Stars
description: It was Saturday night at Restaurant Bareiss, an eight-table dining room in Baiersbronn, a small town in Germanys Black Forest, and the chef, Claus-Peter Lumpp, needed seven orders of John Dory in garam masala. Three line cooks darted around him, fussing over black plates laid out on a checkered towel under a heating lamp, saucing and garnishing and somehow not running into one another. Germany was not, until very recently, known for its chefs, but it does have a well-earned reputation for quality control. Chefs used syringes to deliver pinpoint droplets of sauce and tested temperatures with yellow electric thermometers that looked like Geiger counters. The bulk of the cooking takes place on nine electric burners that were made to Lumpps exact specifications.

title: The Transformational Power of the Right Spice
description: Theres an eschatological thrill to walking into La Bote, a shop wedged between an auto-repair garage and a dismal fenced-in garden on the far west side of Midtown Manhattan. At a cultural moment that has given us a storefront dedicated to artisanal mayonnaise, La Bote manages to advance the genre. The shop is open to the public a total of 12 hours a week. Inside, its serene and nearly empty. At the entrance, a plexiglass obelisk contains a tin the size of a paperback packed with minuscule spiced biscuits (pronounced bis-KWEE; theyre cookies, and the tin costs $65). Farther in, theres a display with numbered canisters that look as if they encase costly Japanese cosmetics but in fact contain spice blends that have been doled out with a jewelers parsimony. As I took in the glossy photos of pods and rhizomes lining the walls and handled the decadently cool, silvery pucks, I couldnt help wondering whether this is what ancient Rome must have been like near the end, before the Vandals trashed Palatine Hill.

title: Daily Report: Googles Eroding Lead in Web Search
description: Though Google is the undisputed king of search, alternative services are chipping into its share of the market, Claire Cain Miller reports in The New York Times.

title: Iain Banks Is Dying
description: This is very upsetting. Banks writes two kinds of books  gritty realism under the name Iain Banks, and visionary science fiction as Iain M Banks. The latter are just amazing  try starting with Use of Weapons, but every one of the Culture novels is a gem, and its terribly sad to think that there will be no more.

title: The Arrival of Facebooks Phone
description: Facebook is expected to introduce a Facebook-centric phone on Thursday that is intended to help increase its profit overseas, Somini Sengupta writes in Thursdays New York Times. Read more.

title: Japan Initiates Bold Bid to End Years of Tumbling Prices
description: TOKYO  Haruhiko Kuroda, the new governor of the Bank of Japan, delivered on his promise to drastically change Japans economic policy to end a long, debilitating era of deflation.

title: Q&A: Moving On From the Windows 8 Preview
description: Q.

title: The Jokes on Louis C.K.
description: I dont necessarily agree with you, but I appreciate it very much, Louis C. K. says to an applauding crowd at the start of his new stand-up special, Oh My God. Its a quintessential act of belittling himself  a refusal to believe that he deserves the gratitude of the hundreds of fans surrounding him at the Celebrity Theater in Phoenix and the thousands more who will see this comedy special when it makes its HBO debut next Saturday. Its emblematic of the defeatist charm of Louis C. K., who at 45 finds himself a performer of the moment whose moment keeps getting bigger and bigger.

title: Our Lady of the Fragile Humanity
description: Every night from as early as I can remember the family knelt in the evening and said the rosary. Each mystery, as they were called, had 10 Hail Marys; the first part of each Hail Mary was recited by a single voice, and then the second part  Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our death. Amen  by the rest of the family in unison. At the end my mother would recite some extra prayers, including the Memorare, which began, Remember, O most gracious Virgin Mary, that never was it known that anyone who sought thy aid or implored thy intercession was left unaided.

title: T-Mobile Breaks Free of the Cellphone Carrier Conspiracy
description: The smallest of the Big Four cellphone carriers has stepped away from the two-year, unbreakable contract that Sprint, Verizon and AT&T live by, David Pogue writes in Thursdays New York Times. Read more.

title: Opinion Report: Corruption in Albany
description: From the editorial page

title: E.C.B. Chief Says Cyprus Shows Commitment to Euro
description: FRANKFURT  The head of the European Central Bank on Thursday rejected suggestions that Cyprus or any other country might give up the euro or be better off if it did.

title: Explaining the Senates Surge in Support for Same-Sex Marriage
description: So many senators are declaring their support for same-sex marriage that Ive regularly had to check my Twitter feed while working on this article, lest I miss any announcements. As Dylan Matthews of The Washington Post has detailed, 50 senators have now stated their backing for same-sex marriage, up from only 16 in 2010 and eight in 2008.

title: Monkey Business on Bieber Tour. Is He the Rolling Stones?
description: LONDON  Forget Kim Jong-uns nuclear posturing and the latest bad news on the euro. The other drama that is grabbing attention in the European press this week is the fate of Justin Biebers monkey.

title: Metro New York Banks to Merge
description: Provident New York Bancorp said on Thursday that it would acquire Sterling Bancorp for $344 million in stock.

From Hillary Clinton, a Book on Foreign Policy Next Year
