description: Say cult musical and what comes to mind is a notorious Broadway turkey like Carrie. But a two-character show about the failed relationship between a Jewish guy and a Gentile girl whose stories are told backward (hers) and forward (his), with a number called Shiksa Goddess?

title: Why Weiners Mayoral Bid Is a Long Shot
description: A poll released on Tuesday by Marist College shows former Representative Anthony Weiner running in second place in the Democratic primary for mayor of New York. Mr. Weiner has 15 percent of the vote, behind Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, at 26 percent.

title: With Debt Studys Errors Confirmed, Debate on Conclusion Goes On
description: The Harvard economists Carmen M. Reinhart and Kenneth S. Rogoff have acknowledged that their groundbreaking 2010 study Growth in a Time of Debt includes statistical errors that significantly alter its results.

title: Scene City: Pillars of New York Society
description: Vanity Fairs party kicks off the 12th Tribeca Film Festival.

title: Complete Immigration Overhaul Bill
description: A bipartisan group of senators working on an immigration compromise released an 844-page bill.

title: Paramore Unseats Timberlake at No. 1
description: The rock band Paramore scored the No. 1 spot on the Billboard album chart this week with its first new release in four years, ending Justin Timberlakes three-week run and beating out a new album by Brad Paisley.

title: Cristin Milioti in 'Once'
description: The actress performs Raglan Road from this Broadway musical about two musicians who fall in love.

title: Make a Note of It: Speech Recognition Apps Are Getting Better
description: Science fiction writers have long imagined a future where we simply voice-command our devices, cars or spaceships. The technology isnt quite there yet, despite Apples best efforts with Siri, its digital personal assistant. But our smartphones and tablets are getting quite good at turning the spoken word into text. This app technology has the power to turn your mobile device into a powerful writing tool, without your having to lift a stylus or type on a touch screen.

title: Euro Zone Crisis Has Increased I.M.F.s Power
description: FRANKFURT  When Wolfgang Schuble, the German finance minister and war horse of European politics, celebrated his 70th birthday at a theater in Berlin last September, two of the most powerful women in the world offered warm words in his honor.

title: Eric Ripert and Richard Gere Will Be Your Chefs
description: A dinner for $220,000?

title: Image of the Day: April 17
Ask Well: Long Runs vs. Sprints
description: Question:

title: Does High Debt Cause Slow Growth?
description: The debate over whether government spending hurts or helps growth has again taken center stage this week because of a new research paper by two professors and a graduate student at the University of Massachusetts at Amherst. Their study critiques the methods and conclusions of a 2010 paper by Kenneth Rogoff and Carmen Reinhart, both professors at Harvard, showing that countries with high debts also have lower growth rates.

title: Blogger Who Traced Flow of Arms to Syria Through YouTube Seeks Crowdfunding
description: The British blogger Eliot Higgins, who has played an important role in tracing the flow of arms to Syrian rebels through close analysis of video clips posted on YouTube from his living room in England, began an appeal for financial support from readers this week.

title: In New Home, Exploratorium Widens Its Interactive Appeal
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Exploratorium science museum, which reopened Wednesday on a new nine-acre campus by the San Francisco Bay, is striking for how closely it has hewed to its quirky, interactive and work in progress roots.

title: Exclusive Clip: Mr. Jones
description: A scene from the horror film Mr. Jones, playing in the Tribeca Film Festival.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Bus Finder App, and Tabletop PC
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: Life Stinks, but Its Still Precious
description: Art should comfort the disturbed and disturb the comfortable, an epigram popularized by the street artist Banksy, aptly describes Jean Thompsons new novel, The Humanity Project, in which the question of how to comfort the miserable  and whether its even possible  becomes nearly as troubling as unhappiness itself.

title: At the Tribeca Film Festival Party, Every Name Is Bold
description: It wasnt clear which stood taller: the Corinthian columns of the New York State Supreme Court or the towering figures of New York society who mingled beneath them at the kickoff to the 12th annual Tribeca Film Festival on Tuesday night.

title: For Bank of America, C.E.O. Greed Would Be a Good Thing
description: Bank of America investors had better hope the banks chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan, is long-term greedy. About half his pay is now tied to hitting specific targets for average return on assets and tangible book value by 2015. The banks first-quarter showing of $2.3 billion applicable to shareholders is better than last year. But without significant further improvement, Mr. Moynihans going to fall way short.

title: Real Madrid No. 1 in the Money League
description: The rich keep getting richer, and for now, Real Madrid is the richest of all.

title: Strolling in Paris, With Menus in Mind
description: Paris is, of course, a walkers city. But which direction to take? And to what destinations? With previously unknown (to me, at least) restaurants as my end points, I started at Notre Dame (essentially the center of town; all time allotments below are from there) and headed in different directions for different lengths of time.

title: Pictures of the Day: Boston and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Boston, England, Pakistan and India.

title: Hearing the Benefits of Confronting Mozart
description: When I spoke recently with the clarinetist and composer Jrg Widmann before his three-concert Contrasts series this week at the 92nd Street Y with the eminent violinist Christian Tetzlaff, he said that the series juxtapositions of his music and Mozarts could bring out the knots in the great master that are often hidden in plain sight.

title: Oilers President Decides Insulting Fans Was a Bad Idea
description: The Edmonton Oilers president of hockey operations, Kevin Lowe, apparently needed to learn a lesson this week taught in Sports Marketing 101: Never take potshots at your fans. There might be a special chapter in the marketing handbook about doing so in a news conference designed to inspire optimism among your fans, as when you hire a new general manager because the last one drove the franchise into a ditch.

title: Clip: 'G.B.F.'
description: A scene from the high school comedy "G.B.F.," directed by Darren Stein.

title: Harry Reids Conscience
description: Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid generally isnt thought of as a conviction politician. Hes a vote-counter; a highly cautious pragmatist who not long ago ducked an opportunity to reform the filibuster, and with it the increasingly slow-to-non-existent legislative process.

title: A Label Finds 99 Ways to Make Classical Profitable
description: Among iTuness top classical albums are plenty by Yo-Yo Ma and Glenn Gould. But the list is also filled with budget compilations, like The 50 Most Essential Pieces of Classical Music and Beethoven: 100 Supreme Classical Masterpieces, that pack in dozens of 1812 Overtures and Fr Elises for as little as $6.

title: New Gun Measures Considered by the Senate
description: The Senate voted on a series of amendments on Wednesday afternoon that may determine the shape of new gun legislation.

title: The F.B.I. Criticizes the News Media After Several Mistaken Reports of an Arrest
description: The F.B.I. scolded several news outlets on Wednesday for mistakenly reporting that an arrest had been made in the Boston Marathon bombings, and warned that such unverified reporting could have unintended consequences for its investigation.

title: This Script, They Think, Could Be the One
description: Writing a script is tough. But writing a script about writing a script  well, thats a whole other story.

title: Now Opening | Altai
description: Amaryllis Knight, a globe-trotting, British-born designer, has left her aesthetic fingerprints all over her adopted home of Los Angeles: in the homes, gardens and offices of private design clients; in her own house; and soon, in the smartly appointed restaurant that chef Josef Centeno is opening this summer (Orsa & Winston). Now, with the opening of Altai  the retail store (which opens April 18) and online platform for her consultancy and furniture studio  Knights eclectic vision is, at last, shoppable. Its a lot more than a store, she says. Its a way to further explore my work and interests while contributing to a conversation in Los Angeles about varied worlds of design and how they intersect. Situated on a stretch of 3rd Street thats a retail desert  but a quick skip to LACMA and Regen Projects  the light-drenched, vaulted-ceilinged space sells everything from $14 Santa Maria Novella lozenges to a $600,000 1948 Vincent 1000cc Rapide Series B motorcycle with a legendary racing pedigree. (Its a wild machine, Knight says.)

title: Cerberus Owner Might Buy Its Gun-Making Group
description: Four months after the investment firm Cerberus put the countrys largest gun company up for sale in the wake of the school shootings in Connecticut, it has found a possible buyer in Cerberuss owner, Stephen A. Feinberg.

title: With Pulitzer, She Became a Composer
description: Caroline Shaw, the winner of the 2013 Pulitzer Prize in Music, isnt quite ready to own up to what she does.

title: With Falsetto and Flash, a Band for Which Bigger Is Always Better
description: The English band Muse loves science concepts. It opened its Madison Square Garden concert on Tuesday night with The 2nd Law: Unsustainable: a warning, based on the second law of thermodynamics, that entropy makes an economy based on endless growth unsustainable. (The song, from Muses 2012 album, The 2nd Law, is also a trendy blast of dubstep, disrupting one of the bands many somber keyboard introductions with a bass upheaval and a swooping synthesizer.)

title: A Shower of Sparkles Amid a Haze of Smoke
description: Sortijas, a premiere for Ballet Hispanico by the Spanish choreographer Cayetano Soto, opens on a darkened stage as Jamal Rashann Callender, a sinewy, shirtless wonder in black pants, lifts Lauren Alzamora from behind. Her legs splay awkwardly, while her top  a riot of sparkles by the German-American design team Talbot Runhof  glitters relentlessly. A haze of theatrical smoke clings to the stage, rendering it difficult to make out choreographic nuances. Perhaps thats for the best.

title: Bravest Woman in Mexico Sees Her Story on a New York Stage
description: Until last week, Marisol Valles Garca, a petite, soft-spoken 23-year-old with rather severe rectangular glasses, had never visited New York, never ridden in an elevator, never dined in an Italian restaurant. And she had never seen a play.

title: Shopping Snapshots: April 18
description: Giada Forte jewelry; offsetting bursts of spring color with a neutral bag; and Pas de Calais, a Japanese label with a Gallic inflection, opens its first United States store in SoHo.

title: In Spuren, Glass Finds His Inner Bruckner
description: LINZ, Austria  How did Anton Bruckner, thought by some to have been the stodgiest of composers, suddenly become cool? Well, not cool himself, exactly, but he seems to be hanging out more with cool guys: namely, a couple of Minimalist pioneers.

title: Editors Lab at The New York Times
description: This weekend, April 2021, were hosting an Editors Lab hack event at the Times building. The worldwide Editors Labs series, organized by the Global Editors Network (GEN), invites teams to build apps and projects around a media-related theme. This weekends theme is newsgaming: projects at the intersection of games and journalism.

title: Company Founder Makes Court Appearance in Breast-Implant Case
description: PARIS  The founder of a French company accused of selling hundreds of thousands of defective breast implants to more than 65 countries appeared on Wednesday in a courthouse in Marseille, with more than 300 victims in attendance.

title: The Weird Realism of H.P. Lovecraft
description: The Stones weekly briefing of notable philosophy-related issues and ideas from around the Web.

title: Scouting Report
description: The Brooklyn-based jewelry line Holst + Lee, created by Natalie Holst and Rochelle Lee, is the latest addition to the roster at Plum Alley, a new luxury e-commerce platform that curates products exclusively from companies founded by women. In honor of the occasion, Ms. Holst and Ms. Lee have designed three pieces exclusively for the site: glass crystal and nylon rope earrings ($175), a Swarovski crystal-studded necklace ($275) and a multistrand necklace made from nylon rope wrapped with pearl cotton thread ($225). This week, 10 percent of the proceeds on these items will go to Somaly Mam Foundation, an organization that works to end human trafficking.

title: For Quinn, Weiner Is the Possible Candidate Who Must Not Be Named
description: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, is rarely reticent on the campaign trail, doling out rhetorical jabs and gibes and regularly earning laughter from crowds.

title: EBays Profit Rises 19%, but Results Miss Estimates
description: EBay continues its turnaround, from troubled online auction site to a forward-looking, mobile-oriented e-commerce company.

title: Times Talks: Ken Burns on Justice and The Central Park Five
description: Watch the discussion about the issues raised by The Central Park Five, the award-winning documentary about a 1989 rape in Central Park, the rush to judgment and the lives of those wrongly convicted.

title: Breaking Up Is Hard to Do
description: Ah, those online relationships.

title: At Age 14, No Stranger to a Steal
description: On the Internet, no one cares that youre 13. Thats what Henry Kilpatrick discovered when he started his vintage-furniture retail site, Magic City Finds, in September 2011, at the dawn of his teen years. Mr. Kilpatrick, who is now 14 and lives in Birmingham, Ala., had no idea who Herman Miller was when he plucked a fiberglass armchair from his grandmothers storage space, but one online search later, he knew he had a find. He plowed the $75 he made on that initial sale, along with some birthday money, back into furniture bought at estate sales and off Craigslist, including 20 more Eames chairs, which cycled through his parents garage. He mostly works on the weekends, as it is tough to do schoolwork and business, and schoolwork comes first, he said.

title: Recalling a Chronicler of Combat as It Is
description: The British-born photojournalist Tim Hetherington starts and stops, groans and grimaces, as he tries to explain why hes made a career of taking his cameras as close as possible to the places where men are killing each other. He manages to get out, The important thing for me is to make work that is connected to people, before shaking his head in disgust: Blah blah blah blah blah.

title: Inspiration From a PB&J
description: When Deborah Ehrlich, a glass designer in Accord, N.Y., needed a new porch light almost four years ago, she designed one. The idea was a jelly jar, she said. But it is a refined version, made by artisans in Sweden with whom Ms. Ehrlich has worked for 13 years. The material is Swedish crystal. You can blow it very thin, and it doesnt break, Ms. Ehrlich said. The light, which has a white glazed porcelain base and a rubbed brass shade holder, is now in production. Fully assembled, it measures 4 inches wide and 8 inches high, and sells for $225 at Artware Editions, 270 Bowery, second floor (Houston Street), (212) 463-7490; artwareeditions.com.

title: He Wouldnt Change a Thing
description: On April 23 and 24, Christies will stage an auction of the contents of a Palladian-style villa in Malibu, Calif., that was designed by Michael S. Smith, the Obamas White House decorator. The auction includes many museum-quality pieces, including a Sean Scully painting and a Persian rug that once belonged to the Agnelli family of Italy. A Chinese brown lacquer altar table, shown, has an estimated sale price of $4,000 to $6,000. Theres also a trove of Asian art and antiques, Old Master paintings and historic European furniture (more than 450 lots) with an estimated sale value of $3.5 million to $5 million. It took Mr. Smith five years to accumulate all the treasures, and he may bid at the auction himself. Im not done with anything, he said. Id buy it all again. So attached is he to the project that he wrote a book about it, Building Beauty: The Alchemy of Design (Rizzoli, $55). Information: (212) 636-2000 or Christies.com.

title: Designs That Help Redefine Craft
description: By weekday, John Liston is a glass artisan working for other artists and architects in Oakland, Calif. But the rest of the time, he experiments with his own furniture and lighting in a cooperative studio in San Francisco. Out of these efforts have come burnt-recycled-wood cabinets ($11,000), lights with industrial-glass orbs perched on scrap-metal tripods ($25,000) and other mixed-media pieces, which he displays at craft shows. One of his cheeriest works is his bright orange Ribbon chair, shown, made of crisscrossed steel slats ($6,000).

title: Need a Good Zinnia Recipe?
description: Dont be misled by the title: The Flower Recipe Book, by Alethea Harampolis and Jill Rizzo (Artisan, $24.95), is not a guide for making hibiscus enchiladas or scented-geranium sorbet. Rather, its a beautifully illustrated and practical guide to the ephemeral art of fresh-flower arranging.

title: Sales at BoConcept, Niche Modern and Others
description: Furniture, lamps and decorative accessories are up to 70 percent off at BoConcepts warehouse sale, on Saturday (the Cavona dining chair, regularly $199, will be $69); 20 Pulaski Street, Bayonne, N.J., (201) 433-4461, boconcept.us.

title: Scare Me, Sure, but Also Make a Statement
description: Propellers where faces ought to be. Woman-on-woman death matches. Celebrity chefs with a taste for human flesh. All you cinephiles who like to find grand statements and social criticism in horror movies, prepare to bloviate. Its midnight at the Tribeca Film Festival.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. Would converting my basement into a man cave increase the resale value of my home?

title: A Pretty Shameful Day in Washington
description: Thats how President Obama characterized the shockingly cowardly act by which the United States Senate betrayed the victims of the Newtown massacre and every American who has been killed by gun violence since then. Ninety-percent of Americans support expanded background checks, but 45 percent of the Senate killed a bill that would have provided that expansion  without infringing in the slightest way on the Second Amendment.

title: Partner Without the Prize
description: Twenty-two years after being passed by, the architect Denise Scott Brown, 81, said at an awards ceremony for women in architecture last month that it was time she share in the 1991 Pritzker Prize that was given to her design partner and husband, Robert Venturi, with whom she had worked side by side.

title: Obama Says Gun Lobby Willfully Lied
description: Following a Senate vote that defeated several gun-related measures, President Obama spoke in the Rose Garden of the White House.

title: A Single Vision
description: In their new space, like every other home Teman Evans and his identical twin, Teran, have shared, nothing is costly or permanent.

title: Ill Be Your Mirror
description: As newborns, Teman Evans and his identical twin, Teran, looked so much alike that the doctor who delivered them had to put bracelets on them so their mother could tell them apart. (When they were 10, she confessed that soon after, she had taken the bracelets off to bathe the twins, and wasnt entirely sure she had put them back on correctly.) At 33, those bracelets are long gone, but the twins remain almost indistinguishable.

title: Obama Decries Senates Rejection of Gun Safety Measures
description: Flanked by family members of the Newtown, Conn., shooting victims and former Representative Gabrielle Giffords of Arizona, President Obama decried a Senate vote defeating gun control legislation, saying a minority of senators blocked common-sense gun reforms even while these families looked on from the Senate gallery.

title: Impatiens, and Some Alternatives
description: Consider the collapse of your favorite annual as an invitation to experiment.

title: A Pox on Your Flowers
description: A mysterious strain of downy mildew has been killing one of the home gardeners favorite annual flowers, Impatiens walleriana, up and down the East and West Coasts, in the Midwest, Texas and Ontario.

title: Settling Fee Dispute, Law Firm Denounces E-Mail Humor
description: The law firm DLA Piper has settled a fee dispute with one of its clients, resolving a case that highlighted lawyers e-mails that discussed overbilling the client, in one instance using the phrase churn that bill, baby! to describe their work.

title: Misconceptions Could Lead to Health Law Train Wreck, Baucus Warns
description: A routine Senate budget hearing turned into a public scolding as a prominent backer of the health care overhaul warned that a lack of public information could cause a train wreck as the laws implementation moves forward.

title: Were You or Someone You Know at the Marathon Finish Line?
description: Over the past several days, Times reporters and editors have been working on identifying and telling the stories of the people in the image above, a frame from video recorded at the moment of the first explosion at the Boston Marathon. We have found many of the people seen here, but would like your help in identifying more. Are you visible in any part of this image recorded on Monday afternoon or do you know someone who was there? Please fill out the form below and include your location. A reporter or editor will follow up on all relevant leads.

title: Making the Best of It
description: MILAN  The dog had spots.

title: Highlights From the Milan Furniture Fair
description: From dalmatians to miniature fireplaces.

title: A Treat for Art Students: Leggy Models With Multicolor Coats and Fine Manes
description: Jordan Judd did something on Wednesday that art students do not usually do: He walked away with one of the models.

title: Beauty Spots
description: Groucho Marxwouldnt join any club that would have him as a member, but he probably wasnt as concerned about his complexion as the target customer for these deals.

title: Rising Bank Profits Tempt a Push for Tougher Rules
description: Banks have been reporting steady growth in earnings since soon after the financial crisis. With the latest reports rolling in, analysts think the banks first-quarter profits will be their best ever.

title: Photo Replay: April 17
description: A view of the day in sports, full of leaps and strong finishes.

title: An Afghan Citys Economic Success Extends to Its Sex Trade
description: MAZAR-I-SHARIF, Afghanistan  This verdant town is home to some of Afghanistans greatest treasures: It is the birthplace of the celebrated poet Rumi, and the site of one of the countrys most storied mosques. It is the first Afghan city to have been connected with another country by rail.

title: Ricin: Poison of Choice Over the Years
description: This toxic chemical comes from the bright red castor plant and can be deadly if inhaled.

title: The Polo Rebuttoned
description: UNIQLO IS MAKING A BIG BET on polo shirts. Walk into the stores and you will find stacks of them, striped, solid, piqu and otherwise. Hold out until next week and you will find even more.

title: Hedi Slimanes First Year at Saint Laurent
description: Since he replaced the designer Stefano Pilati in a creative takeover that bordered on a coup, Mr. Slimane, 44, has introduced a vision for Saint Laurent.

title: Mr. Provocative
description: Hedi Slimane could write a book on how to lose friends and still influence people.

title: London to Harlem via Chelsea
description: On a recent afternoon, the longtime society caterer Serena Bass was having lunch at Lido, the Italian restaurant in Harlem where she has been the executive chef since last fall, and reading a text message. There is a book just out called Best Chefs America, and Im in it, she said. Im quite surprised. So thats good.

title: Stop Involving Red Pelle Pelle Jacket
description: A wanted poster distributed to police officers the day of the stop and photographs of the witness who was stopped on the way home from his mothers wearing a similar red jacket.

title: Obamas Remarks After Senate Gun Votes
description: The following is a transcript of remarks by President Obama and Mark Barden, the father of a 7-year-old killed during the Sandy Hook shooting, after the Senate rejected gun measures, as provided by the White House.

title: The Senate Fails Americans
description: For 45 senators, the carnage at Sandy Hook Elementary School is a forgotten tragedy. The toll of 270 Americans who are shot every day is not a problem requiring action. The easy access to guns on the Internet, and the inevitability of the next massacre, is not worth preventing.

title: Henry A. Prunier, 91, U.S. Soldier Who Trained Vietnamese Troops, Dies
description: Henry A. Prunier taught Vo Nguyen Giap, the Vietnamese general who withstood the armies of France and the United States, how to throw a grenade.

title: Italian Coachwork in American Proportions: the Dual-Ghia Convertible
description: After seeing what sorts of concept-car tricks automakers were up to at the last few auto shows, its fun to dust off the pages of history and examine the concepts that designers dreamed up in the 1950s. Today, form usually follows function with the possible exception of the huge, masculine grilles currently in vogue but during the early years of the jet age, the Big Three fielded many flamboyant, sleek concepts with lines that brought to mind images of rockets blasting off into outer space.

title: Kerry Encourages Venezuela Recount
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Secretary of State John Kerry said Wednesday that Venezuela should hold a recount of votes cast in its presidential election, which the countrys electoral authorities say was narrowly won by a protg of former President Hugo Chvez.

title: As Italy Picks a President, Some Say Its Time to Choose a Woman
description: ROME  Italian lawmakers begin voting on Thursday for a successor to President Giorgio Napolitano amid growing debate about electing a woman for the first time in this male-dominated society, and even seemingly strong popular support for the idea.

title: Just in Time, a Veteran Joins the Knicks
description: Quentin Richardson has seen and experience just about everything in the N.B.A. during his 12-year career, and when the 33-year-old veteran joined the Knicks on Wednesday morning for the team shootaround and an introductory news conference, he said all the things one would expect of a veteran who signed with a team just before the season finale.

title: Conservatives See a Turning Tide on Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  Hours after a bipartisan group of eight senators introduced a sweeping overhaul of the nations immigration system, conservative radio talk show hosts took over two floors of a Capitol Hill hotel on Wednesday and denounced the proposal on the countrys drive-time airwaves as nothing more than a reward for lawbreakers.

title: A History of Oopsies in Economic Studies
description: As my colleague Annie Lowrey has been covering, a frenzy has erupted over errors in an influential paper by Carmen Reinhart and Kenneth Rogoff. Probably the most embarrassing mistake dealt with errors in a simple formula in an Excel spreadsheet.

title: More Children in Greece Are Going Hungry
description: ATHENS  As an elementary school principal, Leonidas Nikas is used to seeing children play, laugh and dream about the future. But recently he has seen something altogether different, something he thought was impossible in Greece: children picking through school trash cans for food; needy youngsters asking playmates for leftovers; and an 11-year-old boy, Pantelis Petrakis, bent over with hunger pains.

title: Report Urges White House to Rethink Iran Penalties
description: WASHINGTON  A panel of former senior American officials and outside experts, including several who recently left the Obama administration, issued a surprisingly critical assessment of American diplomacy toward Iran on Wednesday, urging President Obama to become far more engaged and to reconsider the likelihood that harsh sanctions will drive Tehran to concessions.

title: English Clubs Change at Top Brings It Low
description: BLACKBURN, England  Neil Thornton, enjoying a drink at a restaurant inside Blackburn Rovers Ewood Park, smiled when he recalled his wedding reception. It was held at a suite inside the stadium in 1995, and he could glimpse the seat he occupied as a season-ticket holder.

title: News Media Weigh Use of Photos of Carnage
description: Even for a society comfortable with blood and gore in its movies and video games, the bombings at the Boston Marathon have sparked a new debate among news organizations about when images are too gruesome to display.

title: Making the Most of His Gifts and Flaws
description: Pat Summeralls hotel room in Minneapolis was a mess. Clothes were strewn on the bed. There were empty bottles of booze.

title: U.S. Accuses Company of Adding Mobile Fees
description: WASHINGTON  Those surreptitious charges for flirting tips, yoga lessons and psychic services, long a problem on landlines, have become a costly nuisance for mobile phone users  and a new focus for regulators.

title: Court Declines to Rule in Wikileaks Complaint
description: A military appeals court on Wednesday declined to rule on a lawsuit seeking greater access for journalists to court filings and proceedings in the criminal case against Pfc. Bradley Manning, who has admitted to leaking 700,000 confidential government documents to WikiLeaks. The Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces decided 3 to 2 that it did not have jurisdiction to hear the appeal, filed by a coalition of journalists and organizations, including the Center for Constitutional Rights, which said in a statement that the ruling meant that Private Mannings trial, set for June 3, will be fundamentally unfair. Military officials initially withheld from the public all documents in the case, including some the judge read aloud in court. More recently, officials have released a selection of documents, but with names and other information blacked out.

title: A Senate in the Gun Lobbys Grip
description: WASHINGTON

title: Lessons From Military Surgeries Informed Treatment of Boston Victims
description: BOSTON  For years, Dr. Michael J. Weaver, an orthopedic trauma surgeon, went to meetings of his professional society and heard surgeons from the military describe what they had learned treating blast injuries. Then he would return to his practice at Brigham and Womens Hospital in Boston, where he mostly treated people injured in auto accidents or falls.

title: No Deal Yet in Talks to Reduce Strife Between Serbia and Kosovo
description: PARIS  Talks aimed at overcoming ethnic enmities between Serbia and its former province, Kosovo, ended Wednesday without an agreement, senior Kosovo officials said, as the two countries struggled to negotiate a deal that would enhance regional stability and help clear the way for their eventual membership in the European Union.

title: A Story of Pain, but Also Perseverance
description: Beginning Thursday, Amare Stoudemire will watch his life flash before his eyes on the big screen.

title: Before Adding Players, Jets Face a Tough Call
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The N.F.L. draft looms large for the rebuilding Jets, who are in their current position  upending their roster, overhauling their coaching staff, hiring a new general manager  in part because of their missteps at this time of year. Their needs are so plentiful that it is feasible they could use their first-round pick, No. 9 over all, on a guard, an offensive tackle, a defensive tackle, an outside linebacker, a wide receiver or even a cornerback.

title: Europeans Step Toward Easing Syrian Oil Exports
description: BRUSSELS  European Union members reached a preliminary agreement on Wednesday that would ease an embargo on oil exports from Syria, diplomats said, part of an effort to enable opposition-held areas with petroleum resources to develop an economic base and some self-sufficiency.

title: War and Sports Shape Better Artificial Limbs
description: John Kremer, a Navy explosives expert, lost both his legs below the knee after stepping on a mine in Afghanistan in 2010. In his San Diego hospital bed, he assumed he would be chained to a wheelchair for a year or more. Walking seemed a distant goal. Running? He could barely comprehend the concept anymore.

title: Of Judges and Judging
description: If you read only one judicial opinion this year, you might consider skipping the Supreme Court entirely and going right to a decision issued early this month by Judge Edward R. Korman of Federal District Court in Brooklyn.

title: Lighting a Spark on the High Plains
description: LINCOLN, Neb.

title: Isles Road to Playoffs Is Barnstorming Tour
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  As the lockout-shortened 48-game N.H.L. regular season nears a close, the resurgent Islanders face the challenge of playing their final five games on the road.

title: Only One Title Matters (and Its Not Scoring)
description: Before Knicks fans get too excited about Carmelo Anthonys first scoring title, note that the N.B.A.s leading scorer has rarely played for the league champion. That feat has been accomplished 11 times by five players, and six of those times were by one player: Michael Jordan. No one has done it since Shaquille ONeal led the Lakers to a title in 1999-2000.

title: The Kids Are (Not) All Right
description: The United States has done it again  and not in a good way.

title: Pollan Cooks!
description: The seven most famous words in the movement for good food are: Eat food. Not too much. Mostly plants. They were written, of course, by Michael Pollan, in In Defense of Food: An Eaters Manifesto, the follow-up to The Omnivores Dilemma.

title: Fire Islands Lucky Break
description: Fire Island, the long ribbon of sand, grass and dwarf-pine forest that lies off the South Shore of Long Island, has two main jobs. One is to be a lovely setting for vacation cottages and deer. The other is to be the barrier that encloses the placid Great South Bay and protects large swaths of the suburban mainland from the open Atlantic.

title: A Giant Setback for Human Rights
description: The Supreme Courts conservatives dealt a major blow Wednesday to the ability of American federal courts to hold violators of international human rights accountable. The court declared that a 1789 law called the Alien Tort Statute does not allow foreigners to sue in American courts to seek redress for violations of the law of nations occurring outside the United States.

title: Surprise! Ticos Want to Play U.S. at Saprissa
description: It never snows in Costa Rica, but other unmentionable items have been know to rain down on opposing players at Estadio Ricardo Saprissa.

title: Latin Americas Go-To Hero
description: Can you name an American founder whose name is shouted in the streets, whose legacy inspires fanatical worship, whose image is used to bolster ideals not his own, whose mantle is claimed by both left and right? There is no Washington party, no Jeffersonian republic. No one runs for president in Madisons name. But in Latin America, as the Venezuelan election on Sunday reminded us, the question is easy, and the answer is Simn Bolvar.

title: Honduras: Attorney General Is Suspended
description: Saying it was frustrated with some of the worst criminal violence in the world, the Honduran congress suspended the attorney general and his assistant and replaced them with a temporary oversight committee. The three-person commission will have 60 days to analyze why the prosecutors office has been unable to solve so many criminal cases, and will generate a plan to improve the trustworthiness of the institution. Honduras, which has become a major drug route to the United States, has one of the highest homicide rates in the world.

title: Egypt: Mubarak to Be Moved to Prison
description: Egypts chief prosecutor on Wednesday ordered the transfer of former President Hosni Mubarak from a Cairo military hospital back to prison. Mr. Mubarak is expected to be held there pending a retrial on charges including complicity in the killing of protesters during the 2011 revolt that toppled him. He had been in the hospital since December after injuring himself during a fall in the prison shower, his lawyers said. The prosecutor ordered the transfer after Mr. Mubarak appeared Saturday in a Cairo courtroom, where, despite being on a gurney, the former president appeared in good health and high spirits, waving to supporters. A medical board subsequently ruled that Mr. Mubarak was well enough to be sent back to prison. A judge scheduled May 11 as the date for the new trial.

title: Gun Control Effort Had No Real Chance, Despite Pleas
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, his face set with rage, stood in the Rose Garden surrounded by the families of Newtown and former Representative Gabrielle Giffords and asked how a measure to expand background checks for gun buyers  one supported by an overwhelming majority of Americans and a bipartisan majority of the Senate  had slipped away.

title: A Museum Expands; Not Everyone Is Cheering
description: To the Editor:

title: Campaign Reform in Albany
description: To the Editor:

title: In Boston, Scars of the Past and the Present
description: To the Editor:

title: The Value of Girls Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: The Finding: U.S. Engaged in Torture
description: To the Editor:

title: Arrest Is Made Over Letters Believed to Carry Poison
description: WASHINGTON  Federal agents arrested a man on Wednesday who is suspected of sending letters believed contaminated by the poison ricin to President Obama and a Republican senator. The F.B.I. identified the suspect as Paul Kevin Curtis of Corinth, Miss.

title: Bigger Fines for Defacing Citys Streets to Save a Spot
description: It is an urban pastime borne out of scarcity, ingenuity and an abiding faith that no one is paying attention.

title: Teixeira Is Swinging in Next Step in Recovery
description: On the most restless days of his rehabilitation from a partially torn tendon sheath in his right wrist, Mark Teixeira would head into his office at home and pretend to check an e-mail.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, Apr. 18, 2013
description: When the principal called, I had to tell him, We dont have food.

title: Some Testimony on Police Tactic Undercuts Bias Claim
description: One man was stopped and frisked because of his expensive red leather jacket  similar to one that a murder suspect was wearing in a wanted poster. Another man was stopped after a woman complained to the police that he was following her. Still another was stopped by officers who had watched him jostle the door of a home, trying to get in.

title: Mets Hoping Frigid Trip Doesnt Send Them Into a Cold Spell
description: DENVER  Ballplayers who are asked about bad-weather games tend to offer some variation of the same stock response: Both teams played in it.

title: Seeking Answers to Officers Murder-Suicide in Memories and Notes Left Behind
description: Just before his son was born, Dason Peters finally revealed to his mother what he could no longer hide: he would be a father.

title: Corrections: April 18, 2013
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Figures in Statistics
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Every once in a while, someone comes up with a puzzle theme that is creative and, more to the point, hard to see. I thought I saw it, but I didnt really see it until I had stared at it for a good 10 minutes after I completed the puzzle. Even though, to paraphrase Groucho Marx, the Lord ALPs those who ALP themselves, there will inevitably be people who would like the mountains to come to them, so here comes the explanation.

title: In Boston, Waiting for a Suspect
description: In a chaotic scene Wednesday afternoon, residents and journalists gathered outside the federal courthouse after conflicting reports about whether a suspect in Mondays bombing had been arrested.

title: Throwback to the Days of Tasteful Opulence
description: There are tales, still told by the old ones of Broadway, of a time when Charm  with a capital C  was a cardinal virtue in the theater. It was an attribute that made plain actresses beautiful, and turned short, stocky men into matinee idols. Entire plays, it is said, were written in celebration of those who possessed this enviable trait, works filled with airy, tickling dialogue and the accouterments of tasteful wealth.

title: Nearing End of Contract, Elias Faces Murky Future
description: NEWARK  Goalie Martin Brodeur was asked recently whether he thought the Devils should make every effort to keep left wing Patrik Elias from leaving as a free agent after the season. He threw back his head and laughed ruefully before responding.

title: The Economy Continues to Grow Modestly
description: A roundup of regional economic conditions in the Federal Reserves 12 districts, according to survey results released by the Fed on Wednesday. The survey is based on information collected on or before April 5.

title: Assad Frames Syrian Struggle as Him Against Western Colonizers
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  President Bashar al-Assad of Syria on Wednesday night described what he said was an insidious Western attempt to recolonize his country, and he appeared to reject any thought of compromise or negotiation with the insurgency seeking to topple him.

title: His Velocity Down, Sabathia Faces Reality but Doesnt Give In to It
description: Age is unkind to all athletes, but especially to starting pitchers. A pitcher who can adjust as his arm deteriorates is one who will have a long, successful career.

title: The Bowery: A Bounty of History
description: The Bowery in Lower Manhattan is one of New York Citys oldest addresses. That history is now being preserved, as the Bowery has just been listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

title: Behind the Facades, a Seedy Past Endures
description: The Bowry, the Bowry!

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 17, 2013

title: Dispute in Hamptons Set Off by Effort to Hold Back Ocean
description: SOUTHAMPTON, N.Y.  Soon after Hurricane Sandy hit last fall, Joshua Harris, a billionaire hedge fund founder and an owner of the Philadelphia 76ers, began to fear that his $25 million home on the water here might fall victim to the next major storm. So he installed a costly defense against incoming waves: a shield of large metal plates on the beach, camouflaged by sand.

title: In Dark Humor and Stiff Drinks, Albany Finds Relief From Scandal
description: ALBANY  They pat each other down. They crack wise about CSI: Albany. They vent, in bars and back rooms and on basketball courts.

title: For Senator, Bills Defeat Is Personal and Political
description: WASHINGTON  When Senator Dianne Feinstein led the successful push for a federal assault weapons ban in 1994, she had a simple pitch to skeptical colleagues: What would you need to support this bill?

title: U.S. Infant Mortality Rate Fell Steadily From 05 to 11
description: WASHINGTON  The nations infant mortality rate fell by 12 percent from 2005 through 2011, a promising pattern that researchers say may be due in part to a decline in premature births.

title: Should Social Security Taxes Affect All Wages?
Senate Blocks Gun Control Legislation
description: The Senate on Wednesday defeated several measures to expand gun control that were supported by families of the victims of the mass shooting in Newtown, Conn.

title: Dozens Injured in Fertilizer Plant Explosion in Texas
description: A cellphone video uploaded onto YouTube captures the moment the explosion occurred.

title: Are the Good Jobs Gone?
description: Among those paying serious attention to the economic dilemmas facing the United States and other advanced nations, uncertainty is the only constant.

title: Lakers Will Lean on Frontcourt in Playoffs
description: LOS ANGELES  When Mike DAntoni took over as the Lakers coach in November, he felt that he had a big problem. Two of them, actually. He did not think there was any way he could keep Dwight Howard and Pau Gasol on the court at the same time.

title: Investigators Seek Clues in Boston
description: Two days after deadly blasts during the Boston Marathon injured more than 170, investigators continued to search for evidence.

title: Done With Routine of Regular Season, the Nets Can Focus on the Bulls
description: The Nets have been in playoff mode for almost a week now, making the last two games of the regular season largely irrelevant and, to put it bluntly, a bit of a drag. They spent Monday tending to the tired needs of their starters; they spent Wednesday praying those same starters would stay upright.

title: In Synopsis of Season, Knicks Win Brings New Injury
description: Hours before the seasons final game, 198 days after they opened camp, the Knicks gathered for another round of introductions, farewells and welcome-backs.

title: Mass Injuries Reported in Texas Fertilizer Plant Blast
description: A huge explosion on Wednesday night at a fertilizer plant near West, a town in central Texas, caused many injuries, according to the towns Fire Department and news reports.

title: The Impossible Workload for Doctors in Training
description: One spring morning during the second year of my surgical residency, I learned that two of my classmates, junior residents like me, had suddenly been fired.

title: LinkedIn Refreshes Mobile App
description: On Thursday, LinkedIn unveiled an overhauled version of its mobile application, its first refresh in nearly two years.

title: Word of the Day | requite
description: requite \ri-kwit\ verb

title: Red Bulls Rewind: Loss Leads to a Few More Questions
description: The Red Bulls lost to Sporting Kansas City, 1-0, on Wednesday night in a testy game in which they put only 3 of their 14 shots on target. The loss dropped the Red Bulls into fifth place, at 2-4-2, but raised a few more questions six weeks into the season.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 2:30 P.M. (FX) SALT (2010) Who is Salt? In this action extravaganza from Phillip Noyce, Evelyn Salt (Angelina Jolie, above) is a Russian mole or a C.I.A. assassin, or maybe both. Shedding her shoes and her underwear, she goes on the run from suspicious colleagues (Liev Schreiber and Chiwetel Ejiofor) after she is accused of being a double agent by a Russian defector. What follows is a symphony of ingenious fights and escapes as she tries to prove her innocence. Perhaps the most ridiculous scene in Salt has Ms. Jolie walking away unnoticed from the aftermath of a multivehicle smash-up, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. I suspect this was meant as a joke, since her magnetism is the films foundation and reason for being (even though her role was originally conceived as a vehicle for Tom Cruise). She is the prime special effect, and a reminder that even in an era of technological overkill, movie stars matter.

title: Explosion at Texas Fertilizer Plant
description: A huge explosion on Wednesday night at a fertilizer plant near West, a town in central Texas, caused many injuries.

title: New Zealand Leads Way on Same-Sex Marriage in Asia-Pacific
description: 3:33 p.m. | Updated

title: Indias Tata Group Maps U.S. Expansion
description: NEW YORK Tata Group, the Indian conglomerate whose name is associated with one of the biggest outsourcing firms in the world, is bringing more of its business to United States.

title: News Quiz | April 18, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Plant Explosion Tears at the Heart of a Texas Town
description: WEST, Tex.  The blast was so powerful that the United States Geological Survey registered it as a 2.1-magnitude earthquake. It reduced an apartment complex to a charred skeleton, leveled homes in a five-block radius and burned with such intensity that railroad tracks were fused. It killed up to 15 people and injured up to 180. Volunteer firefighters were missing. Residents of a nursing home were pulled from debris and rushed to hospitals.

title: IHT Quick Read: April 18
description: NEWS Sharply different perspectives within the Obama administration concerning the Syrian opposition emerged publicly on Wednesday when Secretary of State John Kerry and Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel made separate appearances before Congress. Michael R. Gordon reports from Washington.

title: Test Yourself | English, April 18, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article In Little Italy, Saving the Past by Rebuilding It.

title: President Xi Takes a Taxi? Yes, Too Good to Be True
description: HONG KONG  For much of Thursday, a tale told by a Beijing taxi driver appeared to offer ideal political theater for the Chinese government: a humble cabby took the nations top leader, Xi Jinping, for an incognito ride and revealed Mr. Xis yearning to share the pain, and the congested streets, of a frustrated public.

title: Musharraf, Fleeing Once, Is Brought Back to Court to Face Charges
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  When the former military ruler Pervez Musharraf ended his years of exile last month, it was with a vision of himself as a political savior, returning in the nick of time to save Pakistan from chaos.

title: Senate Blocks New Gun Control Measures
description: In Senate Blocks Drive for Gun Control, Jonathan Weisman writes about the Senates defeat of new gun control measures in the wake of Decembers mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn.

title: The Impact of Higher Capital Requirements for Banks
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: What Have Been Your Reactions This Week to News About the Boston Marathon Bombings?
description: What have been your thoughts and reactions this week as youve followed news coverage about the bombs that exploded at the Boston Marathon on Monday? To what extent have you followed the hour-by-hour updates? What stories have you read or heard that particularly affected you? Why?

title: John le Carr Starter Kit
description: In this weekends magazine, Dwight Garner profiles John le Carr, the pre-eminent spy writer of the 20th century. Here, he picks the le Carr books that no true fan  or novice  should miss.

title: Public Enemys Private Photographer
description: Ernie Paniccioli leaned in close. Yo, take a minute, he insisted. Youve got to listen to this from Public Enemy!

title: Waking Up on the Wrong Side of a Ratings War
description: One Wednesday last month, Ann Curry, camouflaged in a hat and trench coat, trudged into the art-deco lobby of 30 Rockefeller Plaza. It had been nine months since she was pushed out as co-host of the Today show. Curry was now NBCs national and international correspondent and the anchor at large for Today, but these titles seemed honorary. Curry had appeared on Today only a handful of times since her ouster. She had no role in NBCs coverage of election night or Inauguration Day. She taped a few stories for Rock Center, the prime-time newsmagazine show, but as she explained on Twitter, her bosses kept rescheduling them. Curry had moved to an office on the 27th floor of 30 Rock, far from her NBC News bosses on the third floor. On this morning, she was at work on a short NBC Nightly News segment about the anniversary of Martin Luther King Jr.s death. It would be only her sixth appearance on the network all year.

title: John le Carr Has Not Mellowed With Age
description: On a recent Saturday morning in February, two dozen or so scent hounds streamed through the streets of St. Buryan, a small village in Cornwall, England. Behind them drifted a loose formation of men and women perched atop well-groomed horses and wearing boots, breeches and hunting coats. As the fox hunt clopped through town, John le Carr, the pre-eminent spy writer of the 20th century, sipped from a paper cup of warm whiskey punch, doled out by a local pub to riders and spectators.

title: College Is a Journey, Not a Destination
description: Martha OConnell is the executive director of Colleges That Change Lives, a nonprofit organization that focuses on a student-centered college search process.

title: Experts Look Beyond Birds in Investigation of Flu Strain in China
description: BEIJING  China is investigating four possible cases of human-to-human transmission of a deadly bird flu that has killed 17 people, but so far there has been no sustained evidence of transmission between people, the World Health Organization said Thursday.

title: The Early Word: Embers
description: In Todays Times:The embers are all that remain of a push to expand gun control laws after the Senate defeated several amendments on Wednesday, leaving Senator Harry Reid, the Democratic majority leader, to postpone debate on the bill on Thursday, Jonathan Weisman reports.

title: North Korea Tones Down Language, Giving Hope for Dialogue
description: SEOUL, South Korea  By North Korean standards, the invective issued over the past week has bordered on civil. Instead of near daily threats of nuclear annihilation for the nest of evil in the United States and promises to press the button, the North in recent days has grumbled over a crafty ploy and cunning trick by America and its allies to strip the North of its nuclear arsenal.

title: Dont Talk the Talk
description: MEXICO CITY  There will be no more drug executions in Mexico, no more levantones (kidnappings with intent to murder) or encajuelados (dead bodies in car trunks, or cajuelas). There will be no more mob bosses, no more mob soldiers, no more hit men.

title: The S.B.A. Wants to Encourage More Small Loans
description: For the last several years, the Small Business Administration has attempted to expand its loan-guarantee programs by making them available to bigger businesses. But with the 2014 budget that the White House sent to Congress last week, the Obama administration is trying to solve a problem at the other end of the spectrum: how to induce banks to make smaller loans, to smaller businesses.

title: 2 Executives Depart in Management Shake-Up at Barclays
description: 1:11 p.m. | Updated

title: Daily Report: As Unauthorized Fees Hit Cellphone Bills, U.S. Acts
description: In the last two years, regulators have found that hundreds of thousands of mobile phone users have been charged for premium text services that they did not authorize, a practice known as bill cramming. Now the crackdown has begun, Edward Wyatt reports in The New York Times.

title: Japanese Exports Rise, but Demand for Goods Is Lackluster
description: TOKYO  A dispute over islands with China that led to boycotts of Japanese goods, coupled with rising energy purchases to compensate for idled nuclear plants, gave Japan a record annual trade deficit last year, the government said on Thursday, in another sign of a steadily worsening trade situation for this onetime export juggernaut.

title: Morgan Stanley Reports Profit, but Investors Have Doubts
description: 8:11 p.m. | Updated

title: Success for the Gun Lobby
description: The American gun lobby plants its flag on the U.S. Senate.

title: Nokia Trims Loss, but Sales Fall
description: PARIS  Nokia said on Thursday that its sales fell sharply in the first quarter because of lagging demand in emerging markets for its simplest models, adding to investor anxiety over the companys ability to execute a turnaround.

title: Amy Schumer, Funny Girl
description: It was mid-October, and six stand-up comedians were working on a sketch inthe writers room of the new series Inside Amy Schumer, trying to come up with funny ways to commit suicide. What if it was something with a low level of success, like throwing yourself down stairs? Tig Notaro suggested.

title: The Tulip Trap
description: ISTANBUL  The citys parks and gardens and the central dividers of its throughways are a blaze of color this month. Its tulip season, and over 14 million bulbs have burst into bloom, roughly one for every resident. Istanbul still prides itself on having transformed, in the 16th century, this wild hill flower into a cultivated blossom, and with it capturing the imagination of northern Europeans.

title: Bahrain F1 Event Goes Ahead Despite Human Rights Protests
description: LONDON  Formula One drivers were arriving on Thursday for the Bahrain Grand Prix, which is to go ahead on schedule this weekend after the organizers rejected calls from human rights activists to cancel it.

title: Goofus and Gallant Come to India
description: Highlights, the earnest, unapologetically unhip magazine that entertained generations of American children while they waited in doctors and dentists offices, started publishing in India on Thursday with much fanfare.

title: Cannes Competition Lineup Includes Coen Brothers and Payne
description: New films from Joel and Ethan Coen, Alexander Payne, Nicolas Winding Refn, Roman Polanski and Steven Soderbergh are among the features that will be presented in competition at this years Cannes Film Festival, organizers announced on Thursday. The Coen brothers, the writer-directors of Fargo, No Country for Old Men and The Big Lebowski, will be represented by Inside Llewyn Davis, their new film starring Oscar Isaac as a fictitious singer in the New York folk-music scene of the 1960s.

title: Wireless Lifts Profit at Verizon
description: Verizon Communications on Thursday reported a healthy profit, driven primarily by its wireless business, which brought in millions of smartphone sales and a mountain of money from subscribers that just keeps growing.

title: Opinion Report: A Forgotten Tragedy
description: From the editorial page

title: Emirates Said to Seize Qaeda Supporters
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  Security authorities in the United Arab Emirates said on Thursday that they had arrested seven members of a terrorist cell affiliated with Al Qaeda accused of plotting attacks in the Emirates and in neighboring oil-producing states, according to the official WAM news agency.

title: F.B.I. Posts Images of Pair Suspected in Boston Attack
description: BOSTON  In a direct appeal for help from the public, the F.B.I. on Thursday released pictures and video of two young men who officials believe may be responsible for the explosions that killed three people and wounded more than 170 during the Boston Marathon.

title: South Korean Intelligence Officers Are Accused of Political Meddling
description: SEOUL, South Korea  At least two agents from the South Korean National Intelligence Service illegally posted comments online criticizing the political opposition ahead of the December presidential election, the police said on Thursday in an interim report on an investigation into accusations of political meddling.

title: Thursday Reading: Visiting Europe in a Time of Turmoil
The Knicks, a Poem
description: Dear Diary:

title: Now Showing | Takashi Murakami
description: The Japanese artist Takashi Murakami titled his new exhibition at L.A.s Blum & Poe gallery Arhat, after Buddhist monks who achieve nirvana. More than 200 Arhats are immaculately rendered in psychedelic paintings, all completed, like most of Murakamis work, by assistants who follow his exacting specifications.

title: American Youth Orchestra to Perform at BBC Proms
description: The maiden tour by a new youth orchestra established by Carnegie Hall will include an appearance at the BBC Proms concerts, Carnegie said on Thursday. The Proms engagement is a sign of the halls influence and the weight it is throwing behind the venture.

title: Does Nitish Kumar Need the B.J.P.?
description: NEW DELHI  Earlier this week, Bihars chief minister, Nitish Kumar, expressed reservations about the Gujarat chief minister Narendra Modis suitability for prime minister, brooking the strongest opposition yet Mr. Modi has faced from an ally.

title: The Ups and Downs of Seesaw Marriages
description: I came to being a full-time stay-at-home mom late. Im on catch-up with all those professional mothers who refined their style over the baby and toddler years. But Ive found that Im not measured against them, but against my husband  and sometimes I fail to measure up.

title: Cyprus Bailout Wins Easy Approval From Germany
description: BERLIN  Germanys lower house of Parliament approved the bailout package for Cyprus on Thursday, bringing to an end to months of debate in Berlin.

title: Blackstones Profit Jumps 28%
description: The Blackstone Group, the private equity giant, said on Thursday that first-quarter profit rose 28 percent, to $628 million, as the firm reported growth in total assets under management.

title: Ammonium Nitrate Used in Bangalore Blast, Police Say
description: NEW DELHI The Bangalore police and government officials said Thursday that investigators are chasing several leads in the blast that injured 16 people on Wednesday.

title: Morgan Stanleys First-Quarter Rebound
description: Morgan Stanley on Thursday reported first-quarter profit of $1 billion, or 50 cents a share, driven by sold results in wealth management. The profit compared with a loss of $79 million a year earlier and beat estimates. Excluding one-time charges, the firm had a profit of $1.2 billion, or 61 cents a share, which was down from $1.4 billion reported in the first quarter of 2012. The firm is holding a conference call at 10 a.m. to discuss the results.

title: At the Bruins Game, a Time to Rally
description: While everyone rolls out the clich that sporting events after tragedies serve as some sort of healing mechanism, the people involved always know better. No one went to the Bruins game at the TD Garden Wednesday night thinking it would ease the citys pain from Mondays Boston Marathon bombings. But like many clichs, it contains a kernel of truth. People went to the Bruins game Wednesday night because rallying together and doing something normal are at least steps into healings neighborhood. And so they came, and when the national anthem singer, Rene Rancourt, turned the song over to them, they all took a teary step forward. The Bruins had simply provided the gathering point.

title: Poetry Pairing | Nomad Exquisite
description: In advance of Earth Day on Monday, this weeks Poetry Pairing matches Nomad Exquisite by Wallace Stevens with the City Room blog post, A Career Bringing Natural History to Life by James Barron.

title: What Were Reading
description: Liquor.com: A guide to the best old-school tiki bars in the United States, including New Yorks own Jade Island (Staten Island) and King Yum (Queens).  Robert Simonson

title: Anna Quindlen: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of Lots of Candles, Plenty of Cake considers the term experimental fiction to be a synonym for Give me a break.

title: The Gun Report: April 18, 2013
description: Yesterday was dispiriting for the vast majority of Americans who, according to recent polling, want to see expanded background checks on gun sales. But another story that may have been overlooked, between the disappointing Senate outcome and the updates coming out of Boston, was this investigative piece from the Timess National desk about Internet arms sales, dubbed the gun show that never ends. Reporters scoured online ads on Armslist, a self-described firearms marketplace, and found that several people who buy firearms are convicted felons who fail background checks, and many private Internet dealers simply look the other way. Its an unregulated swath of the market thats evaded government oversight, and, in the absence of new gun legislation, will continue to do so.

title: April 18 Updates on Aftermath of Boston Marathon Explosions
Fewer Bank Accounts May Lead to More Savings, Study Finds
description: When it comes to bank accounts, less may be more if your goal is to save money, new research finds.

title: The Senate Acts
description: On Wednesday night, not long after the Senate made clear it would do nothing about gun control, a news release arrived in my in e-mail in which two senators proclaim something the Senate accomplished that very day:

title: Seeing Double at Happy Hour
description: There are a few seats at Center Bar that early in the evening, before it gets too dark, offer one of the best views of New York City. Those are at the southern end of the marble bar, several feet away from the baby grand piano. The bar is not on a high floor, and these particular stools do not showcase nearby Central Park or any other New York landmarks, for that matter.

title: Market Sweep | Deco Darling
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Neighbor vs. Neighbor
description: The Confederate rout at Perryville in October 1862 squelched the Souths large-scale ambitions for the Bluegrass State. Afterward, Kentucky had its own internal proxy civil war, and its citizens had more to fear from one another than from some foreign invader. As the Southern war effort started to show early signs of futility in 1863, an untold number of Kentucky Confederates returned home, just as the Federal Armys recruitment of former slaves disillusioned conservative Unionists. Together, they took out their frustrations on their Loyalist neighbors, some of whom gamely returned fire. In no other state, save perhaps Missouri, did this sort of intimate fighting determine the course of the war more than in Kentucky.

title: Image of the Day: April 18
All Worked Up About Guns
description: As a guy who works with words for a living, I marvel at the gun lobbys gift for turning logic inside out. The bumper-sticker classic: Guns dont kill people, people kill people. The post-Newtown twist: The only thing that stops a bad guy with a gun is a good guy with a gun. And this week we have the latest cynical talking point: Lets not legislate with our emotions.

title: Dean Drummond, Musician and Instrument Maker, Dies at 64
description: Dean Drummond, an imaginative composer and musician whose ensemble, Newband, performed on a combination of standard and newly invented instruments, died on April 13 at a hospital in Princeton, N.J. He was 64 and lived in Montclair, N.J., where he was the director of the Harry Partch Institute at Montclair State University.

title: Deal Fell Through; Painting Lives On
description: In delicate diplomatic moments, art is sometimes called on to serve as ambassador. At just such a point in the Thirty Years War, the Spanish king, Philip IV, dispatched his court artist  Velzquez  to paint an Italian dignitary.

title: The Mercedes Concept GLA Is a Personal Drive-In Theater
description: Mercedes-Benz is going smaller and sportier with its Concept GLA, a compact crossover aimed at younger buyers. The GLA, to be unveiled at the Shanghai Motor Show this weekend, has a long, muscular nose, large wheels and squat haunches. The mechanical bits include a turbocharged 2-liter 4-cylinder gasoline engine, making 208 horsepower, a 7-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission and 4Matic all-wheel drive.

title: The Rewards of Indiscretion
description: Cracking down on M.&A. leaks may only make them more tempting.

title: At Fox News, Less Attention Paid to Gun Debate Than Elsewhere
description: President Obama hadnt finished his first sentence on Wednesday when the Fox News Channel cut away from his Rose Garden remarks about the Senates defeat of a measure that would have expanded background checks for gun buyers.

title: Tribeca Film Festival: Mr. Jones
description: Growing up in a small Minnesota town, the director Karl Mueller had plenty of inspiration for his indie horror movie Mr. Jones, part of this years Midnight Section of the Tribeca Film Festival. The film is set at a remote house where a couple, played by Jon Foster and Sarah Jones, goes up against unseen forces unleashed when they encounter an eccentric artist neighbor known as Mr. Jones (Mark Steger).

title: Donations From Colleagues Identify Vulnerable House Incumbents
description: The Federal Election Commission continues to process campaign finance reports covering activity through March, but one pattern is already clear: which House members are most vulnerable in the eyes of their colleagues.

title: Site of Fertilizer Plant Explosion
description: Map showing some of the buildings damaged in the fertilizer plant explosion.

title: Lets Say They Did Their Research
description: They didnt see eye to eye on everything, but on one pivotal moment the playwright, Tanya Barfield, and her lead actress, Kerry Butler, agreed: When Ms. Butlers character finally receives the photo of the child she hopes to adopt, the scene needed to be extended for a beat, or two, or three.

title: OConnors Regrets
description: To the Editor:

title: What Roosevelt Did
description: To the Editor:

title: Lighting the Candle
description: To the Editor:

title: Analysts Fault Both Sides in Mound-Charging Incident
description: Quirks of the Game is a regular feature on The Timess sports blogs.

title: Submit Your Questions on Immigration Overhaul
description: On Wednesday a bipartisan group of eight senators introduced a sweeping bill to overhaul the immigration system. The 844-page bill includes a pathway to citizenship for immigrants here illegally, new border security measures, a mandatory nationwide system to verify the legal status of new hires, two new guest worker programs and a host of changes to the legal immigration system.

title: Excerpt: 'Orphans'
description: Tom Sturridge and Alec Baldwin in a scene from the Broadway play at the Gerald Schoenfeld Theater.

title: How Circumcision May Stem H.I.V.
description: Circumcision reduces a mans risk of acquiring and transmitting H.I.V. and other sexually transmitted diseases, and now researchers have found a possible explanation: the procedure reduces the quantity and diversity of bacteria at the head of the penis.

title: John Derian for Astier de Villatte
description: Early next month, the latest products of John Derians ongoing collaboration with the French ceramic tableware company Astier de Villatte will be available in the United States. They include a mug and teapot with an image of an eye that was taken from a 19th-century medical book, as well as a plate called Starfish at Night and a serving bowl covered with a coral-like pattern in blue. Unlike the designers famous decoupage plates, these pieces are dishwasher-safe (on the gentle setting). I love the fact that theyre user-friendly, Derian says.

title: New Twitter Service Hopes to Capture Musical Trends
description: Twitters music service is no longer just for Ryan Seacrest.

title: Using Just One Word, Try to Describe Your Career DNA
description: This interview with George Hu, chief operating officer at Salesforce, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: In Fine Print of Spider-Man Settlement, Taymor Comes Out on Top
description: Julie Taymor is back on top.

title: This Weeks Links
description: On Layout and Performance

title: Pitch for a Coding Standard to Track Media Assets and Ads
description: For advertisers and media companies, keeping track and organizing the tonnage of media assets  from video clips to commercials  can be a challenge, particularly online. On Thursday, a media industry organization announced the findings of a two-year study that uses a coding system to monitor these assets, similar to how U.P.C. labels track consumer products from shipping to purchase.

title: Where Finish Line Is a Crime Scene, No Talk of Defeat
description: BOSTON  On marathon day, Boylston Street has always been a place of completion and celebration instead of tragic disruption, a straightaway toward home where medals are hung around satisfied necks, not where tourniquets are tightened around mangled legs.

title: A Color Field Artist
description: Kenneth Noland painted some of the great emblems of the postwar American abstract style called Color Field painting.

title: In Boston, Obama Praises Spirit of City
description: Mourning the victims of the marathon bombings, President Obama spoke at a church service titled Healing Our City at the Cathedral of the Holy Cross in Boston. He also praised the spirit of the city.

title: Officials in Israel Stress Readiness for a Lone Strike on Iran
description: JERUSALEM  With Chuck Hagel scheduled to begin his first visit to Israel as secretary of defense on Sunday, Israeli defense and military officials issued explicit warnings this week that Israel was prepared and had the capability to carry out a lone military strike against Irans nuclear facilities.

title: Vision Festival Announces Its Lineup
description: The 18th edition of the Vision Festival, New Yorks annual celebration built around the lineage of free improvisation and jazzs non-mainstream languages, will take place from June 12 to 16, according to Arts for Art, the festivals producers. As it did last year, the festival will be staged at Roulette, in downtown Brooklyn.

title: Bloomberg Criticizes Senators Who Opposed Broader Background Checks for Gun Buyers
description: A day after the Senate defeated a gun control measure that would have expanded background checks for gun buyers, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg on Thursday sharply criticized the lawmakers who voted against it.

title: Sondheim and Marsalis to Collaborate on Show for City Center
description: Stephen Sondheim and Wynton Marsalis are collaborating on a new show to be staged at the New York City Center next November that will feature jazz interpretations of Mr. Sondheims love songs.

title: Injury Sidetracks Mets DArnaud
description: DENVER  Minor league catcher Travis dArnaud, the Mets top position player prospect, will fly to New York on Friday to see team doctors after fracturing a bone in his foot, General Manager Sandy Alderson said Thursday.

title: Tip of the Week: Sending Huge E-Mail Attachments
description: These days, high-definition video recordings and high-resolution photographs are easier to make with smartphones and other affordable gear. While great for personal creativity, some people may be seeing more of that old This file exceeds the attachment limit message from their e-mail providers when they try to share the files privately with friends. To help users send files larger than the usual 10- to 25-megabyte limit, Google, Yahoo and Microsoft have all melded their Web-based mail with online storage services.

title: The Other Gun Vote
description: The Manchin-Toomey amendment to expand background checks could have passed: It received 54 ayes, and would have received 55 if Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid hadnt voted no for procedural reasons. But the so-called worlds greatest deliberative body agreed to a 60-vote threshold for the gun-safety bill.

title: Obamas Remarks at Boston Service
description: The following is a transcript of President Obamas remarks at an interfaith memorial service for the victims of the Boston Marathon bombing at the Cathedral of the Holy Cross in Boston on Thursday, as provided by the White House.

title: On Whether the Rich Pay Too Little in Taxes
description: On Tuesday Bruce Bartlett mentioned that a majority of Americans believe that high-income people do not pay enough in taxes. That majority, though, has been shrinking over the last couple of decades, according to new data from Gallup.

title: Video: Obama Praises Bostons Spirit
description: Mourning the victims of the marathon bombings, President Obama spoke at a church service titled Healing Our City at the Cathedral of the Holy Cross in Boston. He also praised the spirit of the city. Transcript

title: Whats at Stake in the Fight Over a REIT
description: If you want to see one possible dystopian future for takeovers, you should take a gander at what is going on in the takeover bid for CommonWealth REIT, a real estate investment trust that owns more than 500 office buildings. Its not pretty, and its all a result of CommonWealths claim that all its disputes with shareholders must be arbitrated.

title: Noninvasive Cancer Test Is Effective, Study Finds
description: A new noninvasive screening test can detect most cases of colorectal cancer and also many precancerous polyps, potentially helping to sharply reduce the death toll from the disease, according to results of a study released on Thursday.

title: One on One: Tim Jones of Buzzient, Hunting Chatter on Explosives
description: When two bombs exploded at Mondays Boston Marathon, good Samaritans of all sorts rushed in, from off-duty medical personnel to residents who opened their homes to evacuees. Tim Jones, the chief executive of Buzzient, a Boston-area social media management start-up, felt a similar urge to help, using his companys ability to search Web history on forums, comments and social media, to focus on specific topics  like explosives.

title: Keplers Tally of Planets
description: NASAs Kepler mission has discovered more than 1,000 confirmed planets orbiting distant stars.

title: Two Promising Places to Live, 1,200 Light-Years From Earth
description: Astronomers said Thursday that they had found the most Earth-like worlds yet known in the outer cosmos, a pair of planets that appear capable of supporting life and that orbit a star 1,200 light-years from here, in the northern constellation Lyra.

title: From Humiliation to Appreciation
description: When I go home to Ohio for the holidays, I spend my time as many 20-somethings do: I sleep like a teenager, wander around my bedroom in my prom dress slightly tipsy, thumb through old yearbooks, and laugh, eat and occasionally bicker with my parents. The only not-typical aspect of my visit is that my parents are two women who are no longer together, one of whom used to be a man.

title: Theater Talkback: In the Minority
description: Ill admit, I dont have it as bad as poor little Matilda. For her assorted deviances from the norm, she is called stupid at home and routinely humiliated at school. I, on the other hand, am merely made to feel uncomfortable, alienated, and perhaps a shade indignant on account of my most recent heresy: I didnt much like Matilda the Musical.

title: Last Votes Tallied in Gun Debate, Senate Looks to Move On
